Position Summary

The Data Analyst in the Office of Institutional Research (OIR) supports a culture of data-informed decision making at the college by ensuring system data integrity, creating standard and custom reports and dashboards to facilitate data access and use, fulfilling ad hoc data/research requests, and working collaboratively with colleagues across the college to meet data/research needs.

Essential Job Functions and Responsibilities

Create and maintain data validation error checking reports using Web Intelligence software and/or SQL queries to help ensure reliability and validity of data within the institution’s operational data store.
Create and maintain standard and custom data reports using Web Intelligence and InfoBurst software; distribute clear and visually appealing reports to appropriate institutional personnel.
Create and maintain OIR data files to increase efficiency and accuracy in compliance reporting including validation and/or integration of historical files to meet current data definitions, methodologies, and structures.
Assist in the creation, validation, and maintenance of MCC data dashboards (e.g., Daily Enrollment, Course Outcomes, Persistence, Completion, Fall/Spring Census, Key Performance Metrics).
Support academic and non-academic program review processes by preparing Data Books, maintaining dashboards, and fulfilling custom data requests.
Assist institutional departments in data-related process mapping and setting policies and procedures to help ensure validity of system data.
Assist with testing of college data systems (e.g., Colleague, WebI) to assess potential impacts of system updates and/or modifications.
Provide recommendations for process changes that are necessary to support valid and reliable system data.
Collaborate with relevant faculty, staff, administrators, and external consultants to resolve data issues in the college’s enterprise reporting system (Colleague) and operational data store.
Provide guidance to IT and external consultants to ensure appropriate data tables and fields are integrated into the operational data store to meet the college’s reporting requirements and data needs.
Provide Web Intelligence, PowerBI, ODS, SQL Server Management Studio, and other data systems training to new Office of Institutional Research staff and student workers, as necessary.
Work collaboratively with colleagues across the college to provide training and resources explaining/demonstrating how to access OIR Web Intelligence reports, data dashboards, and other data sources as relevant.
Fulfill internal ad-hoc OIR project requests as assigned.
Maintain security of confidential student and employee data/information.
Maintain clear documentation of definitions, processes, and methodologies for standard and ad hoc projects as well as process documentation related to data integrity and database management.
Work collaboratively with colleagues inside and outside the department to address data/research needs, support a data-informed culture, and meet compliance reporting requirements.
Represent OIR on college committees as assigned.
Assume additional duties as assigned by immediate supervisor.

Required Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited institution with background in data management and analysis, or an equivalent combination of experience and education.
Experience using data-mining tools (e.g., SAP Business Objects Web Intelligence) and query-based languages (e.g., SQL).
One year of work experience in a related area.

Desired Qualifications:

Master’s degree from a regionally accredited institution with a background in data management and analysis, or an equivalent combination of experience and education.
Two or more years of work experience with databases/analytics including direct experience in data analysis using SPSS and/or Excel and large dataset management/reporting using SQL and SAP Web Intelligence.
Two or more years of experience in higher education, preferably at a community college
Experience with relational databases and enterprise reporting systems
Experience managing and analyzing data sets with SPSS, Excel, Web Intelligence, and PowerBI.

Job Description Summary
The Institutional Data Analyst is a member of the Office of Institutional Research and Planning (OIRP), and will provide support to both the OIRP and the Office of Human Resources.


Responsibilities
Responsible to model the University Mission through dedicated job performance, service excellence to constituencies, respectful collaboration and active support of the University’s Mission and Catholic and Lasallian higher education.

Organizes and performs research projects related to strategic planning, including preparing statistical reports, analyzing quantitative measurements, developing assessment tools, and administering – processing survey results. Additional duties include analyzing data utilizing standard statistical methods; reporting for external agencies; and preparing other reports and surveys as necessary.
Prepares reports of real-time data results, presenting and explaining findings to senior leadership and identifies and recommends reasonable short and long-term goals, milestones, and benchmarks for key performance metrics.
Responsible for the support of the human resources information system. Develops, implements, updates, and monitors department systems, recommending and leading process changes where appropriate. Serves as system liaison with the department and the university community.
Collects and compiles HR metrics and data from a variety of sources including the human resource information system (HRIS) and payroll outputs, management and employee surveys, exit interviews, employment records, government labor statistics, competitors’ practices, and other sources to run reports as needed.
Analyzes data and statistics for trends and patterns with attention to recruitment, hiring practices, motivation, turnover, and compliance with employment laws and regulations.
Tracks and analyzes faculty workforce planning goals and position requests.
Assist in the yearly faculty contract process including the training of new college personnel and maintenance of the HR portal.
Conduct salary and classification audits to ensure that jobs are properly compensated and classified as exempt or nonexempt by using CUPA-HR salary data
Ensures compliance with data privacy regulations and best practices.
Assist HR leadership with department and program assessments, data analysis staffing, recruiting, and reporting.
This position works with highly sensitive and confidential information. Must have exceptional attention to detail and accuracy
Troubleshoots, analyzes, detects, identifies and corrects technical problems and deficiencies such as conducting user acceptance testing, and being the primary contact for Banner and Peopleadmin upgrades. Create end user training documents for HRIS when needed.
Responsible to perform other duties as assigned


Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree required, Master’s degree preferred. Must have knowledge of and experience in the use of advanced statistical and research procedures and the ability to use a variety of software programs for administrative applications. Ability to create spreadsheets, reports and perform statistical data analysis from compiled data. Ability to be an effective team member who can foster strong relationships across organizational boundaries. Excellent interpersonal skills including listening, speaking and writing. Effective oral/written communication and an ability to work collaboratively across all divisions to advance the Catholic and Lasallian Mission of the University are required. Must be able to keep highly confidential information. Will consider a combination of skills and experience that demonstrates candidate’s ability to perform functions proficiently.



Preferred Qualifications
Master’s degree; experience in progressively responsible higher education institutional research positions handling data requests.



Essential Duties


Work hours
Full-time

Job Title: Data Analyst, Ads Measurement and Insights
Job Description:
About Attain

Built for consumers and companies, alike. In a world driven by data, we believe consumers and businesses can coexist. Our founders had a vision to empower consumers to leverage their greatest asset—their data—in exchange for modern financial services. Built with this vision in mind, our platform allows consumers to access savings tools, earned wages and rewards without cost or hidden fees. In exchange, they give permission to use their real-time data for research, insights and targeted advertising.

At Attain, your contribution will help us build a more equitable and efficient data sharing ecosystem—whether helping consumers access modern financial services or businesses leverage data to achieve better outcomes. You'll have the opportunity to work directly with hands-on leaders and mission-driven individuals everyday.

About the role

The Data Analyst will serve as a key conduit between our data, and the Sales & Marketing team. We are a data-driven organization, and this role will be at the forefront of delivering and driving partnerships forward for our clients. This role will be responsible for identifying trends for sales collateral and thought leadership while partnering with our Insights Lead & broader B2B Marketing team.

It is highly preferential that this position is based out of one of our offices on a hybrid schedule (Chicago, IL; New York, NY; Redwood City, CA).

You'll be a great fit for the role if

You have an analytical mindset and thrive off of delivering actionable insights, that lead to client satisfaction
You possess strong analytical skills and the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
You are a creative thinker and storyteller who is able to transform complex datasets into impactful stories with clear and actionable insights
You enjoy presenting insights internally & externally which provide 'aha' moments
You are adept at SQL, report writing, and presenting findings
You have the ability to wear multiple hats, are a self-starter, team player, and a curious, lifelong learner

What a typical week might look like

Analyze and interpret sales and marketing data & build presentations around interpretations and analyses
Build consumer, category and/or product insights narratives in Powerpoint and/or Google Slides
Support sales, marketing & insights team on reporting requests
Work with multiple key-stakeholders and serve as a subject matter expert on relevant data, forecasts & trends

Preferred Qualifications

1+ years as a Data Analyst or Insights Analyst in business, advertising or related field
Proficiency in SQL and ability to write efficient and well-structured queries on large data sets
Ability to analyze and interpret data, and subsequently present interpretations in an easily understood format
Extensive experience building consumer, category and/or product insights narratives in Powerpoint and/or Google Slides
Experience using a data visualization tool, such as Tableau or Looker

We're excited to hear from you.

At Attain, we are passionate about finding people to continuously help us grow our organization. We encourage you to apply, even if your experience doesn't match every detail of the job description. If we don't see something that immediately fits, we will keep your resume on file for future opportunities.

Company Name: AUNT MARTHAS HEALTH AND WELLNESS INC
Job Description:
Aunt Martha’s Health and Wellness boldly commits to supporting the well-being of our communities, ensuring equity in access and delivering exceptional care inspired by a culture of innovation. We are taking a responsible approach to creating environments that allow us to do what we do best—provide healthcare and wellness. As a part of our commitment to health and safety, COVID-19 vaccines are required for all employees, as well as all newly hired employees. We require documentation upon hire.


SUMMARY

The Data and Compliance Analyst role is a position within Aunt Martha’s Health & Wellness. The role of the analyst is in the area of child welfare and involves high-level quantitative and qualitative analysis to conduct performance measures, research, and projects. The Analyst plans and implements research activities taking into consideration data availability, resources, and time constraints; other duties include conducting and monitoring research projects in order to ensure high-quality work and process.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following:

Works and collaborates with other stakeholders to determine what data should be collected in order to measure Continuous Quality Improvement in the processing of child welfare cases.

Coordinates and monitors data collection initiatives using allocated program software and tools.

Plans and implements projects, interprets data, and prepares interim and final reports at the direction of and in collaboration with Illinois Department of Children & Family Services, stakeholders and external partners.

Manages child welfare-based databases using allocated program software and tools; and/or other analytic platforms to evaluate and enhance database administration procedures.

Creates and maintains ad hoc and routine performance metrics reports in business intelligence platforms (e.g., Tableau);

Provides staff support through participation in meetings, presenting research results and completing committee assignments.

Constructs methodologically sound designs for obtaining data to measure and evaluate Continuous Quality Improvement in the processing of child welfare cases.

Assist in the response to and fulfillment of public and government agency requests for data and information.

Attends conferences, reviews literature and investigates new techniques in program analysis and evaluation.

Research best practices in child welfare and assists with their implementation; and

Performs related duties as required.


Trauma Informed Care

All employees are expected to use a trauma informed approach to all of their work duties that include the 5 "Ss". This approach sets a high priority for staff and client Safety (physical and emotional safety), Self-regulation (ability to manage one's own emotions so they don't interfere with the helping process, and Supportiveness (building relationships with clients that are respectful and caring) so that staff can see the Strengths of all the clients/patients and do the necessary Self-care to resolve any secondary stress reactions from the job.


QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required


EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited degree granting college or university in social work, sociology, psychology, criminology, criminal justice, mathematics, statistics, or social science related field; Advanced degree or graduate work is preferred, but not required.

Knowledge of and experience writing syntax or code in SPSS, Stata, R, or a similar statistical programming package.

Experience cleaning, analyzing, and aggregating transactional data, hierarchical data, or a similar one-to-many data model.

Experience developing reports and dashboards in Tableau or a similar business intelligence tool.

Experience preparing technical documentation for reports and queries developed.

Experience involving data collection, research, analysis planning and report writing.

Knowledge of data collection and statistical analysis procedures; policy analysis and program evaluation; project management and reporting.

Experience working directly with managers, users and others.

Ability to use data to diagnose problems and drive enhancements and efficiencies in departmental operations.

Ability to communicate technical information to non-technical people effectively; and

Experience in and knowledge of Massachusetts child welfare laws preferred.


OTHER QUALIFICATIONS

Current driver's license.

Current auto insurance.

Clear driving record.

The ability to critically think, work well under stress and work well in crisis-oriented situations.

The ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality.


Aunt Martha’s is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

Position Overview:

The Data Analyst position is responsible for the analysis and processing of raw client data. Responsibilities include working with SQL server to process raw client data into Foresight’s standard database schema, managing data cleaning/QA, and building custom reporting queries for internal analysis. This role is also expected to work cross-functionally with the client service and analytics teams to ensure that clients datasets are complete and accurate. Additionally, this role assists with creating the initial insights for a given client by providing an understanding of a client’s dataset.


Qualities Key for Success:

Driver for Results: Hard Worker. Focuses energy on high impact tasks in a sometimes ambiguous and multi-tasked setting. Ability to prioritize, execute, and deliver.
Dig Deeper: High degree of intellectual curiosity. Constantly strives to find the best solution to complicated business problems. Doesn’t stop at ‘good enough’ and gets immersed in the client’s business.
Domain Expertise: Familiarity with Consumer-Packaged Goods (CPG) datasets such as point of sales and marketing data. Ability to use business logic to manipulate client specific datasets into the Foresight standard. Familiarity with relational database development and data warehousing.
Teamwork: Team player able to build effective and productive working relationships with all cross-functional disciplines and senior leadership. Strong empathetic and authentic disposition, willing to do whatever it takes to deliver against our goals.
Communication: Storyteller. Capable of communication both internally and with external clients to better understand the datasets that they are working with. Can effectively communicate concerns found within a dataset.

What We Need in You

Bachelor’s Degree in marketing, statistics, computer science or a related field
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills
High levels of self-motivation, intellectual curiosity, and attention to detail
Ability to handle multiple, complex projects in a deadline-driven environment
Demonstrated skill working with relational database systems (SQL Server)
Familiarity with ETL building systems such as SSIS or Alteryx
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau
Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint)

About Foresight ROI.

Chervon is one of the world’s largest power tool and lawn and garden equipment manufacturers with a rich history of innovation. Chervon’s commitment to build a better world by building better tools is evident in the products we manufacture and our green approach to manufacturing. We focus on hand-held portable power tools, stationary bench tools, laser and electronic equipment and outdoor power equipment. With world-class R&D, manufacturing, design, marketing, sales, and service teams throughout the world, we do it all.

About Our Opportunity

As a Master Data Analyst at Chervon NA, you will be responsible for maintaining and analyzing master data related to our supply chain processes. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability, enabling us to make informed decisions and drive operational efficiency.

Job Responsibilities

Create master data flow and business process flowcharts.
Assist with customer Onboarding/setup and maintenance in our logistical systems including routing guides and 3PL communications.
Analyze logistics data to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities for process improvement.
Generate reports and monitor Service Level Agreement analytics.
Identifying and participating in or leading process improvement initiatives.
Troubleshooting Oracle execution problems, identifying root causes, and implementing solutions.
Responsible for support of Customer Chargeback Resolutions.
Collaborate with IT and Business Systems to ensure alignment of master data rules.
Conduct regular data audits and identify and resolve data discrepancies or issues with SAP systems.
Create and maintain master data templates and guidelines to facilitate accurate and consistent data entry.
Assists in the creation, application and implementation of Routing Guides and other customer on-boarding documentation.
Support sales revenue recognition by correcting transaction failures of outbound Pick and Ship Confirmation activities across all Distribution Centers.

Competencies

Proficient in Microsoft Office products: Excel (including pivot tables), Word, Outlook and PowerPoint.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and Methodology.
Familiarity with data management and governance practices.
Excellent problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
Strong communication and collaboration abilities.
Attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy.


Supervisory Responsibility

This position does not have supervisory responsibility.


Travel

Description:

REPORTS TO: Director of Information Services

STATUS: Exempt, salaried, full-time

LOCATION: Chicago, Illinois


Working at All Chicago:

All Chicago’s mission is to unite our community and resources to provide solutions that ensure and sustain the stability of home. On any given night, nearly 6,000 Chicagoans do not have a place to call home. These are our neighbors and together we can ensure that we all have stable homes.

All Chicago prevents and ends homelessness through emergency financial assistance, community partnerships, data analytics, and training and research. We strengthen our community’s collective efforts to prevent and end homelessness, guided by a vision of impact, influence, and inspiration. As our name implies, All Chicago brings together homeless service providers, non-profit partners, donors, and people with the lived experience of homelessness in a strategic effort to make homelessness history in Chicago.

We bring a sense of collaboration to our work and actively seek solutions through partnership. Come work with passionate, like-minded colleagues in a supportive environment as we help end homelessness. Learn more at www.allchicago.org.

POSITION SUMMARY:

The Data Analyst plays an essential role in reviewing, understanding, and processing data from multiple data sources to develop reports, data requests, and data transformations. This position works on an interdisciplinary team focused on transforming data into reports, data extracts, dashboards, and other useful representations. In addition, this position will represent the team in project team meetings that may comprise of external stakeholders and provide input into tools, methodologies, and other topics that enhance the efficiency and usability of the data.

An ideal candidate will have strong data analysis and problem-solving skills for delivering high quality solutions on time and on budget. The Data Analyst will analyze current implementation and define best practices or areas to improve business processes. Day to day activities will include working closely with project leads, analysts, infrastructure, and database staff to ensure project activities are aligned with architectural and functional objectives.


RESPONSIBILITIES:

Data analysis, database administration, reporting and data request programming/development (approx. 80%)

Act as primary resource for all data sources, the relationships among them, and correct usage of each
Collaborate with others to ensure clarity and correctness of requirements and specifications
Analyze data sources to design and maintain data infrastructure that is pertinent and correct for the functions and requests it must serve, and perform vetting and QA on the data to ensure its accuracy
Create data sources, tables, spreadsheets, programs, processes, and data flows to support custom reporting and data extract requests
Analyze and problem solve reporting issues within the current system as they relate to the workflow implementation, integration and management of data
Create and maintain scripts to generate reports and data extracts
Create and maintain scripts and other mechanisms to automate generation and distribution of results
Analyze and implement methodologies for matching data from multiple sources
Develop and maintain data dashboards
Provide administrative and operational support for SQL and other reporting infrastructure

Relationship building (approx. 15%)

Work closely with internal and external users and project leads to understand reporting challenges and offer solutions.
Communicate effectively with non-technical people, effectively gathering their business issues and requirements.
Participate and, in some cases, lead data related meetings with both internal and external teams.
Work closely with other members of the team to develop cross-functional understanding and solutions.
Review documentation to ensure clarity across functions.

Other tasks (approx. 5%)

Attend training, seminars and conferences when needed or required.
Stay current in technologies used and/or needed by the agency to ensure best use of available tools.
Actively participate in staff and team meetings
Other duties as assigned.
Requirements:

SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:

Minimum of Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems, Computing, Statistics or related fields.
2-3 years programming and report-writing experience in a job-related field.
Proficiency in SQL scripting in construction of data infrastructure, reports, extracts, and other results
Strong familiarity with Python, Excel macros, and MS VBA scripting
High-level of knowledge and competency in relational database management systems.
Experience with creating and maintaining technical documentation.
Good working knowledge/skills with Microsoft Office products including, but not limited to, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook and Access
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication skills, including the ability to convey information in a clear and concise manner to groups with varying levels of technical expertise
Self-motivated with the ability to prioritize, meet deadlines and manage changing priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Proven ability to be flexible and work hard, both independently and in a team environment.
Willingness to work occasionally outside of normal business hours and to take on more responsibilities as assigned
A strong work ethic, integrity and the highest ethical standards are expected.
This position may require out-of-state travel approximately two times a year.
Passion for inclusivity and diversity, and interest in being part of a multicultural team.

WORK ENVIRONMENT:

All Chicago's normal business hours are 9am to 5pm. We are currently working entirely remotely and will transition to a hybrid remote/in-office work setting in the future. We will consider accommodations.
All Chicago values a diverse workplace and strongly encourages women, people of color, LGBTQ individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply. All Chicago is an equal opportunity employer and seeks to employ qualified individuals based on individual merit. All Chicago does not discriminate against any individual with respect to the terms and conditions of employment based on that individual’s race, sex, age, religion, color, national origin, disability, genetic information, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, housing status, or any other non-merit factor protected under state, local or federal laws. Equal Employment Opportunity applies to all personnel actions such as recruiting, hiring, compensation, benefits, promotions, training, transfer, termination, and opportunities for training. All Chicago is committed to a fair and equitable workplace where everyone is a respected and valued member of the team.

COMPENSATION:

Salary is $53,730 - $76,440, commensurate with experience. Comprehensive benefits package (with some employee contributions) includes medical, dental, vision insurance, and disability. Employer-matched retirement plan. Generous paid leave.

About Palm Tree:

Join an elite team of respected experts who approach the needs of M&A differently, in a demanding, yet supportive and collaborative culture. Founded in 2010, Palm Tree is the modern M&A advisor. We are the single source for integrated investment banking and financial consulting services that enable businesses to better prepare for and execute on transactions, transitions, and transformations.

Palm Tree approaches strategic events from the perspectives of owners and operators. Our processes and deliverables enable our clients to make critical business decisions efficiently and to create value in strategic events. Strategic events include mergers, acquisitions, divestitures, carve-outs, recapitalizations, refinancings, restructurings, and growth and performance improvement initiatives.

We were born out of private equity. It gives us the resilience, flexibility, and perspective of owners and operators. Our team comes from private equity, Big-4 accounting, investment banking, and business operations experience. We understand the time-sensitive, uncompromising demands of M&A to deliver advantageous outcomes for private equity firms and business operators alike.


What we offer:

Accelerated, merit-based career advancement compared with more rigid, bureaucratic firms
An opportunity to have an impact with a rapidly scaling, entrepreneurial, collaborative culture centered on growing people’s skills inside of fast-paced M&A environments
Working with top private equity firms, M&A advisors, and corporations
Experience with multiple facets of M&A and investment banking projects that require engagement and communication at all levels of the organization
A principled culture that lives its core values through the actions of the firm and its individuals
High-performing yet supportive and interconnected teams throughout the organization
Highly competitive salary, bonus, and benefits structure
A flexible, hybrid work environment with access to open office plans in strategic markets


Who we are seeking:

Experienced Management Consultants with expertise in business intelligence, analytics and insights, data management, and financial data visualization
Experienced corporate professionals with similar experience as an internal business partner


About the position:

As part of Palm Tree’s recent growth, we are adding staff to build our growing Data & BI practice. The Associate position has unlimited growth potential over time.


Primary Responsibilities & Duties:

Analytical Proficiency
Demonstrate proficiency in conducting thorough analysis of large datasets, employing advanced techniques to identify meaningful trends, patterns, and insights.
Utilize expertise to extract valuable information that drives informed decision-making and strategic planning.
Dashboard Development and Maintenance
Take charge of developing and maintaining visually appealing and interactive Power BI dashboards and reports.
Leverage creativity and technical skills to transform complex data into meaningful visualizations communicating key metrics and performance indicators to stakeholders.
Client Engagement and Requirements Gathering
Exhibit strong leadership and communication skills as you lead requirement-gathering sessions with clients.
Effectively elicit and document their needs, translating them into actionable project objectives and deliverables.
Your ability to navigate client relationships and manage expectations will be key in ensuring successful outcomes.
SQL Query Development
Proficiency in SQL to develop precise and efficient queries for dashboard creation.
Employ an understanding of database structures and data manipulation techniques to retrieve and transform relevant data.

Internal & Growth Expectations:

Proficiently convey development progress, challenges, and strategic insights to clients and internal stakeholders through clear and concise communication channels. Ensure effective transmission of information to foster collaboration and alignment between teams.
Demonstrate exceptional attention to detail when delivering weekly updates to clients, meticulously capturing, and reporting on key project milestones, accomplishments, and any notable issues or concerns. Maintain a high standard of accuracy and thoroughness in all client communications.
Possess hands-on experience with popular project management software such as Asana, Jira, Monday.com, or similar platforms. Leverage your familiarity with these tools to effectively organize and track project tasks, timelines, and resources. Utilize their functionalities to enhance collaboration, streamline workflows, and facilitate seamless project execution.
Formulate and present strategic initiatives to clients throughout the course of the engagement, demonstrating ability to think critically and develop innovative solutions. Collaborate closely with clients to understand their goals, challenges, and opportunities, and proactively propose strategies that align with their business objectives.
Display self-sufficiency and autonomy in a remote work environment, effectively managing your tasks and responsibilities without constant supervision. Keep internal leads updated on progress, milestones, and outcomes to ensure transparent communication and alignment. Utilize appropriate communication tools and platforms to maintain regular and proactive engagement with the team.


Qualifications & Requirements:

This position requires at least 4-6 years of experience in a blended finance/IT environment. Top candidates will have expertise in Excel, SQL, Python, Power BI, Tableau, Redshift, Azure, etc.

Other qualities we look for in a candidate:

Is dedicated to delivering high-quality work products and always pushing themselves to do their best
Is committed to a “team first” atmosphere and has the will to support their teammates and learn from those around them in each engagement
Is proactive, motivated, and has a self-starter attitude with a desire to improve continuously
Has an inquisitive personality that enjoys puzzles, combining strong analytical and critical thinking skills with attention to detail
Has an ability to “stay cool” under pressure and thrive in demanding work environments
Has excellent written, presentation, leadership, and interpersonal communication skills
Is highly organized with strong project management skills


Our Commitment to Diversity, Inclusion, Equity, & Access

Our people are our greatest asset.

As skilled professionals faced with complex challenges, we value unique and creative ideas that help us grow stronger, smarter, and more adaptable for tomorrow. At Palm Tree, we view inclusion, diversity, equity, and access as critical to achieving excellence and belonging to foster an authentic culture where creative solutions flourish.

We believe that our work for clients and the well-being of our company are strengthened by the diversity of our people. We are committed to developing a new paradigm to create a diverse and inclusive financial services firm of the future. Together, we strive to create an environment that values diversity, promotes an inclusive culture, and establishes a profound sense of belonging for each team member.


Compensation:

The Associate position offers a base salary of $125k with a top-of-industry performance-based bonus. In addition, Palm Tree offers medical, dental, and vision premium coverage, a competitive 401k program, an unlimited paid time off (PTO) policy (no formalized limits; take as needed), a robust maternity/paternity leave program, and many other fringe benefits.

Overview:
Who We Are:

National Louis is a 135+ year old university that has been grounded in the values of innovation, access, excellence, and equity from its inception. As an institution we believe in providing access to educational opportunity and that education is our greatest lever for social and economic mobility. We are a student-focused community that is committed to continuous improvement and asks how do we become more “student ready” so that we may better serve our students. We believe that through education we are able to empower change and build healthy communities. Our community works hard in the service of students and supports one another like a family.

As our external environment changes, our employees are provided the opportunities and tools needed to grow both personally and professionally to remain successful. NLU employees and dependents are offered a wide range of benefits, including but not limited to, Health Insurance benefits, Retirement benefits, Paid Time Off and Educational Benefits.

What You Will Do:

The Data Analyst will be responsible for developing and executing on analyses and reporting to drive efficient and effective use of data for a wide variety of data initiatives and requests throughout the university. This position will work in collaboration with team members in the department to execute on the data strategy for the Strategic Data Center and wider university strategic initiatives. This position will engage in various aspects of data collection, cleaning, analysis, metrics, visualizations, documentation, and presentations. The data analyst will work to insure scalability, sustainability, and integrity within NLU data practices and policies. This position will also be involved in knowing and carrying out NLU data governance policy and procedure.
Essential Responsibilities:
Complete data requests and produce various reports and dashboards in a variety of formats (Power BI, Tableau, Excel, PowerPoint, Word, etc.)
Conduct strategic analyses by querying, cleaning, manipulating, interpreting, visualizing, and presenting data using statistical techniques
Full fill various adhoc data requests
In collaboration with various University stakeholders, map data flows, business processes, and perform gap analysis


Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in Data Science, Education, Statistics, Social Work, Public Policy, Business or related field

Minimum of one year of experience manipulating large data sets with analytical software and/or coding languages (R, SQL, SAS, etc.)
At least one year of building data reports, dashboards, documentation and presenting findings to those inside and outside of the department
Minimum of one year of experience gathering and understanding data request specifications and delivering data products
Minimum of one year of experience working with data visualization/analytical software (i.e. Power BI, Tableau, SAS, etc.)
Analytical Thinking - Breaks down problems and issues into sub-components and then assesses the costs, benefits and risks of various options prior to selecting a particular approach.
Project Management - Manages each stage of a project to ensure that commitments are met in a manner that is timely and within budget. Clearly defines roles and responsibilities, determines necessary resources, and monitors project performance through appropriate systems and procedures.
Technical Credibility - Has achieved credibility related to technical standards and procedures. Can describe the rationale for standards and procedures and serves as a positive role model when it comes to following safety practices and equipment procedures. Participates on special committees and other initiatives that enhance knowledge and awareness of safety issues.
Innovative Thinking - Looks out for new and innovative approaches that will improve efficiency. Embraces and champions new ideas and encourages others to do likewise. Recognizes and rewards people and teams who are creative and innovative.
NLU Inclusion Statement:

National Louis University is deeply committed to serving its community, advancing access and equity, and ensuring that all individuals are welcomed and valued. We are dedicated to fostering a culture where diversity, equity, and inclusion remain at the core of who we are. These are more than just words to us: they are truly a way of life for the NLU community. Our goal is to inspire and empower NLU employees and community members to cultivate an environment where we collectively focus on uplifting and advancing our institutional culture.

Leaf Trade is the leading wholesale marketplace between licensed growers, processors, and retailers in the highly regulated cannabis markets. Leaf Trade streamlines order management by providing an easy e-commerce platform, inventory management, order fulfillment, and accounting tool with several integration partners. We help enterprise companies save time and help grow their cannabis business.
Headquartered in Chicago, with remote work available, Leaf Trade is partnered with some of the largest multi-state cannabis operators and operates in nearly 25 states. To learn more about Leaf Trade, visit www.leaftrade.com
Leaf Trade is in a unique position to leave a large footprint in the emerging cannabis industry. As an early hire of a fast growing company, the individual should have a strong entrepreneurial spirit and a whatever-it-takes mentality to help the company grow quickly and sustainably.

About the Role Leaf Trade is hiring a Senior Data Analyst to own internal and external BI reporting and manage data streams across our quickly growing business. You will report to senior management and work closely with our data science team.
The ideal candidate is curious, business-minded, and results oriented. You will own all internal and external reporting and work with every department to give them visibility into our data. You will also work directly with customers and other external stakeholders, acting as their guide to our customer-facing analytics.
Additionally, you will lead the effort to develop and maintain scalable data pipelines to extract, load, and transform data from various sources. You will contribute to the development of our data strategy and architecture to ensure data quality and optimal data processes.
Key Responsibilities
Be the primary resource for internal and external business intelligence and reporting needs, and provide clear visibility into the company's KPI's.
Respond quickly to ad-hoc reporting requests from internal and external stakeholders.
Develop API pipelines from multiple sources
Implement and maintain custom data integration processes
Assist in building and maintaining reporting data sources, and work with the data science and engineering teams to enhance data availability and readiness.
Develop a detailed understanding of the Company, its products and services, its markets and its internal organization in order to be able to identify opportunities to increase revenue and profit.
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Analytics, Statistics or relevant field with 2-4 years of experience in analytics related field
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Proficient in SQL and Python
Project Management experience with end-to-end ownership of projects
Must have experience working with a variety of visualization tools; Tableau required - QuickSight a plus
Experience with Airflow and DBT
You Should:
Be highly analytical with an aptitude in problem solving
Have strong communication skills
Be comfortable speaking with and writing to customers and coworkers
Be a team player, but also thrive working autonomously
Have the ability to multitask and prioritize your own workload
Maintain an acute attention to detail
Knowledge of the cannabis industry is a plus, NOT required
Benefits
Competitive salary and meaningful equity
Fast growth environment with potential for quick upward mobility
Vibrant company culture within a casual environment
Health insurance & benefits
401K
Paid parental leave
Unlimited PTO
Hybrid and flexible remote work schedule

Ability to work independently and manage several projects simultaneously while maintaining a focus on results.

JOB DESCRIPTION

As aSenior Business Operations Analyst(AKA: Sr. Business Analyst),you will play a vital role in supporting the COO and VP of Revenue in driving operational excellence and revenue growth within Equity Residential.

This position requires a strong analytical mindset, exceptional problem solving abilities, and a deep understanding of business operations. You will be responsible for analyzing data, identifying trends, and providing and presenting strategic insights that will enable data driven decision-making. We are looking for a proactive professional with a strong analytical and collaborative mindset, excellent organizational and communication skills, and an interest in Operations. As a Senior BusinessAnalyst, you will have regular interactions with stakeholders and functional business unit leaders and will have the opportunity to impact important go-forward business decisions. Each day will be unique, requiring an ability to think strategically and on your feet, be creative, take initiative, and employ a diverse set of skills.

WHO YOU ARE

Knowledgeable, Analytical, and Solution-Oriented.
Without a doubt, you ve got strong quantitative skills and are comfortable analyzing large data sets, spotting trends and patterns, and synthesizing relevant observations.
Intellectually Curious.
You are resourceful, ask smart questions, and regularly seek to understand.You're inherently interested in the "why" so that you can identify opportunities that represent unconventional solutions to the problems you are trying to solve.
Strong Communicator.
Your writing and speaking skills are concise, articulate, and effective, providing an ability to interact with all levels/various teams across the organization, be understood, and develop trust and rapport within the organization. You are facile with creating and communicating a clear project plan, tracking progress, and keeping your business partners in the loop along the way.
Technologically Savvy.
Microsoft Excel is a basic tool to you that you know like the back of your hand. You also have a strong skill set in Python, SQL, and data visualization tools and techniques.
A Trusted Team Player.
You enjoy partnering with others and build constructive working relationships that foster the collaboration necessary to deliver great results. You are accountable to your teammates and follow through on commitments.
Organized and Confident.
You are flexible, composed, and able to prioritize multiple tasks and deadlines simultaneously, while confidently interacting with a variety of individuals, across all levels of the organization. You handle pressure well and do so with confidence.

WHAT YOU LL DO

Perform moderate to complex research and analyses
by gathering data from a variety of sources, which may include internal operational and financial data (as well as relevant external data), coupled with feedback from business partners, in order to identify trends, patterns, gaps and insights.

, as well as recommendations.

Track, analyze, and report on KPIs
used to determine operational performance, staffing needs, productivity, or other measures deemed valuable to the business.

Identify and utilize resources

to aid on the analysis of performance.

to the COO and VP of Revenue, providing valuable insights and recommendations to support strategic decision-making.

to drive cross functional initiatives that deliver impactful results.
Ask critical questions
, create alternatives, react to changes in business conditions,

PrimaryLocation Chicago, IL, United States ABOUT THE TEAM As a Senior Business Operations Analyst (AKA: Sr. Business Analyst), you will play a vital role in supporting the COO and VP of Revenue in driving operational excellence and revenue growth within Equity Residential.

Role – Senior Financial Analyst
Hybrid on-site schedule (3 days a week most weeks)




Summary of the Senior Financial Analyst Job Opening

The Senior Financial Analyst exercises discretion and independent judgment while working under the general direction of the Financial Reporting & Budgeting Manager and according to established firm policies and procedures. The Senior Financial Analyst prepares reporting of actual and budget financial activity of the firm by performing essential duties personally or through delegation/supervision of subordinates. The Senior Financial Analyst maintains professionalism and strict confidentiality in all client and firm matters.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include, but may not be limited to, the following. Other duties may be requested and/or assigned. Essential functions are primary job duties that an individual must be able to perform successfully with or without a reasonable accommodation. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Prepare, review and distribute the firm’s monthly modified cash basis financial reporting (e.g., Flash and Financial Overview). Reporting includes income statement and other key performance metrics (billable hours, headcount, attorney productivity, etc.). Reporting contains relevant variance analysis to budget, forecast and prior year activity.
Prepare, review and distribute the legal department, practice group and office reporting; while similar, the firm’s monthly reporting has a greater focus on key performance metrics. Reporting contains relevant variance analysis to budget, forecast and prior year activity.
Prepare, review and distribute the financial reporting to various business professional chiefs. Reporting is tailored to the specific focus on the business professional chief with different key performance metrics than legal and practice group leaders. Reporting contains relevant variance analysis to budget, forecast and prior year activity.
Participate in the preparation and review of the modified cash basis annual operating and capital expenditure budget, including income statement and other key performance metrics to support the revenue, expense and capital expenditures. Budgeting includes preparation for business professional chiefs, legal department heads and practice group leaders. This process includes multiple versions until approved by the Director of Financial Reporting & Budgeting, the CFO, COO, CEO and Chairman with final budget approval by the Executive Committee and Board.
Assist in the preparation of the firm’s quarterly forecasts identifying YTD and projected variances to annual budget for revenue, expenses and related key performance metrics. This process includes multiple versions until approved by the Director of Financial Reporting & Budgeting, CFO, COO, CEO and Chairman with final budget approval by the Executive Committee and Board.
Preparation of various analyses with recommendations for solutions as questions and issues from firm management and other stakeholders as they relate to financial reporting and budgeting.
Assist in the preparation of various surveys utilized in the legal industry.
Participate in the preparation of the periodic financial presentations, working closely with the Director of Financial Reporting & Budgeting, CFO, COO and other firm leaders.
Partake in the review of various system-generated financial reports, identifying issues where information is inconsistent and troubleshoot for root cause to ensure accuracy of financial information.
Participate in the design of new reports as requested by firm management.
Participate in the implementation of budget software to support annual budget and forecast process.
Assist in the implementation of reporting/database software to support monthly and periodic reporting.
Participate systems upgrades, leading selected work streams for testing and verification of financial information used in financial reporting.
Perform complex calculations in support of essential duties and responsibilities.
Complete special projects as requested and furnish related information and reports as needed.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or equivalent and three or more years of related experience working within an Am Law 100 law firm is required.
Computer proficient with knowledge and understanding of Accounting systems (CMS/Aderant or Elite are required), Excel, Power Point, Outlook and MS Word. Experience and understanding of Iridium or other similar budgeting and reporting software.
Superior interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills. Ability to communicate with courtesy and diplomacy, efficiently follow written and verbal instructions, provide information, and maintain effective relationships with a diverse group of attorneys, clients, staff and outside contacts.
Superior analytical skills requiring an aptitude for detail, precision, and logic with comprehensive knowledge of complex accounting principles and practices in order to conduct detailed analysis of accounting operations, general ledger accounts, balance sheet and income statement activity and budget variations.
Exhibit initiative and critical-thinking skills in exercising independent judgment and making decisions in order to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced, deadline-driven, detail-oriented work environment.
Ability to identify and analyze complex accounting/financial issues and problems and to recommend and implement solutions. Proactive with excellent troubleshooting, problem resolution, and follow-through skills.
Strong organizational skills including record keeping, data collection, and system information. Ability to compile and analyze data and furnish concise, detailed information in report format, written correspondence, e?mail, or verbally.
Ability to perform complex mathematical calculations and apply mathematical concepts when computing, reconciling balances, verifying numerical data, preparing various accounting reports, providing back-up assistance and support in performing all aspects of accounting operations and participating in preparation of the budget.

Job Title: Insurance Policy - Claims Data Warehouse Analyst
Job Description:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce's client, one of the fastest growing insurance companies, is seeking a remote Insurance Policy & Claims Lead Data Warehouse Analyst/Data Architect from an Informatica Snowflake AWS Development Environment that should have knowledge of data vault, data mart, and data lake principles. Overall, the team is looking for seasoned help with their data modernization project. This is a minimum of a 6-month contract role, that could run into 2025. This is a remote role working in the Central or Eastern Time Zone, but the client is open to candidates that live near Chicago, IL; Dallas, TX; Birmingham, AL; and/or Jacksonville, FL to be on site if they preferred.

Summary:
The Lead Data Analyst/Data Architect will be working closely with the Data Modernization project team to play a vital role in the delivery of P&C data vault and analytical datamarts, lead design, and implementation of data pipelines, and represent the project team in data-centric technology initiatives.

Responsibilities:

Technical lead/lead developer in the design and delivery of P&C data vault and analytical datamarts
The Lead Data Analyst/Data Architect establishes themselves as a subject matter expert that understands the business and delivers data & analytics solutions that drive business outcomes
Partner closely with Business's BA/DA team to review their requirements, the IT Data Architecture Team to ensure agreement in Design/Solution and the Development teams (Internal & 3rd Party) to ensure alignment with enterprise data strategy and roadmap
As a Lead Data Analyst/Data Architect, you will mentor and develop new team members
REQUIREMENTS:

10+ years (specifically) of experience in the Insurance data space
3+ years of experience as a Lead Data Analyst and/or Data Architect supporting design and solutions
2+ years of experience in the P&C insurance industry as a Data Architect or lead technical resource - key is understanding of Policy and Claims Data Model Structures
Several years of experience developing data structures, ETL processes, and data preparation workflows
Significant insurance experience/knowledge
Demonstrated expertise with Data Vault concepts
Demonstrated knowledge of data vault, data mart, and data lake principles
Expert proficiency in data modeling, IICS and SQL
Working knowledge with Snowflake and AWS environments
Ability to curate and deliver robust data engineering solutions, adhering to data governance and architectural standards

This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

Ecentria has a great opportunity for a Business Operations Data Analyst. This is an excellent chance to feel the heartbeat of one of the world's largest and most data-driven online retailers, and make an impact on the company success, by analyzing operational and financial performance of the company, and providing actionable suggestions.
In this role, you will utilize advanced SQL skills, and apply statistical analysis to all aspects of Ecommerce business, as well as create advanced reports and data models using MS BI stack, to provide actionable insights, and see a direct link between your work and company growth. The role will be responsible for developing operational targets, KPIs, and revenue forecasts for a variety of business units and teams. The role is highly cross-functional and will require coordination across several departments such as Supply Chain Management, Marketing, Operations, and others. This role conducts a wide range of business analysis, defines and communicates the appropriate metrics that are needed to accurately and objectively measure business performance. Role activities may include interpreting financial trends, identifying operational deviations from expected performance and reporting results to various departments within the organization. This role will challenge the candidate to understand and contribute to many facets of the company including business analytics, risk and revenue forecasting, data management, and executive reporting.
Ecentria is a leading internet retailer devoted to the passions and professions of our customers. For over fifteen years, we have built a cutting-edge platform that powers ecommerce heavyweights such as OpticsPlanet.com and Dvor.com. We are experiencing a new phase of explosive growth and opportunity, and that means adding more talented and passionate individuals to our existing diverse and professional team. Our casual, fast-paced environment has seen us recognized as one of the "100 Best Companies to Work For" by the Chicago Tribune! In addition to a challenging position, employees at all levels can find extensive opportunities for advancement and career growth, and full-time employees enjoy a popular set of benefits and perks. Ecentria is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Primary Duties and Responsibilities
Applying knowledge in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers. Build/maintain reports, dashboards, and metrics.
Performing statistical analyses on large data sets to provide actionable insights to operations and product teams.
Analyzing current business performance and building statistical models to extrapolate current trends into forward-looking forecasts.
Conducting analysis of design and development of business systems.
Developing methods to analyze market trends, pricing, product offerings and customer experiences.
Reconciling differences and inconsistencies in the financial and operational data within the various corporate systems.
Providing leadership in the development, implementation and ongoing management of all key performance indicators (KPIs) and reporting capabilities for assigned operational areas. Using insights to challenge the organization to be more efficient and cost effective.
Running projects to implement business logic for the processes that could be automated
Researching, analyzing, and explaining current and past activity, expected trends, and potential effect of the change made. Presenting and supporting findings and recommendations to various management levels within the organization.
Qualifications, Skills and Requirements
The ideal candidate will have a demonstrated interest in data and technology, work well independently, and be highly analytical.
BA/BS in Statistics, Computer Science, Applied Math, Physics, or other technical field is preferred.
Understanding of Ecommerce, Supply Chain Management, Finance and Marketing basics.
Experience utilizing SQL.
Advanced MS Excel skills.
Experience solving analytical problem using statistical / quantitative approaches.
Experience with Microsoft BI tools is a plus.
Experience in PHP, JavaScript, and HTML is a plus.
This is a remote/work-from-home role. You must reside in one of the following states/locations: Alaska, Arkansas, Arizona, District of Columbia, Delaware, Florida, Georgia, Iowa, Idaho, Illinois, Indiana, Kansas, Kentucky, Maryland, Maine, Minnesota, Mississippi, Montana, North Dakota, Nebraska, New Hampshire, New Mexico, Nevada, Ohio, Oklahoma, Oregon, Rhode Island, South Carolina, South Dakota, Texas, Utah, Virginia, Vermont, Washington, Wisconsin, West Virginia, or Wyoming. Note, this list of states/locations is subject to change.

The Company does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Ecentria and its affiliates are Drug Free Workplaces.

Bring your heart to CVS Health. Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. This purpose guides our commitment to deliver enhanced human-centric health care for a rapidly changing world. Anchored in our brand — with heart at its center — our purpose sends a personal message that how we deliver our services is just as important as what we deliver.

Our Heart At Work Behaviors™ support this purpose. We want everyone who works at CVS Health to feel empowered by the role they play in transforming our culture and accelerating our ability to innovate and deliver solutions to make health care more personal, convenient and affordable.

This is a full time, hybrid position.

Position Summary

The Trade Finance Data Analyst is part of a small team that is responsible for design, implementation, and support of the trade finance data model. This role will be assisting with data migration, quality control and governance activities. You will play a crucial role in designing and building of a centralized data mart by combining several existing data sources. This allows the opportunity to support and work alongside the Commercial, Medicare Part D, Specialty, and ZINC Health Services Trade Relations teams.

Key role aspects include:

Analyze, interpret, understand, and/or triage complex data and reporting requests
Conduct data quality review and issue root cause analysis and resolution
Design, test, implement and maintain ETL procedures, that support large volumes of data.
Collaborate with technical and non-technical audiences to ensure strong data quality
Supporting Management in the development and maintenance of ad-hoc reporting and analysis
Providing analytic support to the Trade Relations, Underwriting Analytics, and Formulary departments
The candidate should have a strong passion for data integrity with an eye for detail, but also be in tune with the big picture.
Maintaining various Industry Analysis data and data sources
Automation of existing processes to drive analytic quality and efficiencies

This individual will interact with various departments, members of management, and internal stakeholders. A small amount of travel may be required.

Required Qualifications

6 months+ experience in writing and troubleshooting SQL queries
6 months+ experience working with multiple RDBMS database platforms such as Oracle, Teradata, and DB2
1+ years’ in MS Excel


Preferred Qualifications

Prior experience in the PBM, Pharmacy, or Healthcare industry
1+ years’ experience working with ETL tools and Data Languages. (I.e. Python, SAS, R, VBA, Alteryx, SSIS )
1+ years’ Advanced SQL techniques and Functions
Knowledge of Power BI, Tableau development
Ability to manage multiple ongoing tasks, projects and deadlines
Experience with organizing, visualizing, presenting, and migrating large data sets.
Experience in financial modeling, underwriting or analytics
Excellent analytic skills
Ability to dissect large data sets
Problem solving skills
Good communications skills


Education

Bachelor's Degree or equivalent work experience.

A bachelor’s degree in a technical or analytic field is preferred.

At CVS Health, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.


We strive to promote and sustain a culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging every day. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Since 1952, Lawson Products has worked hard to make our customers' jobs easier by improving their operational efficiency, productivity and overall performance. As a leader in the MRO industry, we partner with customers to make sure they have the right maintenance and repair parts on hand when needed.

We’re looking for a Customer Retention Data Analyst responsible for identifying trends in our customers’ spending habits to increase the effectiveness of the sales retention program. This individual will be tasked with retrieving and analyzing customer data from BI and Access and preparing reports in Excel that will help our organization identify at-risk customers and take proactive steps to retain the account.
Our corporate headquarters is located in Chicago, IL. This role operates on a hybrid work model; employees spend two days working in the office and three days working remotely. We offer 401k plus vision, dental and medical benefits, as well as a paid holiday and PTO package.

Responsibilities:
Documents key metrics related to call activity using BI and Access and reports on metrics to analyze and identify trends.
Prepares summary reports using Excel to highlight analysis and area progress to management.
Reviews sales-call cycle reports to target customers with missed sales calls, establishing and adhering to a consistent cycle.
Tracks communications with customers, documenting key customer relationship management (CRM) information, including service issues customers may be experiencing.
Coordinates work efforts with field sales and inside sales teams to increase effectiveness of sales/customer retention program.
Supports documentation of team processes
Other duties as assigned.

Associate’s degree required, bachelor's degree preferred, with at least 3 years of business analysis experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Strong PC skills. A proficiency in Microsoft Excel and BI is essential. Access and SQL helpful. SAP experience preferred.
Good analytical skills, with the ability to make sound decisions. Able to recognize trends as they develop.
Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
Resourceful and a creative problem solver. Results-oriented.
Good communication skills, particularly the ability to communicate over the phone effectively and in a professional manner.
Ability to participate well in a team environment. Participative by nature, offering creative ideas for process improvement.
Ability to self-start and work independently.
Attendance and punctuality are very important for performance.

Job Details

Description

Who We Are

Milliman Financial Risk Management LLC (Milliman FRM)—an SEC registered investment advisor—is a global market leader in risk management and hedging support services. The Milliman FRM team is passionate about transforming the way the world manages portfolio risk and plans for retirement. Established in 1998, the Milliman FRM practice includes more than 100 professionals from around the world, operating from three trading platforms (Chicago, London, and Sydney). This global platform allows the firm to monitor and maintain hedge portfolios around the clock greater than US$600 billion in underlying account value.

What You Will Do

As part of the Trade Operations Group, you will be responsible for enhancing the efficiency and reliability of our Middle and Back Office operations through automation and systemization. You will be involved in designing and building scalable solutions for trade lifecycle processes as well as assisting with data management strategy. You will also be involved in supporting the day-to-day trading operations for our clients.

You will:

Perform root cause analysis on current infrastructure design weaknesses and provide feedback on future state design.
Work collaboratively with multiple stakeholders to help design and deploy a data operating model across the front, middle and back offices.
Identify, perform analysis, and resolve trade and settlement breaks.
Oversee high level account balances and margin requirements; execute transfers to meet margin requirements.
Work directly with counterparties, custodians, banks and other interested parties to ensure all actions on behalf of the client are resolved and reconciled in a timely manner.
Produce and distribute reporting to clients and third-party service providers.
Collaborate with other areas of support including Governance & Risk Management, Portfolio Management, Capital Markets and Trading, Actuarial, Trading Technology and Legal/Compliance
Create procedures and document process flows.
Additional responsibilities as group continues to expand in business and complexity.



Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in finance, economics, or other relevant programs of study
1-3 years of experience in treasury, trade, or investment operations
VBA knowledge strongly desired
Prior experience in data management that may include data design, governance, operations or architecture. Experience with SQL, Python, and other programming languages a plus
Basic to Intermediate knowledge of one or more of the following products: Futures, Listed Options, Cleared OTC Derivatives, Fixed Income (Bonds and ETFs), Mutual Funds, UIT(s), Equities, and Bilateral Non-Cleared OTC Derivatives.
Basic to Intermediate knowledge of cash and collateral management in one or more of the following areas: FCM Margin (Futures, Cleared OTC), PB / Portfolio Margining, Reg T, OTC Collateral including US/EU/APAC Reg IM and FX.
Experience with managing different aspects of the post trade life cycle from beginning to termination including allocation, confirmation, reconciliation, clearing settlement, valuations/exposure management, and corporate actions for Derivatives, Fixed Income, or Equity products in domestic and international markets.

Experience and Soft Skills Required

Experience with Acadia, TriResolve or TriOptima platforms is a plus.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment where the client is always our first priority.
Proven record of reliability and dedication to high quality work
Sharp critical thinking skills, sound judgment, and decision making ability
Both the ability and willingness to clearly articulate your ideas and provide and accept feedback
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work both collaboratively and independently

Additional Knowledge and Skills to Build

Sharp critical thinking skills, sound judgment and decision-making ability, and both the ability and willingness to clearly articulate your ideas
Demonstrated aptitude for quantitative and critical thought
Experience with financial markets, mutual funds, portfolio management, and derivatives
Experience coding complex projects in VBA
Experience working with databases (SQL, Access)
Experience coding in C#, Python or R.



Candidates hired into this role will be required to work in-person in the Milliman office in Chicago, IL on a weekly basis, but flexible work arrangements will be considered.




Milliman Benefits

At Milliman, we focus on creating an environment that recognizes – and meets – the personal and professional needs of the individual. We offer a competitive benefits package which includes:

Medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their families, including eligible domestic partners.
A 401(k) plan with matching program
Paid Parental Leave up to 12 weeks
Adoption Assistance
Profit sharing as a discretionary contribution to employees’ retirement accounts
Paid Time Off (PTO) starts accruing on the first day of work and can be used for any reason.
Milliman pays 100% of the premiums for life insurance, AD&D, an both short term and long term disability coverage
Voluntary benefits such as additional life or accidental death and dismemberment coverage for yourself or dependents
Flexible spending accounts allow employees to set aside pre-tax dollars to pay for dependent care, transportation and applicable medical needs
HMO and PPO Medical Insurance options, Dental, Vision, Commuter benefit, Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account and a Health Care Flexible Spending Account

About Rivian:
Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.

As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Role Summary:

The Data Visualization Analyst is a role where hands on experience designing, building, and deploying data visualization solutions on platforms such as Tableau, Power BI, PowerPoint, and others are required. This role will report directly to the Sr. Manager of Operations and Strategic Management (OSM) located on site in Normal, IL. A successful candidate has a passion for working with our team to understand their needs, visual storytelling, and aggregating disparate data from multiple platforms to convey new business insights. This position brings and maintains in-depth knowledge on visual design and data modeling best practices within visualization tools, performance tuning, and deployment strategies, as well as how to leverage the wide range of data analytics solutions. Assess reporting needs and opportunities.

Responsibilities:
Be the primary point of contact for the Planning Excellence organization’s leadership to understand their data visualization needs and take a user-centered approach to developing and handing off data visualizations.
Fielding questions and escalating issues as necessary.
Be comfortable with initial ambiguity in requirements gathering and offer solutions.
Help prepare for and attend business review meetings with the teams and stakeholders.
Transform datasets and quantitative analysis into compelling visuals for team leadership.
Develop and maintain dashboards and standard reports.
Ad-hoc reporting as required.
Design, create, analyze, and maintain low-to-high complexity data visualizations, reports, and dashboards (using tools such as Tableau, and Excel) to help decision makers answer questions.
Manage requirements gathering sessions and the process, including creating documentation and tracking progress in shared collaboration tools (e.g., Asana)
Establish, communicate, and manage best practices for data visualization.
Create and deliver end-user training and documentation on deliverables.
Qualifications:
2 - 4+ years of experience in data analysis and reporting.
Technical working knowledge of Tableau and Power BI or similar.
Strong communication skills, both verbal, written, and exemplary organizational skills.
Experience with supporting dashboard design and development
Project management and client relationship management skills
2+ years of experience with multiple data visualization tools, including Tableau, Excel, Python, and Microsoft Office tools, including PowerPoint.
1+ years of experience with Excel VBA, Power Query, or SQL
Knowledge of delivering reporting objects in visualization tools
Knowledge of data wrangling, from data discovery to cleaning, structuring, and validating
Ability to interpret technical findings and processes integrating with data from Data Warehouse
Experience with JIRA, Confluence and/or other project management and documentation tools
Working or practical knowledge of automotive manufacturing, global supply chain and logistics
Knowledge of data visualization best practices in performance tuning and user-centric design
Ability to work with a high degree of professionalism, autonomy with a professional presence
Ability to successfully handle multiple projects simultaneously while working independently
Ability to interact effectively with people at all organizational levels of the company
Must be willing to sit on site in Normal, IL.
