All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information or characteristics, physical or mental disability, marital/domestic partner status, age, military/veteran status, medical condition, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Rivian is committed to ensuring that our hiring process is accessible for persons with disabilities. If you have a disability or limitation, such as those covered by the Americans with Disabilities Act, that requires accommodations to assist you in the search and application process, please email us at candidateaccommodations@rivian.com.
Candidate Data Privacy
Rivian may collect, use and disclose your personal information or personal data (within the meaning of the applicable data protection laws) when you apply for employment and/or participate in our recruitment processes (“Candidate Personal Data”). This data includes contact, demographic, communications, educational, professional, employment, social media/website, network/device, recruiting system usage/interaction, security and preference information. Rivian may use your Candidate Personal Data for the purposes of (i) tracking interactions with our recruiting system; (ii) carrying out, analyzing and improving our application and recruitment process, including assessing you and your application and conducting employment, background and reference checks; (iii) establishing an employment relationship or entering into an employment contract with you; (iv) complying with our legal, regulatory and corporate governance obligations; (v) recordkeeping; (vi) ensuring network and information security and preventing fraud; and (vii) as otherwise required or permitted by applicable law.

Rivian may share your Candidate Personal Data with (i) internal personnel who have a need to know such information in order to perform their duties, including individuals on our People Team, Finance, Legal, and the team(s) with the position(s) for which you are applying; (ii) Rivian affiliates; and (iii) Rivian’s service providers, including providers of background checks, staffing services, and cloud services.

Rivian may transfer or store internationally your Candidate Personal Data, including to or in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, and the European Union and in the cloud, and this data may be subject to the laws and accessible to the courts, law enforcement and national security authorities of such jurisdictions.

Please note that we are currently not accepting applications from third party application services.

TITLE: Claims Data Analyst

DEPARTMENT: Claims

POSITION OBJECTIVE: Support Claims team and internal and external customers through collecting, reviewing, organizing, interpreting, and modeling data. Consults with Claims team on business operations and processes to ensure efficient, accurate, and customer-focused transactions

REPORTS TO: Vice President, Claims

LOCATION: Schaumburg, Illinois (Hybrid)

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITES:

Gather consistent and timely claims data from customers
Prepare, organize, and systematically store incoming data
Analyze, manage, interpret, illustrate, and report claims data through:
Catastrophe loss projections
Claims team production reports
Benchmarking databases for customer metrics
Industry and customer trending reports
Act as business unit liaison between internal and external data peers
Assess business processes and recommend improvements through workflow efficiencies and technology
Review, update, and audit key controls to verify department's compliance with model audit rules
Develop, test, and validate process metrics to measure performance
Perform other duties as assigned

RELATIONSHIPS: This position works closely with AmericanAg™ staff and business partners

EDUCATION OR TRAINING REQUIRED: Bachelor's degree in business or equivalent experience

EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS REQUIRED:

Two years of experience working in data analysis or business intelligence
Proficient working knowledge of Microsoft products and other data mining software (Excel, PowerBI, SQL)
Proven ability in data mining, forecasting, and predictive modeling
Strong problem-solving and analytical ability
Ability to prioritize daily workflow and independently multi-task
Must be able to prioritize and handle multiple assignments simultaneously and meet established deadlines

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE PREFERRED:

Knowledge of claims and/or reinsurance
ARe designation or enrolled in courses to complete ARe
AIC designation or enrolled in courses to complete AIC

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND PHYSICAL DEMANDS: Occasional travel may be required; travel opportunities increase with experience and job proficiency

The expected starting salary range for this position is between $80,000 and $110,000 annually. Applicable salary ranges may differ across markets. Actual pay will be determined based on experience and other job-related factors permitted by law. This position is also eligible for an annual productivity bonus.

Job Title: Calypso Software Tester/Analyst - Interest Rate Derivatives
Job Description:
At U.S. Bank, we’re on a journey to do our best. Helping the customers and businesses we serve to make better and smarter financial decisions and enabling the communities we support to grow and succeed. We believe it takes all of us to bring our shared ambition to life, and each person is unique in their potential. A career with U.S. Bank gives you a wide, ever-growing range of opportunities to discover what makes you thrive at every stage of your career. Try new things, learn new skills and discover what you excel at—all from Day One.

Job Description

SUMMARY

U.S. Bank is seeking a highly effective and dynamic individual to perform testing and project support for our Derivatives business in the Capital Market space. This position will help support the delivery of business needs via the Calypso product suite and will collaborate with internal partners to ensure efficiencies and value-added solution are properly and thoroughly tested and validated prior to any production release. Success will be measured through effective and proactive risk mitigations efforts, strong partnered approach to drive business satisfaction and effectiveness.



RESPONSIBILITIES
Provides project and testing support for the Calypso product suite. Performs research, analysis, review, development, implementations, and testing of new and/or revised products/services. Acts as a liaison with other departments testing interfaces or processes. Compiles and analyzes information for an assigned project making recommendations based on findings. Responsible for managing assigned regression test cases including those that have been automated.

REQUIRED

Eight to ten years of experience in project management activities
Bachelor's degree, or equivalent work experience

PREFERRED

Experience with/working knowledge of interest rate derivatives
Experience with the trading processing platform, Calypso
Considerable knowledge of assigned business line or functional area
Strong organizational and analytical skills
Thorough knowledge of project management
Ability to identify and resolve exceptions and to analyze data
Demonstrated leadership skills
Master's degree

This position is remote, i.e., anywhere in the United States.

#OpsTE

Our approach to benefits and total rewards considers our team members’ whole selves and what may be needed to thrive in and outside work. That's why our benefits are designed to help you and your family boost your health, protect your financial security and give you peace of mind. Healthcare (medical, dental, vision)

Basic term and optional term life insurance

Paid vacation (from two to five weeks depending on salary grade and tenure)

Up to 11 paid holiday opportunities

Adoption assistance

Sick and Safe Leave accruals of one hour for every 30 worked, up to 80 hours per calendar year unless otherwise provided by law

EEO is the Law

Job Title: SAS Program Management Lead Analyst/Data Analyst - Hybrid
Job Description:
This is a hybrid role and will require the ability to work in person.

Role Summary:

Data Analyst for our Pre/PostPay Edit editing program. This position will provide the technical component of our Pre/PostPay Edit editing program in development, implementation, production monitoring and maintenance of our internal PrePay edits. Individual will work with our matrix partners to evaluate edit ideas and use business requirements to develop the technical processes to obtain desired results. Strong technical coding experience will be needed to be successful in this role.

Responsibilities:

Act as technical analyst for Proactive Claim Intervention projects and daily tasks for all aspects of our Pre/PostPay Edit editing program.
Data Analyst for the development, installation, execution and maintenance of our Pre/PostPay Edit editing program.
Develop and maintain editing on regular and ad-hoc basis, primarily using SAS, Microsoft SQL Server and internally developed ARM application.
Responsible for data mining activities and technology integration of Pre/PostPay Correction Program to support our Pre/PostPay Edit editing program.
Evaluates and appropriately utilizes various approaches to data mining to narrow in on trends and drivers that directly impact outcomes.
Makes well-thought-out decisions on complex or ambiguous IT architecture issues.
Participate in all phases of Pre/PostPay Edit program IT architecture process testing and implementation
Ensures that system improvements are successfully implemented and monitored to increase efficiency.
Works closely with matrix business partners to define data needs, opportunities for improvement and effectively communicates results of analysis and solutions.
Acts as a resource for mentorship, training and guidance for junior staff.

Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree or higher strongly preferred in business, technology, or related field or equivalent work experience required.
5+ years of SAS coding experience required with proficient skills Microsoft SQL Server.
5+ years of experience in health care/managed care with proficient skills in medical analysis and project management.
Solid Excel experience preferred.
Strong data investigation skills to mine healthcare data required.
Strong data analysis skills with the ability to analyze large amount of healthcare data required.
Strong project management skills and comfort in ability to create and achieve success in highly matrixed environment.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills with demonstrated ability to research, problem solve, trouble shoot, influence and partner across the organization to a drive toward resolution for the client, provider and organization.
Strong presentation skills. Able to prepare, deliver, and ensure understanding of information regarding any customer-related or process improvement topic across audiences.
Demonstrated ability to work independently and drive to objectives.



If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

For this position, we anticipate offering an annual salary of 70,800 - 118,000 USD / yearly, depending on relevant factors, including experience and geographic location.

This role is also anticipated to be eligible to participate in an annual bonus plan.

We want you to be healthy, balanced, and feel secure. That’s why you’ll enjoy a comprehensive range of benefits, with a focus on supporting your whole health. Starting on day one of your employment, you’ll be offered several health-related benefits including medical, vision, dental, and well-being and behavioral health programs. We also offer 401(k) with company match, company paid life insurance, tuition reimbursement, a minimum of 18 days of paid time off per year and paid holidays. For more details on our employee benefits programs, visit Life at Cigna Group.

About The Cigna Group

Doing something meaningful starts with a simple decision, a commitment to changing lives. At The Cigna Group, we’re dedicated to improving the health and vitality of those we serve. Through our divisions Cigna Healthcare and Evernorth Health Services, we are committed to enhancing the lives of our clients, customers and patients. Join us in driving growth and improving lives.

The Service Delivery Analyst is responsible for a broad range of tasks focused on all aspects of application service delivery, including the triaging of complex technical issues involving highly integrated application platforms, the organizing and management of Run+ application functional enhancements and upgrades, business stakeholder relationship management and other assignments focused on delivery of high quality and timely technology support in the higher education space. The individual will apply their knowledge of business process analysis and design and technology to solve client needs. Individual will partner with business owners to deliver technology solutions. Individual will also partner with other members of the IT Organization to develop process improvements that result in more streamlined and effective processes. The Service Delivery Analyst will interact with a wide range of colleagues from Academic Deans to hands-on technology and business professionals across international borders.

This position will understand the technology and information needs of the business to determine which internal and vendor technology solutions are the right solutions for business needs. Working independently, or with a team of colleagues, the Solutions Analyst will design, recommend, plan, develop and support implementation of specific IT solutions to meet tactical and strategic business and IT goals.
Responsibilities:
Executes by applying appropriate methodology and tools to manage assignments in the arena of application service delivery.
Ensures all project deliverables and outcomes are implemented on time, on budget, and within scope to meet the expectations of the project sponsor and owner.
Employs proper management in the areas of project scope, schedule/time, finance, quality, resource, communication, risk, and procurement for successful project outcomes.
Develops recommendations, action plans and necessary documentation following the approved project methodology.
Develops business requirements by interviewing Subject Matter Experts, gains an understanding of the technology that will be used to provide the solution and documents requirements.
Develops Functional Specifications and Designs as needed.
Works with assigned technical resources to develop and document technical specifications.
Works with IT Service Delivery Manager to ensure Training and Communication plans are developed.
Works with business sponsors to ensure that appropriate approvals are gathered at appropriate tollgates.
Completes other duties as assigned.





Bachelor's degree in business, technology or related discipline.
- 2 - 3 years Project Management experience. Managing and executing multiple projects at once is desired
- 2 - 3 years as a Business Analyst
Demonstrated experience with business processes and prior use of a project management system; Azure DevOps experience a plus
Experience with IT service management and IT service delivery activities is desired. Experience with managing ServiceNow is a plus.
Prior experience in a software or technology Organization; higher education or academic technology experience a strong plus
Experience with SharePoint, MS PowerPoint, Excel, and Word required
Experience supporting projects of medium levels of complexity
Experience working in an environment which follows a structured development process
Excellent oral and written communication skills. Must be able to explain complex technical issues in a way that non-technical people can understand. Must be able to explain customer needs and priorities in a way that technical people can understand.
Ability to work with both technical and non-technical team members

At HCSC, we consider our employees the cornerstone of our business and the foundation to our success. We enable employees to craft their career with curated development plans that set their learning path to a rewarding and fulfilling career.

Come join us and be part of a purpose driven company who is invested in your future!

Job Summary

This position is responsible for leading the development of functional and non-functional business requirements. Working with the business solutions lead to understand business strategy and translate into product requirement.

Knowledge of system architecture and application portfolio.

Business and technical acumen.
Project management skills.
Requirements definition and management.
SDLC, Iterative, Agile, OWF, and /or Scrum development.
Problem solving. analytical thinking and critical thinking.
Possess ability to manage workload and manage multiple priorities, as applicable.
Written and verbal communications.

Integrated Project Management Company, Inc.'s (IPM) is a business consulting firm that makes an impact and gives back to the community through tackling strategic initiatives for our clients and supporting our employees’ aspirations. We are an organization with heart and drive to deliver beyond expectations, and we foster a supportive and enthusiastic team environment. We are looking to bring on a motivated, professional, and enthusiastic Data Analyst to help poise us for further growth and sustainability.

The Data Analyst will further enable data-driven decision making across the organization. This role will support defining, developing, and implementing the integration of business data, which comes from multiple software tools, enabling data visualizations to be easily and efficiently viewed. The Data Analyst has the additional responsibility to develop and design data visualizations and analysis on an as-needed basis.

Primary Responsibilities:

Develop and manage reports, analysis, and dashboard solutions.
Assure data integrity and preservation of system data.
Analyze current and past data and performance; monitor variances; gather benchmark data.
Understand what impacts the data being analyzed, draw conclusions, and recommend actions to Management.
Perform data analysis to understand, document, and profile data to be used in business intelligence solutions.
Share intellectual knowledge, learn, and gain strong knowledge of existing software.
Must be and work independently with limited supervision and as part of a team.
Assist project managers as needed with data analysis requests.
Compile and report survey data.
Participate in enterprise-level metadata, master data management, and data governance initiatives.
Stay informed about Business Intelligence industry trends, technologies and best practices that can be applied to achieve business goals.
Perform other duties as required.

Required Education, Skills and Knowledge:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Finance or a relevant degree.
1+ years of experience in data analysis.
Experience with data visualization software, similar to PowerBI, Tableau, and/or Qlikview.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel including extensive knowledge using Formulas, Functions, PivotTables, Data Models, and Data Queries.
Demonstrated proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite.
SQL Server skills including developing and executing SQL queries, performance tuning, data analysis and integration, preferred.
Ability to collect and analyze specific business requirements and work with the team to assess the software solution.
Acute attention to detail with aptitude in decision making, critical thinking, analysis, and problem solving, along with ability ensure confidentiality for highly sensitive information.
Strong interpersonal skills as well as strong written and oral communication skills in the English language.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Ability to organize and prioritize within established deadlines.
Demonstrated work ethic, integrity, and professional conduct.
Excellent interpersonal and presentation skills.

Company Name: BEST FOOT FORWARD SOLUTION SERVICES LLC
Job Description:
Description:


We are looking to hire a Data Analyst to join our Operations team. You will be responsible for developing, reporting and summarizing performance data. You will also identify opportunities, trends, and will be troubleshooting data issues. To do well in this role, you will need to take initiative and have a very fine eye for detail, experience as a Data Analyst, and a deep understanding of the popular data analysis tools and databases.

Job duties:

Take the lead position on creating and analyzing data reports on Operations team activity.
Responsible for daily reporting of Operations’ KPIs.
Analyze reports and trends and provide recommendations on a weekly, monthly, and quarterly basis.
Create new views of data to consistently improve company’s understanding of trends and revenue.
Provide support for additional ad-hoc analysis as needed for company initiatives.
Participate in implementation of new projects.
Projects will require collaboration with multiple departments.

Competencies:

Accountability: Accepting responsibility that results in anticipation/prevention of problem areas from actions, and problem solving inside and outside the department/organization.
Teamwork: Working as a productive member of a cohesive group toward a common goal and contributing to team development and effective team dynamics.
Written Communication: Expressing ideas and opinions clearly in properly structured, well-organized, and grammatically correct reports or documents; utilizing language and terminology.
Verbal Communication: Employ active listening skills, to understand the needs of both technical and non-technical audiences; When interacting with others, utilize socially appropriate manners of conveying ideas, asking questions, and providing answers.
Attention to Detail: Taking responsibility for a thorough and detailed method of working.
Planning and Organizing: Setting priorities and defining actions, time, and resources needed to achieve predefined goals.
Requirements:
Work experience as a Data Analyst or in a related field.
Ability to work with stakeholders to assess potential risks.
Ability to analyze existing tools and databases and provide software solution recommendations.
Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical, lay terms.
Experience with charts, graphs, and use of visualization tools.
Experience with report building, analysis, and interpreting meaning for non-technical audiences.
High-level written and verbal communication skills.

Job Details

Description

Metropolitan Family Services empowers families to learn, to earn, to heal, to thrive. Part mentor, part motivator, part advocate, since 1857, Metropolitan family Services has been the engine of change that empowers families to reach their greatest potential and positively impact their communities. Metropolitan is Illinois' first comprehensive human services agency and reaches more than 117,000 individuals and families in Chicago, Evanston/Skokie, the southwest suburbs and DuPage County with services promoting education, economic stability, emotional wellness and empowerment.

We are now hiring for a full-time Data Analyst to join our Metropolitan Peace Initiatives team!

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

Assist with data entry, cleaning, and analysis of program data from a range of different organizations and service areas
Assist with the creation and implementation of instruments for program evaluation (e.g. participant surveys, workshop evaluations)
Prepare reports and presentations on program outputs/outcomes and trends in violence.
Make adjustments to fields and forms in the database as needed.
Ensure data in system is accurate, complete, and up to date
Build and strengthen relationships with external partners through providing technical assistance with data collection and reporting, and providing input around feasible and valuable performance measures.
Maintain systems and processes that protect the confidentiality of participants
Other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Master's degree in public policy or social service or related field preferred. Bachelor's degree in public policy or social service or related field required.
A minimum of one year of relevant data analysis experience required.
Experience working in violence prevention preferred.
Experience creating data visualizations and/or dashboards preferred.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Must have access to a vehicle, valid driver's license and proof of insurance to perform essential job functions, required.
Employment with MFS requires proof of vaccination or an approved Medical exemption, required.
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously, process high volume of requests, and meet tight deadlines.
Ability to work discretely with and navigate conversations around sensitive and confidential data.
Experience working with large and complex datasets, preferred.
Experience working on program data collection and analysis.
High proficiency with Microsoft Office preferred.
Mobility is required.

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:

MFS staff are required to provide proof of vaccination or have an approved Medical exemption prior to starting employment. If an approved Medical is obtained, weekly testing is required.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

While performing the essential duties of this job, the employee is required to sit and stand for sustained periods of time, frequently talk, hear, use hands and fingers to feel, handle and operate objects or controls, and occasionally stand, bend, stretch, stoop, kneel and crouch.
The employee may occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.
The employee is required to have close visual acuity to perform an activity such as preparing and analyzing data and figures, transcribing and viewing a computer terminal.

SALARY:

Compensation is commensurate with years of related experience, position requirements, and candidate qualifications. The average salary for the position is $60,400.

Company Name: The Federal Home Loan Bank of Chicago
Job Description:
Join the FHLBC team!

At the Federal Home Loan Bank of Chicago, employees come first - that’s why we offer a highly competitive compensation and bonus package, and access to a comprehensive benefits program designed to meet the needs of our employees.


Medical, dental and vision insurance
Retirement program (401k and Pension)
Generous PTO plan
11 paid holidays per year
Hybrid working model (effective February 22, 2022)
Casual dress code
Who we are:
FHLBank Chicago partners with our members in Illinois and Wisconsin to provide them competitively priced funding, a reasonable return on their investment in the Bank, and support for their community investment activities. We are one of 11 Federal Home Loan Banks created by Congress in 1932 as a government sponsored enterprise to support mortgage lending and community investment. We are member owned and member focused. Our members include banks, credit unions, insurance companies and CDFIs.
What it’s like to work here:
At FHLBank Chicago, we bring people together. Our regular All-Staff meetings keep employees informed and our values drive the work that we do. Our Buddy Program pairs new hires with tenured employees to guide their onboarding. Our Employee Value Proposition is honed by listening and identifying the needs and priorities of our valued employees. Through CommuniTeam, we volunteer and identify ways to strengthen our communities. Our Office of Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) hosts signature and employee-led events for continued learning; and Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) and culture clubs create connections around shared interests and experiences. We offer live and on-demand professional development opportunities to grow your skillset and your career.
What you’ll do:
A successful Marketing Analytics Analyst is responsible for gathering and analyzing data related to strategic marketing campaigns, playing a crucial role in helping leadership make informed decisions and optimizing their marketing strategies.
How you’ll make an impact:
Use data and analytical tools to highlight key successes and spotlight marketing opportunities. Visualizing and structuring data in a way that appeals to different audiences (some prefer specificity; while others require executive summary information)
Leveraging your ability to think outside of the box and creatively solve problems, including challenging assumptions and influencing stakeholders
The work you perform will have a direct impact on accomplishing the Bank’s strategic objectives and business results
What you can expect:
Data Analysis: Analyzing marketing data, including sales figures, customer demographics, and online traffic, to identify trends and insights.
Performance Metrics: Developing and tracking key performance indicators (KPIs) to define and measure the success of marketing efforts.
Reporting: Creating regular reports and dashboards to present findings to the marketing team and management.
A/B Testing: Conducting A/B tests to evaluate the effectiveness of different marketing strategies and making data-driven recommendations.
Data Visualization: Using tools like Excel, Tableau, or other data visualization software to present data in a visually understandable way.
Market Research: Conducting market research to identify opportunities and threats in the competitive landscape.
Customer Segmentation: Segmenting customer data to target specific demographics or segments with tailored marketing strategies.
ROI Analysis: Calculating return on investment (ROI) for marketing campaigns and providing insights to improve profitability.
Predictive Analytics: Utilizing predictive modeling and machine learning to forecast future marketing trends and outcomes.
Communication: Collaborating with the marketing team to provide insights and recommendations for optimizing campaigns.
Data Integrity: Ensuring data accuracy and integrity by implementing data quality checks and validation processes.
Stay Updated: Keeping up-to-date with industry trends and emerging analytics technologies.
What you’ll bring:
Bachelor’s degree required in Marketing, Finance, or related field.
2-4 years’ experience in marketing analytics / strategy analysis in the Financial Services industry preferred.
Salesforce or CRM-equivalent expertise is preferred. Marketing Cloud or marketing-equivalent system knowledge is also preferred.
Experience with Tableau or other equivalent data visualization tools is preferred; becoming a Tableau expert is required to successfully perform the role.
Fluency in Microsoft Suite products, particularly Excel and PowerPoint.
Experience putting together executive or board level dashboards, reports, and other summarized materials is a plus.
A high degree of professionalism with outstanding communication (written, verbal, and listening) skills.
Ability to self-start and self-motivate, a willingness to take an active role to drive results by collaborating with peers, leaders, customers and teams.
Desire for continuous learning and inclination to understand big picture elements potentially outside of current role requirements.
Motivated by a curiosity to find new questions or answers by looking at data and problems in novel or unique ways.
Strive to bring new thoughts and ideas to the team in order to drive innovation and unique solutions.
Proven ability to develop, analyze, and effectively interpret data.
Curiosity to learn fixed income capital markets, mortgage markets, financial institution funding dynamics, and wholesale funding markets.
Ability to prioritize work, meet deadlines, and concentrate on details in a fast- paced work environment.
Critical thinking to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions and present results/recommendations to audiences.
The perks:
At FHLBank Chicago, employees come first. We offer a highly competitive compensation and bonus package, and access to a comprehensive benefits program designed to meet the needs of our employees. Our retirement program includes a 401K and Pension. Our generous PTO plan provides five weeks of vacation for new employees and 11 paid holidays per year. About Rivian:
Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.

As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.

Responsibilities:
Work directly with business stakeholders in our factory to build well-loved analytics dashboards (with Tableau, Snowflake) that help solve problems! This is a very collaborative & customer-facing role.
Work cross-functionally to make design decisions that balance between custom and generic content (solving problems vs. scaling and aligning on standards)
Listen closely to user requests and help surface gaps in our analytics data; help craft requirements for new data transformations and metrics that can improve Rivian manufacturing
Contribute to our code-based data transformations (with SQL, dbt, Snowflake) to provide user-facing analytics tables
Educate others on how to access our data and use self-serve analytics tools
Qualifications:
Exceptional communication, social, & executive functioning skills
Collaborate excellently with a wide variety of partners
Consistently demonstrate kindness, respect, and empathy.
Excellent listening skills
Can clearly distill & communicate complex technical topics in a non-technical manner so that technical topics are accessible by a wide audience (“explain like I’m five”)
At the same time, ability to code / write / diagram / document in precise & crisp detailed technical detail.
Expertise with SQL
Expertise building analytics dashboards that solve business problems in Tableau
Expertise using version controlled workflows
Proficiency with R or Python is a plus
Eagerness to work closely with manufacturing engineering teams and develop domain knowledge about manufacturing processes

Degree in engineering, math (statistics), or similar

About us

Primient is a leading producer of food and industrial ingredients made from plant-based, renewable sources. From field to customer, our priorities are focused on ensuring we produce the safest, highest quality products through practices that uphold both our responsibility and commitments to our people, our communities, and our planet.

About the role

The ISIT Digital Data & Analytics (D&A) Developer is accountable for hands-on development of reports, Dashboards for our solution platform to provide business value for our business partners to enable insightful decision-making.

**Please note that Sponsorship is not available for this position**

Main responsibilities of the role:

Work with our business partners to gather requirements and develop / code reports and dashboards
Transform raw data into actionable business insights in support of decision support solutions to improve enterprise performance
Work in a fast-moving, iterative, agile development of analytics solutions environment
Work with the IT Delivery, Operations, and Security teams and business partners to identify, pilot, build analytics-focused deliverables to provide business value for our business partners to enable self-service for insightful decision-making beyond simple reports
Work under the Digital Data & Analytics Manager to utilize the technology portfolio to enable new capabilities while ensuring compliance and alignment with internal policies, governance, security, and business objectives.

What you’ll need to have:

Ability to harness the power of technology for agile delivery of best-in-class solutions
Ability to develop and deliver enhancements and projects and initiatives with the ability to work across various departments to establish common business definitions and rules on key performance indicators based on the current environment with the ability to build conceptual data models
Excellent written and oral communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work with a broad range of stakeholders
Analytically minded and strong problem management and resolution skills

Specifically, you will need:

3+ years of hands-on industry experience in continuous performance improvements with data analysis, business intelligence, visualizations, dashboards, and analytics tools.
3+ Years of hands-on development experience with Power BI on multiple initiatives and projects
Hands-on experience with Cloud based platforms (Azure), Ingestion, Data Lake Store, Databricks, ETL pipelines, end user BI tools
Hands-on Experience with Snowflake development to create technical design, write code and unit test.
Experience with SAP ECC, SAP BW, BOBJ, AFO
Understanding of requirements gathering and data modelling concepts
Proven track record of delivering creative solutions with the objective of aligning technology with business strategy and goals.
University degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science, Data Science, or Information Technology

Location

Our IT team is spread globally but our two largest hubs are in Schaumburg, IL and Decatur IL. This role is to be based on our Schaumburg office with only occasional travel into the respective plant facility offices for meetings.

What we can offer you

At Primient you will have to opportunity to drive end to end to end solutions, while owning a high level of accountability and ownership. Additionally, you will have access to:

Flexible working policy
Competitive salary
401 K matching and non-contingent matching plans
Healthcare/Medical insurance

Here at UNCOMN, our mission is to empower systems thinkers to create elegant solutions to complex problems – to improve the systems that improve our communities. Our team members apply their natural curiosity and grit to discover elegant solutions for our clients’ most complex organizational, logistics, process, data, and technical challenges, with the overall goal of building great businesses that contribute to great communities.

UNCOMN is seeking a Data Analyst to become a crucial force behind ensuring the efficiency and resilience of the U.S. military's fuel supply chain. In this role, your insights and data-driven decisions will directly impact the success of critical missions worldwide. By analyzing and interpreting complex datasets, you'll play a pivotal role in optimizing fuel logistics, enhancing operational efficiency, and contributing to the overall effectiveness of the Department of Defense. This is not just a job; it's an opportunity to be part of something larger, where your analytical skills translate into real-world impact, supporting the nation's defense efforts and ensuring the global reach and capability of the U.S. military.




If you're ready to apply your data expertise to make a lasting difference, seize this opportunity and be a vital contributor to a mission that truly matters. In this role, you'll also:

Become a crucial force behind ensuring the efficiency and resilience of the U.S. military's fuel supply chain, directly impacting the success of critical missions worldwide.
Analyze and interpret complex datasets, playing a pivotal role in optimizing fuel logistics, enhancing operational efficiency, and contributing to the overall effectiveness of the Department of Defense.
Perform data analysis, generate insights, and create interactive data visualizations.
Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their requirements and deliver data-driven insights to drive informed decisions.
Collaborate with data engineers to access, clean, and transform data for analysis, ensuring data quality and accuracy.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, analysts, and business stakeholders, to understand their data needs and provide timely support.
Develop and optimize data processing workflows using Advana and/or Palantir tools.
Apply statistical methods and machine learning techniques to gain deeper insights from data and develop predictive models.
Create customized reports, dashboards, and KPIs to monitor key performance indicators.
Comfortably and confidently compiling & presenting analytical findings to stakeholders.
Comfortable working in an agile environment.
Automate and schedule regular data reporting for stakeholders.
Implement data security measures to protect sensitive information and ensure compliance with data protection regulations.
Assist in auditing and documenting data lineage, measurements, and access controls.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in Advana and/or Palantir tool suites and contribute to the development of best practices.
Identify limitations of current software tools and propose either bridge solutions or alternatives.
Epitomize UNCOMN Core Values.



2 years of related experience.
Must be eligible to obtain a top-secret clearance, granted by the US Government.
Prior experience using scripting languages like Python for data analysis tasks such as data cleaning and visualization.
Prior experience with SQL to accomplish data retrieval, manipulation, joining data, and reporting tasks.
Knowledge of Business Intelligence systems like Tableau, PowerBI, Qlik Sense for data analysis and visualization.



Preferred

Bachelor of Science in STEM-related (Science, Technology, Engineering, Math, etc.) major.

Anova Financial Networks seeks to accelerate the development of ultra-low latency transport devices! As a vertically integrated design and developer of ultra-low latency solutions, instruments, and systems, for High-Frequency Trading networks, our product portfolio includes, high resiliency fail-over and low-latency port-aggregation units.

Job Description:

Anova is seeking an individual contributor who will be responsible for analyzing, developing, executing, and reporting on Market Data Services deployed on our networks. This position will develop a core competency and evolve into a knowledge leader on Exchange Market Data, data delivery, format, and structure. With other members of the engineering and product development teams, this person is responsible for the quality deployment of existing and new Market Data Service offerings. The candidate must be team-oriented, creative, and have excellent technical, written, and interpersonal communication skills.

The individual should possess excellent individual and group work skills and have the ability to interact with developers, engineers, sales, and marketing. Responsibilities include the creation, execution and reporting to validate the functionality, performance and quality of the Anova Market Data Service offerings.

Ideally, the candidate must have a solid foundation in Finance and/or Information Technology in order to analyze, develop, validate, and assess the performance of the Anova Market Data Services. They should have the ability to provide feedback/solutions to enhance the product offering.

Essential Job Functions include the following, but are not limited to:

Develop expertise and knowledge base of Worldwide Financial Exchange Market Data formats
Work closely with development team and marketing to enhance and create new product offerings
Assist in the development of efficient parsing of market data to optimize the utilization of the Anova Network internally and with select vendors
Analyze, develop, and summarize the Market Data formats for the Global Financial Exchanges
Assist Product Development with Anova fulfilling the requirements as a Market Data Provider with the Global Financial Exchanges

Qualifications, Skills, Experience:

BS/BA in Accounting, Finance, Mathematics, or Information Technology
Previous experience with market data analytics is preferred
Demonstrated analytical skills and ability work in an experientially diverse team
Demonstrated knowledge/experience with Financial Exchange (e.g. BATS, CME, ICE, etc.) market data
Excellent presentation, oral, written, and interpersonal skills in a technically dynamic environment
Demonstrated knowledge or skill in computational languages (e.g. R, PERL, Python) is desirable
Understanding of the OSI model; in particular layer 1-3
Lawful employment in the USA on a permanent basis without sponsorship or representation
Travel as needed

The Junior Analyst is typically involved in assisting in developing analyses for marketing investment banking services and has developed the experience to function as a supporting team member on some financing or corporate advisory transactions. The Junior Analyst will also assist our Associate with client financials, including updating, classifying, organizing, and overall data entry. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical and interpersonal skills, 1-2 years of investment banking, accounting statement preparation, or similar corporate finance experience.

POSITION DESCRIPTION

The Junior Analyst will work as part of the transaction team on buy-side and sell-side merger and acquisition transactions, financial advisory, valuations, fairness opinions, and capital raising activities. The Junior Analyst will also work as part of the accounting team and will assist the Associate with daily assignments. The Junior Analyst will report directly to and work closely with the Associate on most assignments.

Junior Analyst responsibilities include:

Assist with accounting statement preparation and bookkeeping support for various clients.
Assist in preparing financial models and in transaction due diligence and other project support such as preparation of project materials.
Assist senior management by analyzing prospective clients for advisory and capital raising services through use of industry research tools.
Work closely with senior management on special projects; work on multiple projects and transactions at any given time.
Help support the deal process from origination to close.
Support management in researching and creating marketing pitch materials as determined by management in targeting or supporting certain clients, industries, or advisory activities.

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree preferred; degree preference in a business-related field such as Finance, Accounting, or related studies.
Experience with detailed financial statement preparation or bookkeeping (QuickBooks).
Excellent analytical, financial modeling, drafting, and client management skills.
Ability to analyze data and offer creative and highly strategic solutions.
Excellent organizational, verbal, and written communication skills.
Ability to articulate the most substantive issues clearly and concisely.
Proven proficiency in utilizing spreadsheets, presentation software, and research programs (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and Eikon).
Preparing, organizing, digitizing and/or Data Keying highly sensitive documents
Ability to work in a team atmosphere with other professionals and administrative staff; strong ability to work in an entrepreneurial culture.
Ability to relate well with clients and establish good working relationships; desire to become an effective representative of the firm.
Understanding of securities regulation and compliance matters.
Proactive communication and critical thinking skills.
Displays superior responsibility, attention to detail, commitment, time management, initiative, maturity, and creativity in dealing with assignments.

Camping World Holdings, Inc., headquartered in Lincolnshire, IL, (together with its subsidiaries) is America's largest retailer of RVs and related products and services. Our vision is to build a long-term legacy business that makes RVing fun and easy, and our Camping World and Good Sam brands have been serving RV consumers since 1966.

We strive to build long-term value for our customers, employees, and shareholders by combining a unique and comprehensive assortment of RV products and services with a national network of RV dealerships, service centers and customer support centers along with the industry's most extensive online presence and a highly trained and knowledgeable team of employees serving our customers, the RV lifestyle, and the communities in which we operate. We also believe that our Good Sam organization and family of programs and services uniquely enable us to connect with our customers as stewards of the RV enthusiast community and the RV lifestyle. With RV sales and service locations in 42 states, Camping World has grown to become the prime destinations for everything RV.

Pricing Data Analyst

Position Location:Hybrid (Lincolnshire, IL)

Camping World is seeking a Pricing Data Analyst to work at the intersection of pricing and data science in our recreational vehicle (RV) business. In this role, you will use business and analysis experience to create pricing analytics, analyze competitor data, develop pricing and discounting models, and compare outcomes of different pricing actions.

You will report to the Director of RV Pricing Strategy and be part of a new, dedicated pricing team focused on implementing new pricing policies and processes.

Job Responsibilities:

Perform daily tasks to monitor and adjust prices and pricing models to optimize profit and volume of sales.
Evaluate and process pricing requests from Camping World team members based on historical data and profit objectives.
Maintain and update data in Excel, SQL databases, and enterprise systems.
Perform advanced analysis is Excel and PowerBI applying knowledge of statistics and business processes.
Develop analytics to quantify willingness to pay, price elasticity, and other pricing related measures using Excel, PowerBI and other analytical tools as necessary.
Create reports, presentations, and information dashboards to present results of analytics work.
Work with the pricing team to develop new processes to improve overall efficiency of the pricing process.
Use Excel, PowerBI, SQL, Python, and/or R to organize and clean data for use in analysis.
Identify and perform exploratory data analysis on datasets. Join multiple datasets for deeper analysis.
Take on special projects as needed.

Must Have Qualifications – Education:

Computer Science, Data Science, Business Analytics or closely related degree at bachelor's or master's level

Must Have Qualifications – Experience:

5 years of relevant pricing or data analysis work experience (3 years with master's degree)
Experience in data exploration, statistical analysis, and visualizations.
Experience with Microsoft Office tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
Experience with common data science programming tools such as SQL, Python, and/or R.

Must Have Qualifications – Other:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to maintain professional demeanor and strict confidentiality.
Ability to work independently to complete assigned tasks.
Must be diligent, organized, and extremely detail-oriented
Strong written and verbal communication skills

Preferred Qualifications:

Direct experience in pricing as an analyst, researcher, manager, within marketing, inventory, finance, or pricing departments.
Experience developing or contributing to machine learning-based pricing models.

The Senior Data Standards Analyst within Clinical Data and Reporting Standards contributes to the development of data and reporting standards in support of AbbVie’s portfolio of clinical trials and ensuring AbbVie’s conformance to CDISC standards and industry best practices. This role will focus on CDASH and SDTM standards within therapeutic area(s) such as immunology, eye care, neuroscience, and medical aesthetics.

Standards Development responsibilities include

Actively participating with a cross-functional team of subject matter experts to define one more of the following types of standards within the assigned therapeutic areas:
SDTM mapping
Data Collection
Data Review Rules
Participating in a cross-functional team of subject matter experts to define one more of the following types of standards within the assigned therapeutic areas:
ADaM mapping and derivation
Study-level tables, listings, or figures
Product-level safety analysis displays
Ensuring each standard is clearly defined, with appropriate documentation of relevant assumptions and decisions related to its use to support pipeline activities.
Ensuring consistency across standard types (e.g. eCRF standards align with TLF standards, SDTM standards align with ADaM standards, etc.)
Educate the organization on the proper use of standards in pipeline activities.
Communicate ongoing standard development activities across the organization.

Pipeline responsibilities may include

Create, review and provide feedback on SDTM Mapping Specifications and Trial Design Domains
Providing feedback on CRF design and SDTM datasets to ensure data are collected and represented in a manner that support regulatory requirements to comply with CDISC standards (CDASH, SDTM and ADaM) and AbbVie standard extensions to CDISC
Oversee the creation of SDTM define.xml, annotated CRF and Clinical Study Data Reviewer’s Guides for both FDA and PMDA submissions
Consult on conformance issues for SDTM and/or ADaM and work with the study team to resolve the problem either by correcting the data or metadata, or by providing an appropriate explanation

Other responsibilities include:

Representing AbbVie’s interests in industry standards development projects,
Staying current with industry standards such as CDISC, and the regulatory requirements related to their use
Identifying improvements to the processes and content of standards, and driving those improvements to completion



Qualifications:

MS with 6 years of relevant clinical research experience or BS with 8 years of relevant clinical research experience
Expert level of knowledge of at least two areas of clinical data standards, and high level of knowledge in at least one additional area. Areas include CDASH, SDTM, ADaM, define.xml and controlled terminology.
Familiarity with other clinical data standards including BRIDG, ODM and SHARE
Experience in mapping and converting legacy data into SDTM domains for eCTD submissions.
Knowledge of international regulations, requirements and guidance associated with clinical data standards and the preparation of data sets for regulatory submission.
Experience with metadata repository technology and its application in clinical data standards processes, or experience with data standards governance

Are you looking for a rewarding career with an organization that values their staff? The Department of Innovation & Technology (DoIT) is seeking to hire qualified candidates with the opportunity to work in a dynamic, creative thinking, problem solving environment. This position serves as a Computer Support Analyst II performing complex professional and advisory functions in End User Computing (EUC). In this role, you will coordinate and conduct complex software distribution application development for Microsoft networks at onsite user provided facilities using automated software deployment tools such as System Center Configurations Manager (SCCM) or Microsoft Windows/Microsoft installer scripts (MSI), Lite-Touch, and computer programming and/or scripting. 30% Under administrative direction serves as a Computer Support Analyst II performing complex professional and advisory functions in End User Computing (EUC) for assigned agencies:

Data Analyst
Job Number: 210002I9
Posting Date: Apr 13, 2023, 10:53:36 AM
Primary Location: Central-42 West Madison Street (Diverse Learner Supt&Svcs)
CPS Non-Union Job Grade: S06


JOB DESCRIPTION -


Chicago Public Schools (CPS) is one of the largest school districts in the United States, serving over 330,000 students in 600+ schools and employing nearly 36,000 people, most of them teachers. CPS has set ambitious goals to ensure that every student, in every school and every neighborhood, has access to a world-class learning experience that prepares each for success in college, career, and civic life. In order to fulfill this mission, we make three commitments to our students, their families, and all Chicagoans: academic progress, financial stability, and integrity. Six core values are embedded within these commitments – student-centered, whole child, equity, academic excellence, community partnership, and continuous learning.




Job Summary:

Within the Office of Diverse Learners Supports and Services (ODLSS), the Data Analyst will be responsible for managing the collection and evaluation of data, and providing reporting to leaders to ensure that Diverse Learners outcomes are monitored. Reporting directly to the Director, Data Management, the Data Analyst will use data to drive progress towards District priority and goals. The Data Analyst will provide sound survey, strategic, analytic, and project management expertise to Offices within the district and help set district standards for data processes and toolsets for analytics.




The ODLSS Data Analyst will be held accountable for the following responsibilities:

Perform analysis on complex data sets to extract meaningful information
Evaluate data for structural integrity and consistency
Compile, manipulate, and analyze data using appropriate statistical techniques
Summarize metrics and produce visualizations for key stakeholders
Ensure data quality and integrity across Offices
Communicate with broad spectrum of stakeholders at varying levels
Collaborate with business and subject matter experts to identify additional data needs
Adhere to a set of guiding principles for analytic practice as established by the Data Governance Council
Work with approved enterprise analytic tool sets. (SAS, SQL)
Compile, manipulate, and analyze data using appropriate statistical techniques
Participate in District’s Data Analyst User Group
Perform related duties as required



In order to be successful and achieve the above responsibilities, the ODLSS Data Analyst must possess the following qualifications:

Education Required:

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in finance, business, education, measurement, psychology, social science, public policy, economics, or related field, including quantitative coursework, required

Experience Required:

Minimum of three (3) years of professional experience in a role requiring data analysis, relationship management, and consultative skills, required
Experience writing code with data analytic tools (SAS, R, SPSS, STATA, etc), required
One (1) or more years of experience as a business analyst or systems analyst, preferred



Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Exceptional organizational, communication (oral and written), and problem-solving skills
Strong attention to detail
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, respond immediately to multiple constituencies and meet established deadlines
Ability to work in a team, with technical and non-technical personnel, and across departmental boundaries
Flexibility to meet changing departmental needs and priorities
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously



Conditions of Employment

As a condition of employment with the Chicago Public Schools (CPS), employees are required to:

Establish/Maintain Chicago Residency - Employees are required to live within the geographic boundaries of the City of Chicago within six months of their CPS hire date and maintain residency throughout their employment with the district. The Chicago residency requirement does not apply to temporary/part-time positions, however, all CPS employees must be residents of Illinois.
Be Fully Vaccinated Against COVID-19 - Unless approved for a medical or religious exemption, all employees are required to be up-to-date on COVID-19 vaccinations, including boosters, and to submit proof of vaccination to the district within 30 days of hire. “Up-to-date” on vaccination is defined as being at least two weeks past all primary vaccine doses and any applicable boosters.

Join our dynamic, progressive team of IT professionals in an environment where you can learn, grow, and be an integral part of creating innovative technology solutions to help our business flourish. Become a part of a leading company in global snacking, international cereal and noodles, and North America frozen foods, with iconic, world-class brands including Pringles, Cheez-It and Pop-Tarts.


At the heart of the Kellanova Company is technology — a key enabler of how we market, sell, and manufacture our well-known and beloved brands to consumers around the globe. We have an opening for you to grow with us as a IT Business Analyst Lead on our Collaboration Technologies Global Delivery team. This is a remote position and it is estimated that this individual will be asked to be in office once a quarter. We are looking for top talent in the Chicago, IL or Battle Creek, MI areas however there may be flexibility for individuals in other remote US Locations.


A Taste of What You’ll Be Doing




Release Management - Working with Microsoft to determine the O365 changes to our tenant, together you will work to understand their technology roadmaps. You will collaborate with the global IT teams to review changes and determine impact to the tenant. Managing the established release management process you will also implement ways to improve it.
Governance and Adoption - You will manage all new releases coming in to O365, owning the governance process and committee engagement. Analyzing the current O365 adoption and recommending ways to improve will be key to your success.
Strong Analysis - Your strong Microsoft solutions knowledge will be used to understand and identify changes that will impact our tenant.
Teamwork - Use your IT experience to work across technology and business to bring an understanding of O365 changes. Challenge the status-quo and bring ideas to the table to deliver. Bring improvements to our Communication and Collaboration environments through process automation and innovation approaches.


Your Recipe for Success




High School Diploma or GED
Experience in Microsoft based applications, communications, and collaboration enterprise solutions including strong experience managing O365 in a large enterprise environment.
Ability to work across functional silos and promote adoption of new tools and processes across the O365 environment.
Ability to balance multiple concurrent priorities and deliver results independently.
Strong technical problem solving, teamwork and communication skills.
Able to coach and mentor junior staff and enable them to understand and manage new platforms along with the ability to present to senior leaders.
Must be a confident, self-starter, self-motivated individual who really enjoys the challenges that come with managing a large-scale enterprise collaboration environment.

Overview:

Our ideal candidate enjoys working with clients, both internal and external, eager to learn and maximize results, is detail oriented and driven to meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Background in the mortgage or real estate industry is a plus. If this sounds like you, and you are ready for a career and not just your next job, apply today!


Responsibilities:
Facilitate servicing transfer data conversions from external parties to LoanCare, including data mapping, trial events, testing and final transfer activities

Cross-train on and perform other functions as directed by supervisor

Assist leadership in training department staff

Lead Department projects and serve as SME for corporate initiatives
All other duties as assigned.

About remote employment

LoanCare provides virtual training and support so employees working from home can be successful. You will never be alone on your journey as you will connect through Teams video chat, so that you remain engaged and form relationships with your leadership team and coworkers. We offer online/remote training, which is both dynamic and interactive, so you get the most out of the training opportunities. Our Training department also offers a large number of free on-demand online training courses that you can take to help you grow and expand your skills and knowledge.

As an added benefit for remote employees, we offer exciting engagement opportunities, such as fitness classes, contests, and fun seminars/learning activities that you can participate in from the comfort of your own home.

We provide all of the necessary equipment; all you need to provide is a quiet, private place in your home and a high-speed internet connection with a minimum network download speed of 25 megabits per second (mbps) and a minimum network upload speed of 10 mbps. Remote employees will be required to sign a Telecommuting Agreement in addition to the job description.

Who We Are
LoanCare is a top national provider in mortgage loan subservicing. The Company has been servicing loans for over 30 years and are known for superior customer support and digital innovation. Over $300 billion in asset value is managed by the team. LoanCare is part of Fidelity National Financial (NYSE: FNF), a leading provider of title insurance and transaction services to the real estate and mortgage industries.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Basic job duties an employee must be able to perform with, or without, reasonable accommodation.
Critical Thinking — Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.
Reading Comprehension — Understanding written sentences and paragraphs in work related documents.
English Language — Knowledge of the structure and content of the English language including the meaning and spelling of words, rules of composition, and grammar.
Speaking — Talking to others to convey information effectively.
Active Learning — Understanding the implications of new information for both current and future problem-solving and decision-making.
Active Listening — Giving full attention to what other people is saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times.
Instructing — Teaching others how to do something.
Judgment and Decision Making — Considering the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate one.
Time Management — Managing one's own time and the time of others.
Writing — Communicating effectively in writing as appropriate for the needs of the audience.
Complex Problem Solving — Identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.
Deductive Reasoning — The ability to apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense.
Problem Sensitivity — The ability to tell when something is wrong or is likely to go wrong. It does not involve solving the problem, only recognizing there is a problem.
Written Comprehension — The ability to read and understand information and ideas presented in writing.
Inductive Reasoning — The ability to combine pieces of information to form general rules or conclusions (includes finding a relationship among seemingly unrelated events).
Information Ordering — The ability to arrange things or actions in a certain order or pattern according to a specific rule or set of rules (e.g., patterns of numbers, letters, words, pictures, mathematical operations).
Near Vision — The ability to see details at close range (within a few feet of the observer).
Oral Comprehension — The ability to listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences.
Oral Expression — The ability to communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand.
Speech Recognition — The ability to identify and understand the speech of another person.
Speech Clarity — The ability to speak clearly so others can understand you.

WORK CONDITIONS

Working conditions are normal for an office environment. Ability to attend work and be productive during normal business hours and to work early, late, or weekend hours as needed for successful job performance. Overtime required as necessary. Essential functions are the basic job duties that an employee must be able to perform, with or without reasonable accommodation.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

Sitting up to 90% of time
Walking and standing up to 10% of time
Occasional lifting, stooping, kneeling, crouching, and reaching.

Barilla is an Italian family-owned food company. Established in 1877, it’s now an international Group present in more than 100 countries.

A world leader in the markets of pasta and ready–to–use sauces in continental Europe, bakery products in Italy and crispbread in Scandinavia, the Barilla Group is recognized worldwide as a symbol of Italian know–how.




“The joy of food for a better life” is Barilla’s purpose. Bringing people closer to the joy of good food and making quality the choice for a better life, from each individual to the planet. Because this is how we are nurturing the future, today. It's a commitment from field to fork, to bring to the world tasty, joyful and wholesome products, made with selected raw materials from responsible supply chains. Because what we eat today can change our tomorrow. Because good food is a joy for the present and a choice for a better future.




Introduction – Organizational Details:
Barilla America, Inc. wants to recruit a Supply Chain Data Analyst - within Supply Chain in Northbrook, IL. The individual will report to the Production & Distribution Planning Sr. Manager.




Job Purpose: The Supply Chain Data Analyst will problem solve and begin to predict for improved efficiencies in the data integrity throughout Supply Chain interfaces for Planning, Customer Orders, SAP, and Transportation (APO, SAP, EDI, E2Open) working in conjunction with IT and in alignment with global processes.





Key Accountabilities:

1. Confirm orders flow through without error from customers on a daily basis to ensure proper order-to-cash (OTC) data flows using internal customer (EDI) system.
2. Communicate with customers and partners in identifying EDI data issues and ensuring the cleaning of any bad records.
3. Ensure proper data flows for weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual planning cycles in APO tool and identify if trends occur for improvements.
4. Partner with IT on continuous improvement data projects to eliminate manual work, find efficiencies, and begin to use predictive models for data analysis.
5. Provide S.C. user support on Barilla America’s Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems and interfaces. (technical super-user).
6. Support the implementation of upcoming software changes for Forecasting, Planning, and Order Book Management (e.g. SAP/APO, Manugistics, etc.).

7. Provide user support for other Supply Chain tools and systems.
8. Develop relationships with the category business teams and manage expectations through deep knowledge of business processes, strategies, and goals.
9. Maintain excellent working relationships and healthy partnerships with business partners and external vendors.
10. Proactively monitor interfaces between business systems and resolve any issues.
11. Facilitate periodic meetings with business partners for project updates and issue resolution.
12. Proactively identify, escalate, and help resolve issues as they arise.
13. Document Business Processes and SOP.
14. Assist in developing process improvements that can be translated by IT to be put into system improvements.
15. Work with the Business Units to define initiatives and guidelines for business process innovation as a fundamental step towards business change.




Education/Work Experience:

Bachelor’s degree (Supply Chain Management, BBA in Business Analytics or BBA in logistics and supply chain management) or specialized training
Minimum 3 years of experience supporting Supply Chain data analysis, data flows and systems
3 years of SAP (ERP) support experience, APO preferred
Attention to detail and ability to troubleshoot data integrity issues on business processes
Experience using APO, EDI (Gentran preferred), and SAP (at least 1, multiple a plus)
E2Open or Transportation software experience preferred
Strong communication, interpersonal, and influencing skills
Ability to prioritize multiple tasks to ensure end-user satisfaction
Ability to be able to identify end-to-end processes and understand the effect of errors and changes on the overall downstream processes
Technical/functional experience a plus
Super user experience in supply chain and ERP systems
Experience working for a CPG or manufacturing company a plus.
Ability to travel domestically and internationally if needed, less than 5% travel

At AAR we are committed to doing it right, and we have built our core values based on that premise.
Data Operations Analyst - 13663

Description


SUMMARY:
The Data Operations Analyst is responsible for improving operational effectiveness and performing ad-hoc analysis, through best-in-class analytical techniques and data visualization tools, to support decision making by management and the overall AAR team.





ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Through industry best practices build upon the data infrastructure created within data visualization tools. (AAR uses DOMO)
Develop an understanding of the various databases within AAR’s ecosystem in order to write SQL queries or add required fields to existing queries.
Write python scripts helping eliminate mundane steps, build complex modeling, and simulate a program’s operations to improve overall performance and awareness.
Develop charts, pivot tables, tables, and other types of cards helping highlight a team’s current operations, trends of the past, financial performance, and measurements towards a goal.
Collaborate with business subject matter experts to understand the objective of a new request and translate that into technical steps in order to accomplish that request.
Provide analytical support relating to startup and operating phases of programs.
Document processes to ensure clear understanding for team members supporting maintenance and troubleshooting through process flowcharts, entity relationship diagrams, methodology assumptions, and other.
Identify opportunities and participate in continuous improvement activities to achieve process efficiencies.
All other duties as assigned.

CORE COMPETENCIES:

Business Savvy
Change of Direction
Transformational
Focus
Accountability

Qualifications


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:

Bachelor of Arts degree (B.A.) or Bachelor of Science degree (B.S.) from four-year college or university within a related field (e.g. IT, Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, Finance, or Actuarial Science); or eight years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
At least 2 to 5 years of related experience is strongly preferred.
Preferred experience with project management software tools such as JIRA and Azure DevOps.
Literate with Microsoft Office (e.g. Excel, Access), competent with relational databases, complex spreadsheets, data visualization tools (e.g. DOMO, Tableau, Power BI), Python, or T-SQL skills a plus.

There’s never been a more exciting time to join United Airlines. We’re on a path towards becoming the best airline in the history of aviation. Key Responsibilities:

The Senior Analyst – Dashboards and Metrics will advance the delivery of meaningful analytics in support of IT performance and objectives. This role will be analytical and collaborative and will focus on analysis and reporting across technology teams, including developing and refining metrics dashboards, tracking key performance indicators, and identifying and developing improvement opportunities for how senior leaders measure and track performance.

Provides analytical support, conducts research, reviews and helps evaluate the effectiveness of initiatives and IT performance

Conducts feasibility studies on efforts/costs of reporting on new metrics requirements

Oral and written communication skills
