Job Description:

The Contract IT Business Analyst will be responsible for closely working with business stakeholders and technology teams, including SaaS vendors, to ensure the successful delivery of our new order management, warehouse management, and data integration solution. This role involves in-depth analysis, design, and support in implementing the solution to meet our complex operational requirements.

Responsibilities:

Requirements Gathering and Analysis: Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs, gather requirements, and translate them into functional specifications, including data integration requirements. Solution Design: Work with technical teams to design a solution that includes integration with existing systems and SaaS solutions, aligning with business objectives. Data Integration Planning: Define strategies for integrating data across various platforms, including SaaS, ensuring consistency, quality, and security. Project Management: Assist in planning, tracking, and reporting on project milestones, deliverables, and status. Testing Support: Lead or assist in the development of test plans for system functionality and data integration, and coordinate user acceptance testing. Training and Documentation: Create user manuals and provide training, focusing on system functionality, data management, and SaaS interactions. Vendor and SaaS Management: Coordinate with software vendors, including SaaS providers, ensuring that the solution aligns with organizational goals and industry standards. Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities to enhance efficiency and effectiveness within the order, warehouse management, and data integration space.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Business Administration, or related field. Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Business Analyst, with a focus on order management, warehouse management, data integration, and SaaS solutions. Strong knowledge of data integration methodologies, tools, and best practices. Experience working with relevant tools, platforms, and SaaS solutions, such as ERP, WMS, SCM systems, and cloud-based integration platforms. Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills. Familiarity with Agile or other iterative development methodologies. Project management certifications like PMP or PMI-PBA would be a plus. Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.

Associate, Business Analyst

The Associate, Business Analyst performs requirements gathering, process documentation, and quality control for technology solutions implemented at Elevate. The Associate takes responsibility for leading requirements gathering, task prioritization, and software quality assurance across a number of Elevate’s programs and teams.

The Associate, Business Analyst reports to the Senior Manager, Integrated Program Operations. This position is located in Chicago, Illinois and is hybrid remote.

Responsibilities
Evaluate business processes to develop functional requirement specifications that ensure full understanding of team deliverables for software developers.
Lead ongoing meetings and reviews with program teams to optimize processes and systems.
Participate in development kick-off and Agile sprint planning sessions to communicate requirements and timelines with software developers.
Identify test requirements from specifications, map test case requirements, and execute software quality tests.
Manage and execute User Acceptance Testing (UAT) with program teams and leadership.
Ensure that validated deliverables meet functional and design specifications and requirements.
Define, implement, and champion policies to significantly increase the efficiency of Elevate’s software development/quality/delivery process.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications and Skills
Bachelor’s degree preferred.
At least three (3+) years of experience in software design, quality control, or business analysis
Experience in an Agile software development environment
Excellent documentation skills (requirement definitions, use cases, process flows, data models)
Highly detail-oriented and organized individual with the ability to manage multiple assignments and work with tight deadlines.
Ability to expand job responsibilities, suggest improvements, and collaborate with others to generate ideas for improved processes.
Excellent communication, interpersonal, collaboration, and consultative skills
Inquisitive and positive mindset in approaching complex problems.
Experience with Salesforce preferred.
Organization Description

We design and implement programs that reduce costs, protect people and the environment, and ensure the benefits of clean and efficient energy use reach those who need them most.

At Elevate, the greatest asset of our organization is the kind of people we attract. Elevate employees co-create our energetic and collaborative environment, where constant learning and service to others take priority. We empower individuals to challenge conventional thinking in pursuit of innovation and we seek dynamic, hardworking team members who are inspired to work with people of diverse backgrounds and perspectives. Every day we make a difference by placing our team, clients, and community partners first. From our mission to our focus on staff well-being and career development opportunities, there’s no better place to grow your career than Elevate.

Compensation

The total compensation for this position includes health and welfare benefits (medical, dental, vision, etc.), defined contribution benefit (401k with contribution), professional development, generous paid time off policies, and a flexible schedule. This is an exempt individual contributor position with a salary range of $70,000 - $80,000, based on experience.

Anti-Discrimination Policy

Elevate is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant based on race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or marital status. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, termination, promotion, transfer, layoff, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

ADA Accommodation

Elevate will reasonably accommodate qualified individuals with a disability so that they can perform the essential functions of a job unless doing so causes a direct threat to these individuals or others in the workplace, and the threat cannot be eliminated by reasonable accommodation, or if the accommodation creates an undue hardship to Elevate. Contact the People Team with any questions or requests for accommodations.

Job Title: Business Analyst, Infor M3 System - REMOTE
Job Description:
Description:

We are HALO! We connect people and brands to create unforgettable, meaningful, and lasting experiences that build brand engagement and loyalty for our over 60,000 clients globally, including over 100 of the Fortune 500. Our nearly 2,000 employees and 1,000 Account Executives located in 40+ sales offices across the United States are the reason HALO is #1 in our $25B industry.

HALO is looking for a Business Analyst with strong Infor, M3, ERP experience to join our high-growth company. This Business Analyst will be the subject matter expertise in our M3 system and business processes to make an immediate impact at HALO. As this successful Business Analyst you will be helping internal business users assess better ways to initiate and improve processes and procedures in a systematic perspective. As an active listener, you will pinpoint specific challenges, articulate the business requirements, and translate them to functional designs for developers.

HALO believes in bringing teams and individuals together in a collaborative environment. For candidates who live within a 30-mile radius of our Illinois offices, the following will apply:

If you reside within a 30-mile radius of our Sterling, IL office, you are required to work a hybrid schedule, working in-person anywhere from 1-3 times a week.

Responsibilities

Serve as the Info, M3 system and process expert on system and business transformation projects.
Gather business requirements through interviews with business area subject matter experts to create better business/process efficiencies.
Identify business needs, create user stories, and translate requests into functional requirements for the development team.
Translate business requirements into functional design documents.
Collaborate with internal business users and the software development team to ensure designs and deliverables meet the documented requirements.
Train and assist users with ERP related information and tools.
Provide demos with suggested UI layout and application changes for approval by the business
Oversee software projects through the software development life cycle.
Organize and maintain each project’s respective backlog through grooming sessions, daily standups, sprint planning, and sprint reviews.
Perform and coordinate software acceptance and regression testing.
Perform and help coordinate user acceptance testing (UAT) and post-implementation validation.
Other responsibilities as assigned.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in a related field.
3+ years of strong working knowledge of Infor M3 system is a MUST.
3+ years of experience as a Product Owner, Business Analyst, or System Analyst with demonstrated accomplishments in implementing projects and other initiatives.
Candidate must be able to demonstrate a history of repeatedly leading successful project execution.
Prior work experience with development methodologies including Waterfall, Scrum, Agile, and/or Lean.
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to effectively present and communicate complex solutions to technical and non-technical audiences.
Able to create and maintain standard project deliverables for multiple projects such as: Epics, User Stories, process flows, wireframes, mockups etc.
Aptitude to translate business requirements into technical requirements.
Capable of facilitating communication between stakeholders from all levels of the organization while objectively identifying and resolving conflict.
Ability to manage multiple complex projects and prioritize competing priorities.
Understand all phases of the software development life cycle (SDLC).
Proficiently drive business participation in all phases of the project.
Proficient analytical and troubleshooting skills.
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
Strong organization, time management, self-initiative, sense of ownership and accountability.


Preferred Qualifications:

Basic knowledge of databases, SQL structures and writing simple queries
Basic knowledge of HTML and/or other web-based technologies


Compensation range is specific to the job level and takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including, but not limited to: education, experience, licensure, certifications, geographic location, and internal equity. The range has been created in good faith based on information known to HALO at the time of the posting and does not include any potential benefits, however, such information will be provided separately when appropriate. The estimated base salary range for this position is between $100,000 to $120,000 USD.

More about HALO

At HALO, we unleash the energy of our client's brands and amplify their stories to capture the attention of those who matter most. For that reason, more than 60,000 small- and mid-sized businesses work with HALO and have made us the global leader of the branded merchandise industry.

Career Advancement: At HALO, we love promoting from within. Internal promotions have been the key to our exponential growth in the last few years. With so many industry leaders at HALO, you'll have the opportunity to accelerate your career by learning from their experience, insights, and skills and gain access to HALO's influential global network, leadership experiences, and diverse thinking.
Culture: We love working here and know that you will too. You can expect a positive culture of ingenuity, inclusion, and relentless determination. We push the limits of possibilities and imagination by staying curious, humble, and provocative in order to break through yesterday's limit. Diversity is the source of our creativity and we thrive when each of us contributes to an inclusive culture of respect, dignity, and equity mindset in everything we do. We keep our promise for excellence with an unrelenting commitment to achieving results and supporting one another to stay accountable, transparent, and dependable.
Recognition: You're going to succeed here, and you can count on us to celebrate your wins. Colleagues across the company will join in recognizing your big milestones and nominate you for awards. Over time, you'll earn so much recognition that you can convert into gift cards, trips, concerts, and merchandise at your favorite brands.
Flexibility: Most roles offer hybrid work. In addition, we pride ourselves on flexible schedules that help you find a balance between professional and personal demands. We believe that supporting our customers is the priority and trust that you and your manager will find a schedule to achieve that priority.
Stay well at HALO: At HALO, we have benefits that support all parts of your life and to find a work-life balance custom to you. We offer nationwide coverage for Medical, Dental, Vision, Life and Disability insurance, and additional Voluntary Benefits. Prepare your financial future with our 401K Retirement Savings Plan, Health Savings Accounts (HSA), and Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA).

HALO is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We insist on an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Inclusion is a core value at HALO and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people.

HALO participates in E-Verify. Please see the following notices in English and Spanish for important information: E-Verify Participation and Right to Work.

HALO is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process – including the online application and/or overall selection process – you may email us at hr@halo.com. Please do not use this as an alternative method for general inquiries or status on applications as you will not receive a response. Reasonable requests will be reviewed and responded to on a case-by-case basis.

Join Reynolds Consumer Products …and Drive Your Career across a world of opportunities! We provide amazing job opportunities for growth with competitive salaries and benefits in an exciting, dynamic, fast-paced, and fun workplace environment. If you are looking to build a strong career, we have an opportunity for you! We currently have an opportunity for a Business Analyst - Automation to join our team located at our headquarters in Lake Forest, IL.

Your Role:
As an Business Analyst - Automation, you will play a pivotal role in discovering and assessing new opportunities in the rapidly evolving fields of Automation and Generative Artificial Intelligence. Your responsibilities will encompass gathering and analyzing business requirements, evaluating the return on investment for new initiatives, and overseeing the creation and maintenance of key performance indicators to effectively measure the ongoing impact on our business after implementation. We embrace and accept individual experiences and backgrounds to achieve a diverse and inclusive workplace.

You will have the opportunity to:
Conduct in-depth sessions with Business Process Owners to deeply understand their processes, deriving comprehensive requirements and performing value/feasibility analysis for potential automation and AI enhancements.
Actively interact with the development team lead to facilitate the strategic planning and execution of projects, ensuring alignment with business goals and technological capabilities.
Develop and disseminate business communications and training materials to support effective change management, particularly in transitioning to automation and AI-enhanced processes.
Create and manage key performance indicators to monitor and report on the success and impact of deliverables on a monthly, quarterly, and annual basis.
Lead workshops and webinars to promote and educate the organization about the benefits and applications of automation and generative AI technologies, fostering a culture of innovation and continuous learning.
Regularly assess and report on the continuous business impact of implemented automation and AI solutions, ensuring they align with evolving business strategies and objectives.

You will love it here if...
Are naturally curious and enjoy exploring new technologies and their business applications.
Possess strong analytical skills and can translate complex data into actionable insights.
Value collaboration and excel in communicating with diverse teams to drive project success.
Have a proactive mindset, taking initiative to identify and act on opportunities for improvement.

You Need to Have:
Bachelor’s degree in business, computer science, or a related field.
1-3 years experience required.
Prior professional experience in business analysis, including internships.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong skills in facilitation and requirements gathering.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Icing on the Cake:
Experience or familiarity with Robotic Process Automation (RPA) platforms such as Automation Anywhere and Power Automate.
Knowledge of or experience with Large Language Models like OpenAI's ChatGPT and Anthropic Claude, showcasing an understanding of their capabilities and
applications.

The position is responsible for management and analytic support of all planning, evaluation, measurement and verification (EM&V) activities of energy efficiency programs, will help develop the strategy for energy efficiency programs and measures in the future. The position is highly analytical and will require the individual to blend the application of business, strategic, and design thinking with technology and quantitative / economic modeling methods to enable better data driven decision making. This position is responsible for managing and leading complex analytical projects requiring use of data analysis, data visualization, and statistical modeling techniques. The role will work closely with internal and external stakeholders such as commission staff, independent evaluators, and implementation vendors to accurately plan, evaluate and measure portfolio and program energy savings.

JOB REQUIREMENTS: (Education, Experience, Knowledge, Skills _)_

Education: BA or BS in business, economics, engineering, accounting, mathematics, or related field required.

Preferred: Master’s degree in business, public policy or engineering. Certified Measurement and Verification Professional (CMVP) or Certified Energy Manager (CEM).

Special Skills: • MS Excel and Excel Models, Visual Basic, Power BI, Azure, Statistical Analysis, Database management, MS Access, SQL, or equivalent.

Knowledge of the gas industry (electric a plus); energy efficiency program planning, design, implementation and evaluation, state, and national energy policy.
Regulatory experience, including managing regulatory processes or contributing to regulatory filings.
Knowledge of relevant industry practice and legislation.
Knowledge or experience in Process Excellence / Lean Six Sigma is a plus.

Position Related Experience: 5 years of related experience in energy efficiency evaluation or energy industry related analytical and/or regulatory work.

OR any combination of education and work experience which permits the candidate to meet position work requirements.

MAJOR JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Specify major duties performed by the job and % of time spent on duties.

Evaluation, Measurement and Verification Support and Mgmt.

Manage EM&V studies including procurement of external consulting resources, oversight of study methodologies and execution, management of time and budgets, and review of study results.
Lead a team of contractors, employees and consultants charged with successful evaluation, measurement and verification of residential, commercial, and income qualified EE programs.
Support the Company's EM&V process in regulatory proceedings including filing of testimony and serving as an expert witness in Docketed proceedings.
Manage legal agreements associated with EM&V consultants.
Manage cost effectiveness screening of energy efficiency measures and programs.
Manage planning efforts for EM&V activities associated with new energy efficiency programs, products and services that meet statutory objectives.
Facilitate data delivery to study consultant/market research contractors by interpretation of study data requirements for study managers and data developers.
Analyze, interpret, and report on EMV and cost effectiveness study results, and make related recommendations and manage implementation of recommendations.
Assist in reviewing work products for accuracy.

Program Planning and Analysis

Manage the multi-year and annual strategic planning process; oversee the preparation of efficiency potential assessments; developing planning models, establish targets; and participate in the statewide Planning process.
Plan long term and short-term future energy efficiency programs and services by collaborating with implementation, product development, marketing and external stakeholders; analyzing cost-effectiveness; analyzing large data sets; researching new technologies; incorporating customer or study feedback.
Review innovative research methods and methodologies to be used for EM&V, cost effectiveness, customer and market studies.
Organize large amount of raw data and perform complex statistical analysis. Map forecast and planning data into excel planning models. Generate and perform quality assurance on the planning model inputs and output results for regulatory reporting and presentations.
Participate in regulatory efforts related to energy efficiency approval including stakeholder meetings, technical sessions, hearings, preparing reports or information requests, preparing regulatory filings and plans.
Identify, develop and validate assumptions related to energy efficiency for the various analyses (i.e. economic impacts, fairness, prudency, customer equity, costs, risks, etc.) required for defining the department’s strategic plan and to support the decision making process.

TRM Management 20%

Maintain knowledge of all energy efficiency measures in TRM and have the ability to understand algorithms used and impacts of changes to the energy efficiency programs.
Implement processes to monitor, maintain, and change the TRM, including tracking of annual filings with the ICC.
Coordinate TRM efforts with other utilities and stakeholders including the statewide SAG members.
Responsible for incorporating results from market potential studies, program evaluation results, and research activities as necessary to develop new or modify current TRM measures.
Provide regular reports, analysis, and recommendations of TRM changes and status to energy efficiency program for use in marketing strategies and tactical plans.

Duties Discretion:

%_ _Enter the percentage under the appropriate heading indicating the amount of time spent doing each element.

10% Employee receives clear instructions from supervisor regarding what to do and how to do it.

15% Tasks follow set guidelines or procedures.

25% Employee must consider alternative courses of action and then make a decision after considering the options.

50% Employee has the authority to make significant choices and decisions, without specific guidance or direction from the supervisor.

Explanation: The position does require significant understanding of the industry, and evaluation theory and strategies. Consolidation of changes in EM&V activities, and incorporation into the TRM, and ultimately the planning efforts is key to assure the portfolio constantly adjusts to changing key parameters. There is engagement with many external entities, where key decision making occurs through this role.

Task Complexity:

%_ _Enter the percentage under the appropriate heading indicating the amount of time spent doing each element.

20% Tasks are straight-forward, routine, and often repetitive.

30% Tasks are varied and fairly complex.

50% Assignments are quite varied and highly complex.

Explanation: There is significant acumen required to manage the complexity associated with the coordination and implications of changes that ripple through the entire planning and design systems as a result of evaluation changes annually. This role does require a high degree of attention to detail, and command of policy and implications of changes when negotiating with third parties to identify and minimize changes to the portfolio.

Southern Company Gas provides for the energy needs of over four million U.S. households and businesses. As the largest natural gas-only distribution company in the United States, we're working to ensure that Americans have access to a supply of clean, safe, reliable and affordable natural gas for decades to come. We offer our customers a wide range of energy services under one umbrella: seven regulated utilities as well as non-regulated businesses that offer retail, wholesale and storage services.

Southern Company (NYSE: SO) is a leading energy provider serving 9 million residential and commercial customers across the Southeast and beyond through its family of companies. Providing clean, safe, reliable and affordable energy with excellent service is our mission. The company has electric operating companies in three states, natural gas distribution companies in four states, a competitive generation company, a leading distributed energy infrastructure company with national capabilities, a fiber optics network, and telecommunications services. Through an industry-leading commitment to innovation, resilience, and sustainability, we are taking action to meet our customers’ and communities’ needs while advancing our commitment to net zero emissions by 2050. Our uncompromising values ensure we put the needs of those we serve at the center of everything we do and are the key to our sustained success. We are transforming energy into economic, environmental and social progress for tomorrow. Our corporate culture and hiring practices have earned the company national awards and recognition from numerous organizations, including Forbes, Military Times, DiversityInc, Black Enterprise, J.D. Power, Fortune, Human Rights Campaign and more. To learn more, visit www.southerncompany.com.

Business Analyst
Department: IT, Corporate
Location: Itasca, IL
Type: Full-Time
Summary: The primary goal of the Business Analyst is to continually improve the business management systems with an emphasis on Labware and JDE systems to achieve the proper balance between fulfilling customer needs and meeting business financial objectives. This position will be responsible for identifying and developing solutions and processes within the Labware/JDE arenas that increase the operational efficiencies, productivity, and availability, supporting user teams across multiple divisions and business entities.

The Business Analyst will bring significant experience and a proven track record of adding value through business analysis skills including gap analysis, requirements gathering, functional design, scope management and IT project management.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following.
Contribute to the IT support and implementation process for all divisions of Prinova.
Coordinate efforts of service providers to maximize use of third-party resources.
Identify new options in Labware that will improve Prinova’s internal user experience and increase the effectiveness of the Quality, Regulatory, and Laboratory functions.
Provide key support for JDE processes that directly and indirectly interface with Labware.
Work closely with users to understand their needs and then translate these into actionable plans.
Writes detailed description of user needs, program functions, and process steps required to implement new features.
Develop and support integration functions to support the global Labware/JDE process.
Prepares time and cost estimates for completing projects.
Coordinates work to develop, test, install, and modify programs.
Provides front line user application support.
Prepares process flow diagrams, workflow charts and other visual diagrams in Visio or Excel to specify in detail operations to be performed by equipment and computer programs and operations to be performed by personnel in system.
Supervisory Responsibilities:
None
Qualifications:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Required Education and/or Experience:
Bachelor's degree with 3+ years of experience or equivalent combination of education and experience.
2+ years of experience as a Business Analyst supporting a distribution or manufacturing organization.
2+ years of Labware working knowledge a plus
2+ years of JDE experience in a distribution or manufacturing environment
Working knowledge of Crystal Reports and/or Reports Now a plus
Required Skills/Abilities:
Strong written and verbal communication skills to work with senior management and to regularly train users at all levels of the company in a variety of processes
Strong analytical skills to assess and revise existing business processes
Ability to work as a team member and contribute to the overall success of a team as well as work independently and handle multiple tasks at the same time.
Travel:
Up to 10% travel
Work Conditions & Physical Requirements:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
Work environment is normally in an office setting.
Ability to view a computer screen and type for extended hours
Ability to sit and stand for extended periods of time
Ability to adjust work schedule as business needs require.
Quality/Safety Responsibilities:
All Prinova employees are required to ensure compliance standards with food safety, food defense and food quality. (FDA, ILDPH, FSMA and BRC).
It is the responsibility of each employee to comply with occupational safety and health standards issued under OSHA and to follow all rules, regulations, and procedures established by the Company to ensure that their actions do not impact the health and safety of themselves or others.

Business Intelligence Analyst

Concerto Renal Services is an industry leader in nursing home dialysis. We are a rapidly expanding business with a simple mission: reimagining dialysis care, one community at a time. Our model focuses on ensuring those with end-stage renal disease receive the best possible care through a more convenient, centralized, continuous care model.


Summary/Objective

Concerto Renal Services is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to manage data retrieval and analysis and transform data into insight to productively improve Concerto’s overall business.


Responsibilities:

Collect, interpret, and analyze data to produce finance and market intelligence reports
Design and provide ongoing live-reports utilizing Microsoft Power BI
Proactively deliver insightful, actionable, and accurate financial reporting analysis to key business owners in the organization. Must be able to communicate the information so that others can understand.
Assemble periodic and ad-hoc analysis reports on company operations
Build successful partnership with key internal customers and cross-functional teams
Identify development needs to streamline and improve the operations of Concerto for efficiency and profitability




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree with a major in Business Intelligence, Computer Science, Data Science, Business Administration, Economics, or related major
2-3+ years of consistent work experience specializing in Business Intelligence/Business Analytics
Exceptional communication skills – both written and verbal, as well as strong interpersonal and teamwork skills that fosters a collaborative and continuous improvement environment
Well adept in Microsoft Power BI, Excel, & Word.
Experience utilizing MS SQL and NetSuite, preferred

Why work at Concerto?

Medical, dental, vision, short and long-term disability benefits
401k match of 50% up to 6% of salary
PTO
Paid holidays
Discounts through Nectar
Employer Paid Employee Assistance Program


Other Duties

Eastridge Workforce Solutions is partnering with an electronics contract manufacturer in their search for a Cost Accountant. Develop and maintain the cost accounting system, documents, and records of the organization.

Prepare and complete internal cost audits.

Build estimates of new and proposed product costs.
Perform month-end cost and inventory accounting close, including the posting of journal entries and account reconciliations.
Participate, review, reconcile, research, and ensure weekly completion of cycle count process for materials.
Analyze and recommend costs and cost savings.
Analyze changes in product formulation and product design, raw material, or manufacturing methods to determine effects on cost.
Strong analytical ability to support creation of new tools to help drive operational success.

Excellent report-writing, communication, and IT skills

Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you'll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you'll be responsible for:

Circle is looking for a treasury analyst who will support day-to-day treasury banking operations. You will help to ensure the successes of critical operational functions, including bank accounts, cash flow, AP, internal controls, and wire processing. You will also participate in the development of related processes and help lead projects to ensure alignment with Treasury objectives, as it relates to cash and financial risk management.

What you'll work on:

Supporting corporate treasury needs including accounting, accounts payable, funding, and month-end close support.
Monitoring the settlement of fiat movement across all payment rails for both corporate and customers transactions. Performing reconciliation and troubleshooting payment issues according to process and procedures.
Performing bank account maintenance including signer maintenance, access audits, debit blocks.
Assisting in bank account openings, closings, and regular account maintenance.
Collaborating closely with internal stakeholders to ensure end to end process flows are executed according to regulatory requirements and internal controls/processes, as well as documenting evidence of compliance. Internal stakeholders include Compliance, Customer Care, various Treasury teams, Audit, Accounting, Product, Engineering, etc.
Supporting the relationships with key external payment operations stakeholders at banks and other payment service providers, coordinating and resolving process issues, as well as building new processes as the company and product offerings scale.
Performing day to day reporting needs for the Treasury team including FBAR reporting, cash reporting, report maintenance, automation and other associated reporting needs. Providing insights into spending trends, cash flow analytics, as well as inputs into forecasting processes for Circle.
Developing our internal treasury management system for bank account maintenance and utilization for reporting and cash positioning.

You will aspire to our four core values:

Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.
Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals.
High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards. You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you'll bring to Circle:

2+ years of experience in treasury, banking, payments industry or related field.
Strong work ethic and ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to manage multiple competing priorities.
Established ability to independently organize and analyze data; attention to detail and high level of accuracy.
Experience in core cash and bank management or payments industry preferred.
Experience with treasury management systems; Kyriba experience preferred.
Experience/familiarity with Slack, Apple MacOS and GSuite.

Additional Information:

This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.

Actual starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.

Base Pay Range: $87,500 - $110,000

Annual Bonus Target: 10%

Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.

JOB DESCRIPTION -


Chicago Public Schools (CPS) is one of the largest school districts in the United States, serving over 330,000 students in 600+ schools and employing nearly 36,000 people, most of them teachers. CPS has set ambitious goals to ensure that every student, in every school and every neighborhood, has access to a world-class learning experience that prepares each for success in college, career, and civic life. In order to fulfill this mission, we make three commitments to our students, their families, and all Chicagoans: academic progress, financial stability, and integrity. Six core values are embedded within these commitments – student-centered, whole child, equity, academic excellence, community partnership, and continuous learning.

The Mission and Vision of Nutrition Support Services (NSS) is to support the district’s academic community by providing nutritious and appealing meals with excellent customer service to every student on every school day. Nutrition Support Services serves over 60 million meals to 300,000+ students daily. Nutrition Services Support also works to ensure the CPS school meal program is a well-managed, fiscally sound operation.




Job Summary:

Reporting to the Senior Systems Analyst, the Systems Analyst, NSS is responsible for helping implement, maintain, and support IT and information systems to meet the business needs of our organization and scale as the organization grows. The Systems Analyst, NSS analyzes, creates tests, and develops specifications and requirements for developers and programmers to follow.

The Systems Analyst, NSS will be held accountable for the following responsibilities:

Test, maintain, and monitor computer programs and systems, including coordinating the installation and configuration of information systems and applications, ensuring business needs and user requirements are met.
Communicate with internal and external stakeholders to determine system goals and establish a system to structure and prioritize business requirements.
Conduct regular reviews of systems, generate reports on efficiencies and improvement areas, analyze data, and make recommendations for risk mitigation planning and systems improvement.
Develop system-use guidelines and manuals, as well as facilitate training sessions and workshops on system processes
Define and coordinate the execution of testing procedures, and develop test cases to serve the overall quality assurance process
Collaborate with the Senior Systems Analyst, Project Leads, and vendors to resolve issues and ensure solutions are viable
Support vendors and information systems to meet the business needs of the organization
Develop, analyze, and prioritize requirement specifications as well as document business processes.
Monitor systems health, gather system statistics, and troubleshoot technical issues, including reported errors and alarms
Run ticket reports to ensure tickets are closed out in a timely manner by vendors
Implement best practices for scalability, supportability, ease of maintenance, and system performance
Maintain, modify and/or upgrade existing systems as required to serve new purposes and improve workflow, as well as design new computer systems and frameworks

Specific Responsibilities

Drive tactical support for technology and development for the onsite team
Ensure proper configuration to integrate POS data into enterprise systems
Configure payments, including credit cards and other approved payment methods
Responsible for daily interactions with field operations personnel and system administration processes
Support the team to ensure menu support tickets are tracked and resolved within agreed upon service levels. Handle menu support escalations to ensure they are resolved timely
Perform other duties as required or assigned which are reasonably within the scope of role

In order to be successful and achieve the above responsibilities, the Systems Analyst, NSS must possess the following qualifications:

Education Required:

Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university with major coursework in computer science, information technology and systems, business and public administration, business analysis, technical writing, or a related field
Possession of one or more approved information technology certificates and or completion of other approved technology-related training may substitute for some or all of the required education

Experience Required:

Minimum of 5 years experience in relevant work experience is required
Project management experience is preferred
Experience with procurement procedures or development of RFPs (Request for Proposals) is preferred

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Excellent verbal and written communication skills; capable of communicating, collaborating, presenting to, and building relationships with a wide variety of internal and external stakeholders
Ability to convert IT technical language into Front Line First user-friendly learning
Demonstrate high levels of instructional expertise, integrity, honesty, credibility, and the courage to make difficult yet necessary decisions
Advanced knowledge of principles and practices of project management and workflow analysis
Effective strategic planning capabilities, including the ability to establish long-term vision and goals, and align/manage activities toward goal fulfillment
Knowledge of operations, budget/finance, management and organizational development
Ability to define problems, analyze data, and outline valid conclusions and action steps
Excellent time management skills with the ability to complete assigned tasks on schedule



Conditions of Employment

As a condition of employment with the Chicago Public Schools (CPS), employees are required to:

Establish/Maintain Chicago Residency - Employees are required to live within the geographic boundaries of the City of Chicago within six months of their CPS hire date and maintain residency throughout their employment with the district. The Chicago residency requirement does not apply to temporary/part-time positions, however, all CPS employees must be residents of Illinois.
Be Fully Vaccinated Against COVID-19 - Unless approved for a medical or religious exemption, all employees are required to be up-to-date on COVID-19 vaccinations, including boosters, and to submit proof of vaccination to the district within 30 days of hire. “Up-to-date” on vaccination is defined as being at least two weeks past all primary vaccine doses and any applicable boosters.

JOB DESCRIPTION -


Chicago Public Schools (CPS) is one of the largest school districts in the United States, serving over 340,000 students in 600+ schools and employing nearly 36,000 people, most of them teachers. CPS has set ambitious goals to ensure that every student, in every school and every neighborhood, has access to a world-class learning experience that prepares each for success in college, career, and civic life. In order to fulfill this mission, we make three commitments to our students, their families, and all Chicagoans: academic progress, financial stability, and integrity. Six core values are embedded within these commitments – student-centered, whole child, equity, academic excellence, community partnership, and continuous learning.

The Office of the Controller is responsible for the financial operations of Chicago Public Schools, including Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Payroll, Internal Accounts, and Corporate Accounting. Under the general direction of the Controller, the School Internal Accounts team supports banking for CPS schools with regards to gifts, grants, and donations.

Job Summary:

Reporting to the School Internal Accounts Manager, the Financial Analyst (FA) will be responsible for CPS financial policies, procedures, and processes related to the Central Office and School financial operations and preparing standard monthly financial reports for a designated portfolio of schools using the CPS Internal Accounts Management System.

The Financial Analyst will be held accountable for the following responsibilities:

Analyze financial data in Excel using formulas, data functions, lookups, and pivot tables.
Participates in the compilation and analysis of fiscal data for inclusion in the Comprehensive Annual Financial Report (CAFR)
Analyze financial data and other documentation to determine controls are working as designed
Review and correct financial-related issues related to school internal accounts
Perform finance and accounting related activities in a timely manner
Maintain accurate documentation of financial operations and transactions
Review financial data and reports to determine anomalies and areas for improvement
Streamline existing business processes and develop new processes to support schools and achieve strategic goals for.
Ensure compliance with Governmental Accounting Standards Board (GASB) Standards, Government Finance Officers Association (GFOA) Best Practices and Advisories, U.S. Office of Management and Budget (OMB) Guidance, and other Federal, State and Local regulatory directives.
Analyze and map business processes with flow charting software
Complete special projects and other duties as assigned

In order to be successful and achieve the above responsibilities, the Financial Analyst must possess the following qualifications:

Type of Education Required:

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance or related field
MBA or Certified Public Accountant (CPA) is preferred

Type of Experience Required:

Minimum three (3) years of budget or grants management experience working in education or nonprofit
Previous experience in a Financial, Budget, or Grants Analyst role highly preferred

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Knowledge of financial practices at large organizations
General Knowledge of state and federal laws and regulations related to financial operations General knowledge of financial internal controls
Strong communication skills (speaking - including presentations - listening, and writing)
Ability to use spreadsheets to view data and perform analysis
Proven ability to use ERP applications
Ability to analyze data and document any issues or problems
Able to write basic procedures and policies
Ability to read and understand various policies and procedures
Ability to identify problems and develop recommendations for resolution.



Conditions of Employment

As a condition of employment with the Chicago Public Schools (CPS), employees are required to:

Establish/Maintain Chicago Residency - Employees are required to live within the geographic boundaries of the City of Chicago within six months of their CPS hire date and maintain residency throughout their employment with the district. The Chicago residency requirement does not apply to temporary/part-time positions, however, all CPS employees must be residents of Illinois.
Be Fully Vaccinated Against COVID-19 - Unless approved for a medical or religious exemption, all employees are required to be up-to-date on COVID-19 vaccinations, including boosters, and to submit proof of vaccination to the district within 30 days of hire. “Up-to-date” on vaccination is defined as being at least two weeks past all primary vaccine doses and any applicable boosters. Unvaccinated staff with an approved exemption must submit to weekly testing.

We’re looking for a Workforce Analyst to join our Mission Control team. Mission Control Analysts are responsible for developing and maintaining all of the analytical resources and data tools necessary to enable workforce management of our business. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical and analytical background.



Workforce Analyst Responsibilities:

Leverage design skills to build and maintain complete suite of user-oriented dashboards and meaningful, actionable data visualizations to meet workforce needs of the business
Partner with program managers to define customer personas and their data, insight and reporting requirements
Build relationships & influence constituents from support functions across the company and within the team to act on findings

Combine qualitative findings and other inputs along with data analytics to make comprehensive recommendations
Collaborate effectively with other team members
Demonstrate judgment and discretion when dealing with highly sensitive people data
Demonstrate initiative and strong attention to detail

Job Description:

Applied Systems, Inc., a worldwide leader in insurance technology, is looking for a dedicated and results-driven Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to join our Customer Operations team. In this role, you will primarily focus on partnering with stakeholders in our CX organization to understand and improve our customers’ experience across their journey with Applied, as well as to drive CX-focused business impact. You'll be responsible for leading cross-functional projects, analyzing product and customer data, developing key insights, and presenting findings that drive strategic business decisions. The ideal candidate will have demonstrated strong customer-centric experience in a customer-facing and/or customer operations role within a technology company.


What You’ll Do




Proactively identify opportunities to enhance the customer experience or drive CX-focused business impact, work with management to scope and prioritize, and develop and execute on strategic projects to address them.
Partner with cross-functional teams including Product Operations, CX, and Data/Analytics to optimize product analytics / experience tools, develop product usage insights, and implement data-driven strategies to boost product adoption.
Develop detailed customer journey maps, working with other stakeholders to proactively identify pain points / potential areas of improvement and scope potential solutions.
Project manage complex initiatives, partnering with cross-functional teams to execute projects with a bias to delivering results.
Manage and analyze data to develop customer dashboards, derive key insights about customer behavior, and provide recommendations on potential improvements.
Contribute to the strategic planning of business initiatives based on data-driven customer insights.
Track and report on effectiveness of initiatives and present to stakeholders and management.
Develop, enhance, and maintain effective systems and processes for the customer success team, including churn management.
Create documentation in support of change management and to ensure smooth rollout of multifaceted initiatives.
Other duties as assigned by immediate manager or management team.


What You’ll Need to Succeed


We’re looking for someone who:

Can work hybrid from our Applied Systems Chicago offices.

Your experience should include some or all the following:

Minimum of seven (7) years’ experience in CX operations, consulting, revenue operations, or program management, preferably in a customer-focused role.
Strong analytical skills, with demonstrated ability to organize, analyze, and present information to all levels of the business.
Ability to lead / project manage complex cross-functional initiatives, executing on important initiatives with a focus on incorporating CX best practices and trends.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
Strong PowerPoint and Excel capabilities.
Proficient with Salesforce and product analytics / experience tools (e.g., Amplitude, Pendo).
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Technology, or a related area.
We proudly support and encourage people with military experience, as well as military spouses, to apply.
What You’ll Gain

Benefits from Day One

Health insurance plans, dental, and vision
Wellness incentives
401(k) and/or RRSP retirement savings plans with employer match.

Work-Life Balance

Competitive paid vacation time and a free day for your birthday
Personal/sick time
Paid holidays
Flex Time
Paid parental leave (U.S. candidates)
Volunteer time off

We strive for excellence at every turn to be the best at what we do. We invest in talent, care about our people and are empowered by the results of our work. Job Title: Senior Workday Financial Data Analyst (Adaptive Insights) (Remote)
Job Description:
Job Description:
Progressive Leasing is a leading provider of in-store and e-commerce lease-to-own solutions. As an almost 20+ year old FinTech company that has gone from start-up to industry leader, we know how to innovate, simplify, and value all people. We are a company founded on our grit and we are constantly looking to the future. As an ever-evolving group of entrepreneurs and technologists, we strive to do the right thing period in all aspects of our work. We are a subsidiary of PROG Holdings (NYSE: PRG), an exciting FinTech holding company, with three business segments including Progressive, Vive Financial, and Four, a Buy Now Pay Later (BNPL) platform.

We are currently hiring a Senior Financial Data Analyst to help grow our company and ensure our mission is achieved!

This role is a work from home position and can be performed remotely anywhere in the continental US or in one of our corporate locations in Utah or Arizona.

Employee Value Proposition (EVP): PROG is dedicated to providing people with opportunity; opportunity for inclusive collaboration, opportunity for innovation, and opportunity for development.

WE ARE: A team of financial experts focused on the adherence of reporting and planning our Progressive Leasing’s financial wellness. Progressive Leasing is known for the high-quality assistance that we provide, and we love to continuously pursue excellence and compassion in all that we do! We are dedicated to creating a culture of belonging, inclusion, diversity, and equity in our teams and celebrate each individual contributions and uniqueness.


YOU ARE: As a Senior Financial Data Analyst on the FP&A team, you will play a crucial role in extracting, analyzing, and visualizing financial data to support various business functions. Your expertise with Adaptive Insights, advanced SQL, and data visualization tools such as Tableau Insights will be instrumental in helping our organization make data-driven decisions and achieve its financial goals.

YOUR DAY-TO-DAY:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify data requirements and design solutions for complex financial analyses
Ensure the accuracy and integrity of financial data in the Adaptive Insights system. Implement validation checks and data quality controls to maintain data consistency
Design and architect complex financial models within the Adaptive Insights platform to support the organization's evolving needs. Ensure models are structured logically, incorporating best practices for scalability, efficiency, and ease of maintenance
Develop and implement advanced formulas and calculations within Adaptive Insights, including complex allocation methodologies, driver-based modeling, and custom scripts using the Adaptive Formula Language (AFL). Create formula-driven solutions for intricate financial scenarios
Continuously seek opportunities to enhance financial planning and analysis processes. Streamline workflows, automate repetitive tasks, and optimize the use of the Adaptive Insights platform to increase efficiency
Stay informed about updates and enhancements to the Adaptive Insights platform. Evaluate how new features can improve financial planning processes and lead the implementation of these enhancements when relevant

YOU’LL BRING:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Finance, Economics, Statistics, or a related field
3-5+ years of proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in Finance
A strong foundation in Adaptive Insights, including advanced knowledge of model building, formula writing, and report/dashboard creation. Certification in Adaptive Insights is a plus
Proficiency in data validation, quality control, and data integrity practices, ensuring that financial data remains accurate and reliable
Expertise in data visualization and dashboarding tools, particularly Tableau
Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities, allowing you to address complex financial challenges and propose creative solutions
Strong communication and presentation abilities to convey complex findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Ability to work independently, manage multiple projects, and meet tight deadlines
WE OFFER:
Competitive Compensation
Full Health Benefits; Medical/Dental/Vision/Life Insurance + Paid Parental Leave
Company Matched 401k
Paid Time Off + Paid Holidays + Paid Volunteer Time
Diversity Alliance Resource Groups
Employee Stock Purchase Program
Tuition Reimbursement
Charitable Gift Matching
Job Required Equipment & Services Will Be Provided

Who We Are
The Options Clearing Corporation (OCC) is the world's largest equity derivatives clearing organization. Founded in 1973, OCC is dedicated to promoting stability and market integrity by delivering clearing and settlement services for options, futures and securities lending transactions. As a Systemically Important Financial Market Utility (SIFMU), OCC operates under the jurisdiction of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), the U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC), and the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System. OCC has more than 100 clearing members and provides central counterparty (CCP) clearing and settlement services to 19 exchanges and trading platforms. More information about OCC is available at www.theocc.com.

Senior Business Intelligence Analyst

Context

The shift within Higher Education more from one-time purchases of print textbooks to recurring subscriptions of digital products has generated a wealth of data about our products, customers, opportunities, and sales.

We’re looking for a leader who can take this information and leverage the latest data analytics tools, especially Tableau, to provide insight into the performance of business.

Reporting to the Director of Business Intelligence and sitting within the Strategic Sales Operations wing of US Higher Ed Sales Operations, the Sr Business Intelligence Analyst leads the analyses of the sales pipeline, net sales, subscriptions, and market data across multiple formats, models, and channels.

Responsibilities

Forecasting Mastery: Take the helm in owning all aspects of forecasting seasonal revenue, turning data into a strategic asset for our team.
Collaborative Insight: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing, finance, and product, to deliver accessible and consumable insights into the success of our higher education products.
Dashboard Stewardship: Support the lifecycle of our Tableau dashboards, ensuring they remain up to date with the latest features and capabilities while streamlining and retiring those that are no longer necessary.
Analytical Evolution : Drive the evolution of our analytics capabilities from self-service to predictive and early alert insights into product, sales, and market trends.
Data Integrity Guardian : Manage functional areas of data management, forecasting, contacts, leads, opportunities, dashboards, and reports, ensuring data integrity across our systems.
Strategic Partner: Assist in turning sales data into actionable insights that inform our go=to-market strategy, emphasizing focus areas, maximizing revenue, and preventing revenue leakage.

Essential Skills:

Holistic Business Understanding: Detailed comprehension of the sales business process and the ability to translate business needs into technical specifications.
Communication Prowess: Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex topics and present them thoughtfully to senior leaders.
Tech Savvy: Comfort with navigating the complexity of data across legacy and third-party platforms, ensuring forward momentum while simplifying and standardizing.
Organizational Agility : Strong time-management and organizational skills to balance multiple competing priorities.
Data Expertise: Background with ETL logic, data modeling concepts, and 5+ years of experience in a technical data role.

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, or computer-related program
5+ years of experience in a technical data role, such as analyst, engineer, architect, or scientist 5
5+ years of experience with multiple versions of SQL
5+ years of experience building and maintaining Tableau dashboards

Preferred Skills

Proficiency with Salesforce Sales Cloud (Marketing & Services Clouds a plus)
Proficiency with cloud databases such as Google BigQuery or Snowflake
Experience with machine learning concepts such as predictive modeling, categorization, and clustering
Background with programming in a language such as R or Python
Experience working in or supporting Sales or Revenue Operations a plus

As one of the largest mutual insurance companies in the US, Sentry is committed to offering coverage at a competitive price and provide outstanding service and support. To provide our competitive products, it takes an effective team. We’re currently seeking a highly self-motivated individual to join our commercial lines team as a Product & Compliance Senior Analyst to support the needs of our business stakeholders effectively and efficiently. As a Product & Compliance Senior Analyst, you’ll leverage your organizational and interpersonal skills to affect operations within lines of business while growing your insurance knowledge and ensuring corporate compliance.

This position will be located in a Hybrid work model at either our Home Office in Stevens Point, WI or our office location in Edwardsville, IL and is not a fully remote opportunity.

What You’ll Do

There are three major roles you’ll support as a Product & Compliance Senior Analyst: supporting state insurance products for Sentry’s Commercial lines niches, communicating implementation and availability of new or enhanced products, and participating in projects focused on key improvement initiatives. Within these roles you’ll:

Implement and communicate strategic plans for markets by working with internal partnerships

Conduct market and competitive analyses to take advantage of market opportunities

Create, maintain, and file exhibits and requests with the State for changes to products

Lead filing projects and communicate status to various stakeholders

Work as a team player to analyze markets, data, and trends

Communicate results to the team and management

Senior Financial Systems Analyst
Job Number: 220002GB
Posting Date: Jul 1, 2022, 3:36:25 PM
Primary Location: Central-42 West Madison Street (Accounting)
CPS Non-Union Job Grade: S08


JOB DESCRIPTION -


Chicago Public Schools (CPS) is the third-largest school district in the United States, serving over 330,000 students in 600+ schools and employing nearly 36,000 people, most of them teachers. CPS has set ambitious goals to ensure that every student, in every school and every neighborhood, has access to a world-class learning experience that prepares each for success in college, career, and civic life. In order to fulfill this mission, we make three commitments to our students, their families, and all Chicagoans: academic progress, financial stability, and integrity. Six core values are embedded within these commitments – student-centered, whole child, equity, academic excellence, community partnership, and continuous learning.

The Office of the Controller is responsible for the financial operations of Chicago Public Schools, including Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Payroll, Internal Accounts, and Corporate Accounting. As part of this work, the Accounting Department is made up of Financial Analysts, Accountants, and Financial Systems Analysts who are responsible for providing timely and accurate financial reporting as well as developing and utilizing efficient financial systems.

Job Summary:

Reporting to the Business Process Manager in the Accounting Department, a Senior Financial Systems Analyst is responsible for analyzing and evaluating business requirements, cross-department collaboration, and identifying areas for the development of technical solutions to automate and/or improve business processes for CPS. Additionally, a Senior Financial Systems Analyst will be part of the team that manages systems integration projects, including requirements gathering, systems design, data transformation, data migration, and related business planning as well as providing internal IT advisory and advocate for process improvement and good application design.

The Senior Financial Systems Analyst will be held accountable for the following responsibilities:

Lead the analyses and development of a system of business requirements documents necessary for the District to achieve further systems integrations; this role will include requirements gathering, documentation, planning and reporting on Finance impacted projects and initiatives.
Triage all technical issues relating to financial systems; escalating to appropriate parties as needed.
Provide internal IT advisory and advocate for process improvement and good application design.
Develop trainings, User Performance Kits (UPKs), test scripts, and other technical support documentation to assist with the use, knowledge base, and functionality of Oracle financial modules (Payables, iSupplier, iProcurement, General Ledger (GL), iExpense, etc.), custom CPS modules (Internal Accounting Management System (IAMS), Property Tax, Payments to Contract & Charter Schools (PCCS), Student Transportation, etc.) and other software and systems utilized by the Finance Department.
Provides recommendations on new or enhanced systems, software, upgrades and modifications and advocates for process changes that align with business practices.
Lead business process analyses and business requirements documentation efforts necessary to ensure continuous improvement.
Assist with the implementation and maintenance of financial system processes and procedures related to Oracle financial modules, custom CPS modules (IAMS, Property Tax, PCCS, etc.), Smartsheet, and other software and systems utilized by the Finance Department.
Work with various approved vendors for temporary staffing by assisting various departments with interviewing candidates, on-boarding new team members, and managing the payment approvals and agreements with the staffing agency.
Responsible for updating and maintaining the contents of the Office of the Controller’s webpage.
Additional special projects as assigned by the Office of the Controller which may range from small to larger inter-departmental projects working as a lead or team member.

In order to be successful and achieve the above responsibilities, the Senior Financial Systems Analyst must possess the following qualifications:

Type of Education Required:

Bachelor’s Degree in Business Management, Finance, Management and Information Systems (MIS) or related field.
Project Management Professional (PMP)/Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM) is preferred

Type of Experience Required:

Minimum of five (5) years in a business systems analyst or governmental technology role.
Previous experience in process improvement initiatives and analysis is highly preferred

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Advanced knowledge of Microsoft (or similar) Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Projects, etc. is required
Advanced knowledge of project management tools preferred
Oracle Financial (or similar ERP) software experience is preferred.
Knowledge of Google Docs Editor web-based productivity office suite
Knowledge of project management tools, S/FTP integrations, various Excel-based add-ins
Knowledge of operations, budget/finance, management and organizational development
Ability to build collaborative relationships with a variety of constituent groups, including external partners, to ensure the entire system operates in the most effective manner possible to support schools
Ability to define problems, analyze data, and outline valid conclusions and action steps

Conditions of Employment

As a condition of employment with the Chicago Public Schools (CPS), employees are required to:

Establish/Maintain Chicago Residency - Employees are required to live within the geographic boundaries of the City of Chicago within six months of their CPS hire date and maintain residency throughout their employment with the district. The Chicago residency requirement does not apply to temporary/part-time positions, however, all CPS employees must be residents of Illinois.
Be Fully Vaccinated or Submit to Weekly COVID-19 Testing - Employees are required to be fully vaccinated within 30 days of their hire date. Full vaccination is defined as at least two weeks after your second shot of a two-shot vaccination course, or at least two weeks after a one-shot vaccination course. Unvaccinated staff must submit to weekly testing.

CPS Non-Union Job Grade: S08

Estimated Annual Salary Range: $74,000-95,000

Final salary offers are dependent upon candidate qualifications.
