Job Title: Senior Business Analyst, Trade Promotion Management
Job Description:
Glanbia Business Services
Senior Analyst, Trade Promotion Management

Join this dynamic team focused on delivering better nutrition for every step of life’s journey

The Opportunity
A vacancy has arisen for Sr. Analyst, Trade Promotion Management to help with the implementation and support of a new Trade Promotion Management (TPM) solution using SAP’s TPM product across our Performance Nutrition business. This Sr. Analyst role will sit within the Customer Engagement CoE within Glanbia Business Services.

The Sr. Analyst will partner with Glanbia Performance Nutrition’s Sales/Trade Planning stakeholders, an external Implementation Partner and our internal Glanbia Business Services Teams to help deliver a new TPM solution, new processes and an associated change management program across the GPN business. Subsequent to its rollout in North America the role would involve day-to-day operational support, capability enhancements, and continuous improvement to ensure a best-in-class TPM solution that drives maximum value for the business. The analyst will also be involved in subsequent rollouts of the TPM template across the GPN organisation. The analyst will also be involved in the emerging development of an RGM roadmap and strategy.
Support the implementation and delivery of the initial SAP TPM solution across the GPN business with an initial North America focus. Following its initial go live in North America manage support incidents and enhancement requests on an ongoing basis. Identifying areas of improvements in process and technology, driving continuous improvement and staying abreast of industry and technology trends and best practice. Support enterprise wide SAP Trade Promotion Management Solution. This includes providing functional and technical guidance on SAP’s Trade Management solution. Act as the Business Services solution expert engaging with Business partners in sales planning and sales finance teams to build capabilities. This includes jointly defining business objectives and goals, developing business cases, evaluating current technologies, communicating new technology capabilities, without losing focus on supporting the current system. In time helping to develop and deliver Revenue Growth Management capabilities and an associated technical solution within the GPN business on behalf of Glanbia Business Services. Through expert lens of SAP’s Trade Promotions Solution, act as Glanbia Business Service Subject Matter Expert (SME), providing functional and technical guidance to the business with your strong understanding of SAP TPM. Establish day-to-day operational support for the TPM system that includes supplier management activities, business continuity, and overall service delivery support operations including change, incident, problem, and configuration management in partnership with the implementation partner, internal GBS IT team and business partner teams. Participate in System Integration and User Acceptance testing for the end-to-end TPM processes as part of initial implementation and subsequent change streams. Perform analysis and troubleshooting to resolve issues as and when they arise. Assist with operational tasks such as data validation, bulk data loads, etc. Coordinate with the Implementation Partner, internal GBS teams and relevant business teams to prioritize and implement changes and help to develop associated trade strategies. Create technical design for bug fixes and enhancements and oversee execution with Implementation partner team and or our Internal IT teams across analytics, programming, supply chain and finance CoE’s. Work collaboratively with business strategists, process owners and subject matter experts. Coordinate with architecture, technical, and our Basis teams to manage application lifecycle. Provide input for the SAP TPM solution road map, integrating multiple disparate processes, and addressing short / long-term organizational needs Acts as a disruptive change agent fluidly moving back and forth between transformation initiatives and day-to-day business as usual. Delivers right mix of operations, delivery, strategy and innovation. Listens for reflection; partners with business and functions to deliver outcomes. Utilize knowledge of defined reference architectures, technology trends and implementation experience to translate business requirements into a system and landscape solution blueprint that represents an end-to-end technical solution.

The Skills you will bring to the team
Bachelor’s in a STEM or relevant business degree / experience. 3 - 5 Years of trade promotion technology implementation experience, preferably within a large CPG company or consulting organization servicing CPG companies. Experience to alternative Trade Promotion platforms will also be considered 3 - 5 years of experience with SAP TPM solution OR industry equivalent platforms having being involved in at least one and optimally multiple trade management solution rollouts 3 - 5 years of experience with related SAP products with emphasis on SAP CRM / TPM, SAP SD, SAP FI, SAP BW and SAC Integration experience of the components utilised by SAP in their TPM solution would be beneficial Demonstrate knowledge of and success in applying extensive understanding of the SAP TPM and BW planning solutions in a CPG business. Technical domain knowledge including a broad understanding and working knowledge of IT including all major functions. Must be up to date with SAP trends such as BW4/HANA, SAC, RGM and general industry trends and technology advancements including big data capabilities and advanced analytics. Multi-year experience in supporting a complex SAP landscape with architecture, design, and deployment experience of major release/project roll-out Strong Trade Promotion experience across a number of companies and experience in the use of trade solutions to generate ROI on trade spend and optimise processes. Strong interpersonal, influencing, negotiation, organization, and communication skills. Ability to manage multiple priorities, meet deadlines and produce quality results under pressure. Strong problem solving and analytical skills. Strong team player, change agent, and advocate. Excellent customer service skills. SAP certification is a plus. CPG experience is a plus. Trade execution experience

If you think you have what it takes, but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please apply!

Where and how you will work
The base location of the role will be North America with a requirement to be onsite in Illnois during project phases, with a hybrid working arrangement available through our Smart working model which allows you a greater choice in how you work and live, giving you a better work-life balance.

What we would like to offer you!
The opportunity to develop your career on a global stage, continuous learning through an on-demand learning platform, and a competitive compensation package including staff discounts and a competitive salary.

At Glanbia, we celebrate diversity, because we know that our individual strengths make us stronger together. We welcome and encourage interest from a variety of candidates, we will give your application consideration, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status.

At Meta, Mission Control plays a critical role in driving business success by efficiently integrating financial plans, business priorities, and workforce strategies into operational plans. As trusted partners, Mission Control is committed to seamlessly executing Meta's workforce plans in alignment with the strategies defined by our stakeholders, policy-makers, and executive leadership. The Analytics team collaborates with a variety of XFN partners to develop a data driven strategy to supplement and report on the operational plans. We’re looking for a Workforce Analyst to join our Mission Control team. Mission Control Analysts are responsible for developing and maintaining all of the analytical resources and data tools necessary to enable workforce management of our business. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical and analytical background.



Workforce Analyst, Mission Control Analytics Responsibilities:

Leverage design skills to build and maintain complete suite of user-oriented dashboards and meaningful, actionable data visualizations to meet workforce needs of the business
Partner with program managers to define customer personas and their data, insight and reporting requirements
Build relationships & influence constituents from support functions across the company and within the team to act on findings
Work with data infrastructure, tooling and process teams to triage data-quality issues and drive long term improvement
Approach and execute ad-hoc data requests creatively, identifying root cause needs and determine when discrete needs should be regular reports or dashboards
Operationalize data migrations across all dashboards and reports, ensuring continuity of service and data alignment across resources
Deploy Better Analytics Engineering principles to maintain team and partner alignment
Perform deep-dive analyses to answer questions and deliver insights on the root causes of issues and make recommendations on how to best monitor and meet them
Present all data and findings in succinct and creative ways using data visualizations for a broad audience
Combine qualitative findings and other inputs along with data analytics to make comprehensive recommendations
Collaborate effectively with other team members
Demonstrate judgment and discretion when dealing with highly sensitive people data
Demonstrate initiative and strong attention to detail
Attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy especially in times of rapid turn-around needs




Minimum Qualifications:

6+ years experience working as a data analyst, or similar role
3+ years experience working in Workforce Planning, Recruiting Analytics or similar function
BS/BA or above in a technical field
3+ years’ experience with spreadsheets, Tableau and/or other reporting/data manipulation tool
Experience with SQL, Python, R, VBA and/or similar programming language
Experience with data management, specifically with validating and auditing data and reports from multiple systems
Communication and presentation skills with experience presenting to senior leadership
Experience with ambiguity and applying creativity to solve problems




Preferred Qualifications:

3+ years experience with SQL (or similar language aimed at querying relational databases)
Experience working in a fast-paced and demanding environment
Experience with data and building things – making cohesive reports and structuring data
Experience merging data sets from disparate sources and report findings in a variety of formats and mediums

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Supports a variety of corporate overhead business units with monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reporting financial systems training and other ad-hoc items

Air Transportation Data Analyst 1: Will demonstrate in-depth functional knowledge of AMC airlift operations and is highly proficient with utilizing GATES applications. An ideal candidate will possess over eight years of experience serving within an Aerial Port, Air Mobility Squadron, Air Transportation Function (ATF), or Contingency Response Wing (CRW) with routine exposure to manual and automated air manifesting procedures, pax service operations, anti-hijacking screening, mishandled baggage processing, and ITV systems to include- but not limited to- GATES, IGC, GDSS, e-APIS, and e-Secure Flight (eSF). An Air Transportation Data Analyst will initially possess a basic understanding of APS/AMS Data Records functions and will be trained to efficiently troubleshoot and/or resolve TWCF reconciliation requirements. An associate's or bachelor's degree is preferred, however, the OTS Team will prioritize logistics experience and/or the attendance of a 2T2/2T0 technical school. Air Transportation (2T2) subject matter expertise and intermediate computer literacy are paramount to promptly resolving manifesting, passenger vetting, workload reporting, and GATES-user issues experienced 24/7 by the global Port Dawg community.


Position Overview

Provide professional and functional subject matter expertise for operational end users in the Remote Manifesting Resolution Center (RMRC) and associated support tools for application functionality, related user productivity (e.g. optimization of workload and application utility) and end user assistance with maximizing In-transit Visibility (ITV) of real world and exercise passenger/cargo operations.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Within the RMRC, the Air Transportation Specialist will:

Maintain cargo/passenger screening and manifesting applications in support of Air Mobility Command (AMC) Aerial Ports and designated USAF operational scenarios/locations where logistics personnel do not have access to automated In-Transit Visibility (ITV) systems
Apply USAF Transportation (2TXXX) and/or global mobility Subject Matter Expertise (SME) to resolve general air manifesting, workload reporting, record keeping, and GATES-user problems experienced by the Air Transportation community
Facilitate overall process improvements for data collection, input, analysis, reconciliation, and record keeping processes for Air Terminal Records and Reporting functions world-wide

Basic Qualifications:

In-depth knowledge of USAF Aerial Port, Air Mobility, (APS/AMS) or Logistic Readiness Squadron (LRS) cargo and passenger movement operations
Proficient using the Global Air Transportation Execution System (GATES)
Familiar with In-Transit Visibility (ITV) systems that support global AMC operations
Skilled with Air Freight automated and manual manifesting requirements
Experience with Passenger Service Operations to include passenger anti-hacking/screening, manifesting, lost baggage, and Customer Identification Codes (CIC)
Knowledgeable of Over/Short Shipment Reports, Monthly Station Traffic Handling Reports, and GATES cargo/passenger queries
Understanding of Customs and Border Protection requirements for flights departing/entering the United States
Basic understanding of Transportation Working Capital Fund (TWCF) and Air transportation billing/reconciliation requirements

Desired Skills:

Familiarity with operations of all or some of the following software applications:

Global Air Transportation Execution System (GATES)

eSecure Flight

This position provides Operations expertise in the preparation, analysis, design, testing and implementation of process designs and improvements. In a Scrum-based environment, the incumbent will represent Operations in Scrum ceremonies and implementation meetings, interact with Technology, business stakeholders, and vendors, provide Operations input, develop user stories and process flows, participate in User Acceptance Testing, and help drive the final solution through Production implementation. A key purpose of this role is to assess and evaluate current state processes and envision more streamlined, automated, and standardized alternatives.

Partner with stakeholders, Product Owners, Scrum Masters, and Architects to define Operations process requirements related to multiple internal and external systems
Lead the analysis of key risk areas in current and proposed Operations processes
Lead and/or design process improvements as part of system implementations and translate them into requirements, epics, features, and stories to support development teams and process owners
Lead the creation of user stories and process flows, process documentation, and training materials
Solicit ideas and feedback from impacted departments and represent these areas in discussions with internal/external implementation teams
Use data analysis and metrics to support prioritization decisions for enhancements, features and new development
Evaluate and test the system throughout the implementation phases
Conduct on-going analysis and monitoring of processes to ensure that desired outcomes are produced
Assess and define change impact (people, process, and technology) related to proposed Operations changes
Determine and support team structure changes as it relates to the definition of roles impacted by process changes
Assist with change management efforts throughout the firm including
Creating a strategy to support adoption of the required changes
Assessing change readiness and identifying key stakeholders
Supporting the design, development, and delivery of communication
Other tasks and duties as assigned

Education: Bachelor's Degree

Proactive, analytical, and problem-solving approach, able to propose resolutions and/or remediation to inefficient processes
Proven ability to self-prioritize, multi-task, and complete assignments within specified timelines

Work closely with senior leadership to design compensation plans based on company goals.

Job Responsibilities:

The Business Analyst will play a pivotal role in transforming the Retail industry and how retailers conduct analytics and generate insights to deliver optimized experiences & personalized value to their shoppers. Delivering simple, easy-to-use insights solutions, like Collaborative Gateways, will be central to how Retailers embed data into their day-to-day decision-making. This role will be responsible for helping Circana develop a portfolio of solutions to help our retail clients achieve these objectives.

The successful candidate will be a highly skilled Business Analyst who is comfortable working in a start-up environment where speed-to-market must be achieved in tandem with game-changing innovation. She/he will be experienced in driving complex, multi-faceted solutions across the vast landscape of Retail channels leveraging diverse, cross-functional teams including Technology, Product Marketing, Commercial Sales, and HR. She/he will be responsible for documenting and constantly improving Circana’s standardized collaborative insight solution across new markets; demonstrating expert-level written and spoken articulation of the business ideas, systems, processes, steps, wire-frames and test-criteria into comprehensive technical requirements that enable our developers to successfully build new solutions. While activities will vary and evolve, the Business Analyst can expect to spend 80% of their time building the requirements associated with the Collaborative Gateway solution. The remaining 20% will be allocated to assisting the Product Manager in developing & delivering impactful project communication that will be used to inform the Senior Leadership team as well as all key stakeholders up to the level of CEO.

Reporting Relationship:




The Gateway Business Analyst will report to the Gateway Product Manager. The Product Management function resides within Circana’s Technology division. The Gateway Product manager reports to the Executive Vice President Global Retail Solutions.




Job Requirements:

Ten or more years of SaaS solution requirements development experience in one or more of the settings below:
Retail insight solution & data experience (Grocery, Drug, Mass, Club, etc.)
Market research supplier with a defined software offering
SaaS solution company (retail-oriented software company preferred)
Category Management function (Category/Brand manager, DMM, CPO)
Expert requirements documentation, organization, and explanation skills required
Business Analysis Certification highly preferred (i.e. IIBA, CBDA, CPOA, etc.)
Knowledge of cloud, hybrid, and on-premise computing concepts (i.e. Azure, Google, etc.)
Knowledge of Data & Database Management concepts (i.e. MongoDB, PostgreSQL, etc.)
Knowledge of BPA & ETL concepts (i.e. Ab-Initio, Apache Airflow, etc.)
Category Management certification preferred (CMA, SIMA)
A flexible approach to communication; able to adapt their message quickly to the appropriate level or function with poise and polish. A history of strong performance at the C-level is a plus
Self-motivated; a healthy sense of impatience; start-up-level urgency
Proven skills to thrive and drive project results in an ambiguous and fast-paced environment; comfort/confidence making decisions with 70% of the facts in-hand
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to articulate complex technical issues in a concise and polished manner to a diverse audience
Ideally, reside in or be willing to relocate to Chicago, Illinois or vicinity
Experience with client facing projects
A Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution. An advanced degree is a plus

SUMMARY:

The Product Information Management (PIM) Data Analyst is responsible for managing and enhancing the quality of product data within the organization's PIM system. This role executes a structured approach to the collection, creation, maintenance and distribution of master product data through product information management. This role is responsible for the integrity of the organization's master product data systems.

JOB DUTIES

Creates, inputs, reviews, approves and distributes product master data using various tools and workflows. Works with vendors and third parties to collect and update data.
Manages data requests in support of business processes, new product sales initiatives, and mergers and acquisitions.
Drives excellence and ensures continuous improvement in quality of data through cleansing and best practices for data construction.
Provides input into the development of PIM data collection templates and workflows.
Works collaboratively as a data steward within teams to ensure clear understanding of business requirements that are managed in concert with PIM data.
Identifies opportunities to gain efficiencies, automate, and improve data quality.
Partners with cross functional stakeholders to support business needs.
Ensures data output feeds are successful, troubleshooting and/or updating as required.
Performs other duties as assigned.

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE

Typically requires a bachelor's degree in business, operations, marketing or a related field and zero (0) to two (2) years of related experience or an equivalent combination.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES

Ability to work in a team environment.
Strong Microsoft Office skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills.
Desire to understand how things work and provide ideas for improvement.
Strong analytical problem solving skills.
Knowledge of workflow management techniques such as Lean Six Sigma, Kanban, etc.
Experience with product information management tools (Stibo, Salsify, inRiver, Oracle, etc).
Experience with data BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, etc.).
Positive attitude.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

LICENSES & CERTIFICATIONS: None required.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY: No Supervisory Responsibility

BUDGET RESPONSIBILITY: No

Payroll Tax Analyst


See What We’re All About


As the fastest growing distributor of foodservice equipment parts, we like to do things a little differently. We believe our team should be like family. Not like a second cousin, twice removed, but more like the family you choose to be with every day. First, you have to demonstrate our core values and keep safety as your #1 priority, that’s key. But we’re also looking for unique enthusiasm, high integrity, courage to embrace change…and if you know a few jokes, that puts you on the top of our list.


Do you have a genius-level knowledge of foodservice equipment parts? If not, no problem! We’re more interested in passionate people with fresh ideas from different backgrounds. That’s what keeps us at the top of our game. We’re proud that our workplace has been recognized for its growth and innovation on the Inc. 5000 list, fifteen years in a row, and the Crain’s Fast 50 list ten times. We are honored to be voted by our Chicagoland team as a Chicago Tribune Top Workplace for four consecutive years in 2020, 2021, 2022, and 2023.


If you’re ready to roll up your sleeves, go above and beyond and put your ambition to work, all while having some fun, let’s chat – Apply Today!


Perks


Parts Town Pride – check out our virtual tour and culture!
Team member appreciation events and recognition programs
Volunteer opportunities
Casual dress code
On-demand pay options: Access your pay as you earn it, to cover unexpected or even everyday expenses
All the traditional benefits like health insurance, 401k/401k match, employee assistance programs and time away – don’t worry, we’ve got you covered.


The Job at a Glance
The Payroll Tax Analyst will ensure our tax compliance across the business. You will support with all things related to payroll tax fillings, communicate with tax agencies, and analyze data through report presentation. Do you consider yourself as a tax nerd and like things in order? Do you feel like rolling up your sleeves for every single tax-related project and just excited by the results you can bring? Let’s do it, keep scrolling!


A Typical Day


Support with full cycle of payroll tax processing including but not limited to setting up, managing, and taking down federal, state, and local agencies taxes.
Ensure accuracy, balancing, and resolving issues for payroll tax fillings.
Generate tax-related reports and analyze tax data to find opportunities for improvement.
Assist with employment-related tax audits.
Partner with human resource team across the business to support with any related calculations to payroll processing, mapping, and chart of accounts.
Prepare and analyze unemployment insurance payroll taxes.
Serve as a point of contact to all tax agencies.
Collaborate on any special projects; evaluate and recommend process changes to increase efficiency.


To Land This Opportunity
You have 5+ years of experience in medium-large scale payroll tax and accounting environment.
You have 2+ years multi-state employment tax experience.
You are proficient in automated payroll systems – bonus points if you worked with Ceridian Dayforce HCM.
You thrive when given multiple projects and are a prioritizing expert.
You demonstrate the capacity to adapt to change in a fast-paced atmosphere and have managed multiple payroll tax processing schedules.
You have experience with multiple state payroll tax laws and know when to check just to be sure.
You’re an all-star communicator who has prompt follow up and are fluent in English (both written and verbal).
You pay close attention to detail, as far as you’re concerned anything worth doing should be done right.
You enjoy working autonomously with limited direction.
You’re a data guru and thrive in excel spreadsheets.
You deep dive to navigate and find the right answers.
You love being on time with decision making – tight timelines and limited information makes no pressure to you, challenge accepted!


About Your Future Team
Our Talent team’s favorite pastimes include corny jokes, Disney themed puzzles and Harry Potter. We like dogs, and we like coffee…a lot (we’ll hear you out on whether Dunkin or Starbucks gets your vote).

The Company is one of North America’s leading sales and marketing agencies specializing in outsourced sales, merchandising, category management and marketing services to manufacturers, suppliers and producers of food products and consumer packaged goods. The Company services a variety of trade channels including grocery, mass merchandise, specialty, convenience, drug, dollar, club, hardware, consumer electronics and home centers. Job Duty

Identify, gather, and write business and functional requirements by breaking features down into user stories

What You’ll Do at BTS

The greatest ideas in the world will die on the vine if not properly implemented. At BTS, we turn our clients’ ideas and strategies into results. We do this by designing customized experiences that drive innovation, alignment, and performance.

As a Business Analyst consultant on the Strategy & Business Modeling team, you’ll work directly with leaders from the world’s leading corporations. You’ll learn their strategies and how their businesses work, and you’ll be shaping the leadership capabilities of their senior management. A BTS consultant also cultivates the skills of thousands of developing leaders across the globe.

A Strategy & Business Modeler (SBMer) is responsible for designing and building the business simulations and models that are the foundation of many BTS experiences. Our excel-based models help leaders at organizations visualize their role in their company’s strategy and understand how their decisions impact organizational performance.

The SBMer is a key member of the BTS consultant team that conducts discovery interviews with client stakeholders, co-creates a design with the client to deliver on their objectives, builds the modeling component of the experience, and delivers, facilitates, and presents the end solution to the client. An SBMer brings specialized knowledge to the BTS team by helping to simplify complex business models, highlighting tradeoffs within the client’s business, and bringing strong business and financial expertise to the team. The SBMer is also expected to be a trusted advisor to the client by co-leading interviews and milestone meetings as well as joining client facilitation teams. ,

There are no industry verticals at BTS, and you will have all the variety you want in your clients and work. You’ll be staffed on multiple projects at one time, across different industries, and with different internal teams.

We feel that regularly working together in the office is the best situation for career development, and so we are not hiring remotely-based employees at this time. However, we have a hybrid work environment where you can work from home a few days a week. As for travel, we do that when we are in front of our clients leading them through BTS experiences and workshops we’ve created. And as we continue getting back to “normal,” you can expect that you’ll travel around 25-30% of the time, going to different cities to facilitate the incredible experiences you’ve designed.

What We’re Looking For

Curiosity. Resourcefulness. A humble and inclusive spirit. These are core attributes of BTS all-stars.

Strong business and financial acumen and a love for problem solving with a structured approach to scoping solutions to those problems. Advanced Excel skills (INDEX/MATCH, Lookups, IF statements) are a must. Modeling skills, as well as experience with programming languages, especially VBA, are big pluses. Backgrounds in engineering, finance, science, math, or economics are well-suited. We have team members from all kinds of backgrounds, work experience, and education. We love diversity and variety.

We do have a few requirements. Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience is needed, as are strong written and verbal communication skills. Willingness to travel as indicated above.

Lastly, we require eligibility to work in the US permanently without sponsorship.

Job Title: SVP of Strategic Insights, Chief Data Officer
Job Description:
Description:

Title: Senior Vice President of Strategic Insights, Chief Data Officer

Employee Status: Full Time-Exempt

Salary: Grade 10

Starts at: $170,500

Reports to: President, Social Impact Accelerator

Matrix Reporting: Chief Financial Officer

Department: Social Impact Accelerator – Strategic Insights

Location: Chicago, IL

Hybrid Remote: In office: T/W | Remote: M/Th/F

Department Function: The Social Impact Accelerator (SIA) develops and implements processes, systems, and structures to facilitate, coordinate, and hold IFF accountable for equity in practice, cross-functional collaboration, innovation, scaling of impact, and systems change. SIA comprises five interdependent functions: Strategic Insights; Strategic Response; Organizational Learning; Sector-Based Strategy; and Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion. Strategic Insights leads IFF’s knowledge gathering and sense-making and stewards a data-informed culture by growing, developing and nurturing IFF’s data assets and supporting data-informed decision making and strategy for IFF, as well as our customers and the communities we serve.

Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion

Partnering to create thriving communities is at the heart of everything we do. We leverage knowledge, capital, and resources to advance equitable and transformational outcomes in under-resourced communities, guided by our commitment to be an inclusive, anti-racist and anti-oppressive institution that honors communities as asset-rich and as experts in their own stories.


Basic Job Function

As a member of the Senior Leadership Team, the Senior Vice President of Strategic Insights, Chief Data Officer (SVP Insights) nurtures a data culture at IFF by leading IFF’s data strategy and mission-driven research, analysis, and insight sharing. As the cultivator of IFF’s data ecosystem, the SVP Insights ensures that IFF’s data systems and data assets meet current needs, but also has value into the future. As the head of IFF’s research consultancy practice, the SVP Insights provides executive oversight of IFF’s research services by offering a range of quantitative and qualitative methodologies and analytic and data visualization tools to deliver actionable insights for our customers and the communities we serve. As the co-leader of IFF’s internal research agenda, the SVP Insights works closely with the Vice President of Organizational Learning (VP Learning) and other senior leadership and cross-functional teams to identify organizational questions, to find the path to addressing and answering those questions with data, and to deliver data-informed insights that enable IFF to make more refined strategic decisions and lead others to do the same.

IFF is looking for candidates with a commitment to the work we do who can demonstrate their creativity, diligence, enthusiasm, growth-mindset, thoughtfulness, and passion to make meaningful change in the areas of economic and racial justice.

Requirements:

Core Responsibilities:

1. Defines IFF’s data strategy to ensure IFF’s data systems and data assets create business value now and into the future.

a. Oversees the development and deployment of IFF’s data ecosystem. Ensures that IFF has the needed people, processes, and information systems to support data collection, ingestion, and storage; data transformation, querying, and processing; data modeling and analysis; and data output and visualization.

b. Leads IFF’s Data Governance Committee to ensure IFF is making needed investments in data management and is committed to data governance as a business responsibility.

Works in close collaboration with IT to guard against intrusion, corruption, and loss of data. Ensures well-rounded data security and protection that complies with data sharing agreements and other data protection regulations. Drives data security awareness across the organization.
Improves and ensures ongoing data quality. Establishes and implements data management standards, guides, processes, and procedures.
Develops policies and practices that ensure robust data documentation and metadata.
Promotes data ethics and data democratization. Leads the charge to eliminate bias in data interpretation, improve data access, encourage data sharing, and eliminate data territorialism.

c. Promotes data literacy by providing strategic oversight of staff training to improve their ability to understand data and to utilize data visualizations, dashboards, reports, and other self-service data tools.

d. Advances IFF’s data and analytics maturity. Leads IFF in moving beyond primarily using data for record keeping, reporting, and descriptive analysis to employing data to understand patterns and trends, support predictive analysis, and drive organizational learning and innovation.

2. Continues to advance and cultivate IFF’s research consulting practice

a. Formulates and executes an annual financial plan, including an annual budget and a marketing strategy, that ensures Strategic Insights can operate in a financially sustainable manner.

b. Develops a strategy for expanding upon IFF’s research service offerings in support of IFF customers and the communities they serve and in alignment with IFF’s mission and theory of change.

c. Ensures and maintains a superior level of customer service through methodological and analytic rigor and delivery of high-quality, actionable data and insights.

d. Prepares and delivers public presentations of research findings as appropriate. Coordinates with External Affairs to promote and disseminate research findings and learnings.

3. In close coordination with the Vice President of Organizational Learning (VP Learning), collaborates with other IFF Departments and regional Executive Directors to develop and implement transformative strategies informed by data and analysis through IFF’s internal research agenda.

a. Advances the development and implementation of IFF’s impact measurement and management framework, including supporting the development and continued refinement of business line process and outcome metrics

b. Along with the VP Learning, co-leads a cross-functional team of researchers and analysts to develop and implement an ongoing approach to capture business questions across IFF and design and implement the appropriate methodology/analysis to provide actionable data and insights in support of IFF business objectives.

c. Along with the VP Learning, co-leads a cross-functional team of researchers and analysts to develop and implement an ongoing approach to capture business questions across IFF and design and implement the appropriate methodology/analysis to provide actionable data and insights in support of IFF business objectives.

4. Provides leadership and direction for Strategic Insights that ensures sustainable operation and growth to effectively implement and support current and future IFF goals and objectives.

a. Leads a department comprised of data systems, data science, research, and data analysis professionals based in Chicago and serving the entire IFF Midwestern footprint. Supervises assigned staff including selection, recruitment, coaching, staff development and training, in accordance with IFF’s personnel policies.

b. Develops an annual work plan that evaluates and balances resources with workload to ensure adequate staffing capacity.

c. Facilitates a high level of collaboration within Strategic Insights, as well as within the Social Impact Accelerator and IFF overall, through development and application of ways of working that promote role clarity, goal alignment, and accountability.

5. Works in close collaboration with the other functions within the Social Impact Accelerator to drive equity in practice, cross-functional collaboration, innovation, scaling of impact, and systems change.

6. Contributes to thought leadership in the CDFI sector around data-informed strategy and impact measurement. Produces white papers and other written communications using IFF data and experience.

7. Coordinates with Resource Development to develop and implement a fundraising strategy for both internal and external projects.

8. Demonstrates a commitment to equity, diversity, and inclusion. Promotes an environment of empathy and respect, ensures the inclusion of all team members, and will actively engage in EDI events and learning opportunities.

9. Perform other projects as assigned.


Performance Measures:

1. Meets or exceeds department goals as established in annual department work plan.

2. Ensures that Strategic Insights financial objectives are met on an annual basis.

3. Upholds highest data governance and security standards and ensures that management of IFFs data, most importantly but not limited to its financial data, meets standards required by Auditors, rating agencies, data sharing agreements, etc.

4. Upholds highest standards of excellence in work products including research proposals, reports, and presentations, and oral presentations.

5. Maintains high level of customer satisfaction and excellent relationships with nonprofit partners, funders, and other key community stakeholders.

6. Cultivates a culture of openness in information sharing. Encourages open communication, cooperation, and the sharing of knowledge.

7. Models personal accountability that promotes ownership and engagement.

8. Builds and maintains effective working relationships with colleagues, peers and team members.

9. Values and supports differences in others, contributing to an inclusive work environment. Demonstrates the ability and willingness to communicate effectively with people of diverse backgrounds and experiences to create a collaborative, collegial, and caring community.

10. High level of satisfaction with both internal colleagues and external contacts.


Position Qualifications:

Education: Minimum of a master’s degree in social science, research and evaluation methodology, public affairs, community development, public administration, applied statistics, data science, business analytics, or a related field.

Previous Experience:

Minimum of fifteen years of applied research and/or data science and analytics experience, with an emphasis on outcomes/community impact/social impact measurement, program evaluation/business performance analysis, and/or government performance management/audit and program review.

Additional Requirements: Regular travel throughout the Midwest region and periodic travel nationally; occasional evening and weekend work.

Job Description

About the role:

Plasma-derived therapies are critical, life-saving medicines, which patients with rare and complex diseases around the world rely on every day. Global demand for these therapies, particularly immunoglobulins, has increased dramatically over the last 15 years, and continues to grow. Takeda is established as second largest provider of plasma-derived therapies (PDT) globally. Leveraging on 75+ year pioneering legacy, Takeda believes there is tremendous potential to do more to meet expectations of patients and health care providers with plasma-derived therapies for patients with immunologic, hematologic, autoimmune and other complex diseases.

PDT’s mission is to transform the lives of patients through innovation and sustainability from plasma donation to delivery of holistic plasma-derived therapeutic solutions. Data Digital & Technology (DDT) is a trusted PDT partner, transforming donor experience and patient lives through innovation and excellence. You will lead Plasma Derived Therapies (PDT) data strategy, data management and analytics for all PDT functions including BioLife Operations, Marketing, Supply Chain, R&D. You will be based in our Bannockburn, IL office and will report to Head of Data, Analytics, and Digital Architecture.

How you will contribute:

Build PDT Data Acquisition and Business Intelligence strategies supporting multiple operating models, including self-service and full-service analytics

Lead a team of experienced professionals within Data Digital & Technology, with a focus on providing data-driven insights and partnering with PDT strategic business units and multiple stakeholders in business decision-making

Apply latest technology (i.e., generative AI) to create new business capabilities, enhance decision support solutions, and sustain performance

Oversee multiple parallel projects, including quantitative or qualitative analyses addressing business issues, development of dashboards and reports, and research on competitor data and industry trends to remain current

Oversee all aspects of delivering analytics solutions for the business, including descriptive/diagnostic/predictive/prescriptive analytics and decision support solutions to influence and grow the business intelligence practice

Manage Systems Integration, Data Pipelines, Data Ops, and ML Ops specific to our requirements (real-time and batch, push and pull) and related governance, security, integrity and consistency to support both operational and analytical use cases

Develop tangible data solutions with measurable return on investment/metrics using the Agile methodology

Collaborate with Global Data, Digital, and Technology stakeholder groups, Privacy Office, and other related teams to ensure adherence to established analytic solution standards, data security, and protocol, and to identify best practices for data usage and data democratization

Minimum Requirements/Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science, or related field

7+ years of experience in Data, Analytics, Business Intelligence with at least 3+ years in a leadership role

Background in data visualization, storytelling, and analytics solutions, including dimensional data models (i.e., Snowflake, Star-Schema)

Knowledge of modern programming tools, Python, R, and familiarity with LLM, AI libraries and frameworks

Experience in modern analytics tools, and frameworks, including AWS technologies, serverless computing, data lake, datamart

Experience understanding customer-centric requirements and transforming them into solutions that address our needs

What Takeda can offer you:

Comprehensive Healthcare: Medical, Dental, and Vision

Financial Planning & Stability: 401(k) with company match and Annual Retirement Contribution Plan

Health & Wellness programs including onsite flu shots and health screenings

Generous time off for vacation and the option to purchase additional vacation days

Community Outreach Programs and company match of charitable contributions

Family Planning Support

Flexible Ways of Working

Tuition reimbursement

More about us:

At Takeda, we are transforming patient care through the development of novel specialty pharmaceuticals and best in class patient support programs. Takeda is a patient-focused company that will inspire and empower you to grow through life-changing work.

Certified as a Global Top Employer, Takeda offers stimulating careers, encourages innovation, and strives for excellence in everything we do. We foster an inclusive, collaborative workplace, in which our teams are united by an unwavering commitment to deliver Better Health and a Brighter Future to people around the world.

This position is currently classified as "hybrid" in accordance with Takeda's Hybrid and Remote Work policy.

As the Senior Compensation Analyst you will be driving impactful efforts to evolve and scale our compensation processes and programs in alignment with our business objectives. This role will be responsible for all of the traditional analyses of a compensation professional in addition to partnering with the broader People Team to strengthen our organizations baseline knowledge of compensation and administer OpenGov’s compensation programs. The successful candidate will be a self-starter who is an analytical thinker, skilled at solving new and unfamiliar problems, and is driven by a desire to meet business needs through a consultative approach for a fast growing organization.

Responsibilities:

Comp Advisor: Provide business relevant compensation solutions and guidance to stakeholders. Includes compensation inquiries and recommendations for new & existing employees by partnering with HRBPs, People Managers, and FP&A to ensure that internal equity/parity, external competitiveness, and budget needs are met. Promote an understanding of OpenGov’s compensation philosophy and practices across all levels of the organization, while building relationships that result in a trusted partnership.
Operationalize at Scale: Scale our processes and tools; you’ll lead a continually effort to operationalize and automate so compensation can scale with our growth.
Data & System Integrity: Maintain integrity of compensation data and systems including internal job architecture, career paths, salary scales and comp ranges aligned with our compensation philosophy.
Benchmarking: Benchmark jobs against external survey providers, and other market intelligence to determine compensation ranges for each position; provide summary reports of job and compensation analyses.
Job Descriptions & Mapping: Prepare and maintain job descriptions for each position; ensure descriptions accurately reflect the work being performed by incumbents and are classified and mapped correctly (FLSA, leveling, etc).
Compensation Programs: Administer our compensation programs such as comp cycles, promotions, goal-setting/scoring, variable pay. To start, you will lead some of these processes and overtime you will have the opportunity to be the project lead on each of our compensation programs.
Training: Create and deploy compensation content and training for HRBPs, Talent Acquisition, Managers, and Employees; topics will span both foundational and complex aspects of compensation and our compensation programs.
Pay Transparency: We are on our journey of pay transparency and you will help us implement processes and mechanisms that drive equitable and fair compensation practices. Your work isn’t just implementing though, you’ll also play a big role in educating our recruiting team, People team, Managers, and Employees as we evolve!
Metrics: Design and build compensation metrics, reports, and tools to inform compensation program decisions and forecast/analyze compensation outcomes.
Culture and Values: Be an advocate and help champion OpenGov’s culture and values.

Requirements and Preferred Experience:

6+ years of experience in compensation, consulting, or related field in a high-growth, fast paced environment required
Experience building compensation programs, managing projects, and scaling processes with company growth
Strong experience with benchmarking roles with external survey providers, required; experience benchmarking against Radford is preferred
Strong analytical and strong Excel/Google Sheet skills are required to analyze data and create meaningful, understandable models and reports; ability to see beyond the numbers to drive sound-decision making
Knowledge of federal, state, and local laws impacting people operations and compensation
Experience working with base pay and incentive plans, required
Experience with global compensation strongly preferred
Bachelor's degree or commensurate experience required, a strong background in data/quantitative analysis such as Finance, Statistics, or Economics preferred
Ability to present and distill complex topics in a concise and meaningful manner to diverse stakeholders
Must be able to independently problem solve and work under pressure in a deadline driven, rapidly changing organization
Ability to exercise judgment and discretion in maintaining confidential and sensitive information
The ability to gain alignment and represent a common point of view across multiple stakeholder

About the Company

Glen-Gery Corporation is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Brickworks Limited. Brickworks Limited (“The Group”) is a large Australian-listed group of companies. The Group has been in operation since the early 1900s, has a market capitalization exceeding A$2.5 billion, and operates across 3 core business segments: Building Products, Land & Development, and Investments. The Group employs more than 2,000 FTE employees and operates nationally across Australia, recently acquiring Glen-Gery Corporation to add operations in the USA.

Founded in 1890, Glen-Gery Corporation is one of the nation’s largest brick manufacturers and operates nine brick manufacturing facilities and one manufactured stone facility. Glen-Gery products are sold nationally through a network of over 500 distributors as well as in Canada.

Provide subject matter expertise for Oracle JDE EnterpriseOne (E1) Sales Order management, Purchase Order management, Inventory, Transportation, and other modules related to retail project team.

Work with IT, business leaders, and end users to implement projects from concept through implementation, resolve issues, and provide ongoing support.
Influences and contributes to process and organizational continuous improvements.

Anticipate, identify, and resolve system and report malfunctions.
Develop and maintain technical documentation of systems and reports.
Ensure adherence to IT best practices, standards, and processes.

Experience with barcodes and barcode scanning technologies if any.
Experience on acting as a business analyst in JDE integration projects including EDI.

Six to Eight years of JD Edwards EnterpriseOne as a functional expert with implementation and support experience.

The Regional Transportation Authority (RTA), located in downtown Chicago, is currently accepting applications to fill the Principal Analyst, Strategic Planning position. The RTA oversees financing, secures funding, and conducts transit planning for the Chicago Transit Authority (CTA), Metra, and Pace (also referred to as the Service Boards). The RTA manages these three Service Boards’ five-year capital programs. Also, to help riders with disabilities and older adults across Cook, DuPage, Kane, Lake, McHenry, and Will counties, the agency issues Reduced Fare and Ride Free permits, assesses eligibility for ADA Paratransit service, and oversees specialized travel training. The RTA offers a competitive benefits package, including flexible work arrangements and a hybrid work environment.


Under the direction of the Manager of Strategic and Corridor Planning, the Principal Analyst, Strategic Planning develops and manages RTA-led regional planning studies of major transportation investments in the Chicago metropolitan area. Develops and implements study scope and approach including program management plans, schedule, and participation. Performs planning and analysis to identify mobility issues and evaluate transportation networks. Assists in the development of policy recommendations and provides guidance and input to senior management on such issues. Directs consultant services in the performance of RTA led studies and provides support and guidance for study committees. Provides technical guidance to external projects led by other agencies and partners. Prepares and presents reports to the RTA Board of Directors, RTA Service Boards, counties, councils of government, and other regional partners/organizations.





Responsibilities include but are not limited to:


1. Develops and maintains a Strategic Asset Management system of regional transit capital assets to model and compare funding scenarios and inform regional investment decisions. Provides for annual asset updates and State of Good Repair assessments.

2. Performs planning and analysis to identify travel patterns and mobility issues and develop and evaluate complex multi-modal transportation networks. Assists in the development of policy recommendations and provides guidance and input to senior management on such issues.

3. Designs and implements transit and travel surveys to update and supplement existing regional resources.

4. Performs annual progress reporting on regional goals and measures of the Regional Transit Strategic Plan and implementing strategies of the Plan. Assists with updating/developing the Plan on a 5-year cycle.

5. Assembles and analyzes data from multiple existing national and regional sources for demographics, travel demand, mode preference and economics to understand travel patterns trends, and transit market characteristics .

6. Develops research projects and partnerships with academic and research institutions to leverage RTA data and research activities to further the understanding of mobility, market conditions and travel behavior .

7. Directs outside consultant services to ensure a high-quality work product and the timely and efficient completion of RTA planning initiatives. Manages consultant contracts, budgets, and payments.

8. Develops extensive written products that include technical documentation of models and tools developed by RTA; documentation of study methodologies, results, and recommendations for published technical reports; and summarized study results for executive and public briefings. Liaisons with other RTA groups and departments as needed for graphic design and other services related to the production of professional documents.

9. Develops and presents materials and ordinances, and study findings to the RTA Board.

10. Represents RTA on inter-agency task forces, advisory committees for new transit services, facilities, and planning studies.

11. Acts in a manner which is consistent with the RTA’s policies, while providing service of the highest level to our customers - both internal and external. Maintains the confidentiality of all information.

12. Performs other duties and assists in special projects as required or assigned to contribute to the effectiveness of the department.





The ideal candidate has the knowledge, skills, and abilities equivalent to a master’s degree in Transportation, Engineering, Urban Planning, Public Policy or a related field, or bachelor’s degree and equivalent work experience.





Other qualifications desired, s hould possess a minimum of five (5) years of progressively responsible experience with: design, manipulation, analysis, and maintenance of databases. Experience in analyzing GTFS and Census data products (e.g., ACS, CTPP, LEHD) required. Ability to code in SQL, Python, SAS/SPSS/R, or VBA required. Proficiency in GIS data editing and analysis required with preference given to candidates having experience using ArcGIS Spatial and Network Analysis tools. Familiarity with travel demand model development, validation and application is required, previous experience with FTA’s STOPS model is a plus. Knowledge of statistics and experience in estimating and interpreting statistical models (regression, time series) are required. Experience communicating results of technical studies in written documents for technical and non-technical audiences also a plus.





The RTA offers a competitive compensation and benefits package. Relocation is not available. For more information about the RTA, visit our website at https://www.rtachicago.org/ .





Salary Minimum to Mid-Point: $78,812.15 to $98,516.00

Candidates can expect salary offers that range from the minimum to the mid-point of the salary range. RTA provides full pay ranges so candidates can consider their growth potential.

About Spark Foundry:

Spark Foundry is a global media agency that exists to bring HEAT – Higher Engagement, Affinity, and Transactions – to brands. By combining flawless media fundamentals with aggressive innovation, Spark inspires consumers to pay more attention, to care more about our clients’ brands, and to buy more products and services from them.

Balancing the nimble spirit of a startup with the powerhouse soul of Publicis Media, Spark Foundry delivers the best of both worlds to a client roster that spans some of the world’s best and most beloved brands and companies. We combine boutique-caliber insights and service with the buying clout and first-look access of a global leader, bringing the heat to challenger brands that want to act like giants, and to giant brands that want to act like challengers.

With a bottom-up culture that celebrates diversity and aims for all voices to be heard, Spark has become a magnet for the industry’s best talent, with one of the best retention rates in the industry. And by applying a whole-person approach to professional and personal development, Spark develops a workforce that is well prepared for today’s challenges, and also poised to create meaningful careers in the years to come.

Because we know that heat arises the intersection of complementary forces, our professionals come from myriad disciplines and backgrounds: data, analytics, and insights, content and creative production, communications and strategy, finance and marketing, and sociology, psychology, and other liberal arts disciplines.

Are you ready to directly impact the lives of first-generation college students and champion economic mobility for all?

About Us

Did you know that only 21% of low income, first-generation students in the U.S. graduate from college within six years? Those who do graduate have a median household income 27% lower than their peers. While there are a multitude of college access programs for high school seniors and job assistance programs for low-wage earners, there are few programs that ensure first-generation students stay in school and build the skills necessary to prepare for long-term careers. This is where America Needs You (ANY) comes in.

ANY fights for economic mobility for ambitious, first-generation college students by providing transformative mentorship and intensive career development. Founded in 2009 and headquartered in New York City, ANY expanded to New Jersey in 2012, Illinois in 2015, and California in 2016, growing from serving 50 students to nearly 600 students annually. In 2021, ANY launched FirstGenU, a new virtual program designed to help 10,000 first-generation college students navigate their careers. Visit www.americaneedsyou.org to learn more.

Position Description

Reporting to the National Director of Program Operations, the Program Data Associate is a critical member of the national ANY Operations team and plays a key role in ensuring the day-to-day effectiveness of data tracking and reporting for our organization. The Associate will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and reporting data on program performance across all ANY initiatives. The position is based in New York City, Northern, NJ or Chicago, IL and is currently hybrid, with occasional in-person attendance required at work-related event/meetings, staff retreats, and local program workshops.

Responsibilities include:

Develop, prepare and submit all ANY program reports on a weekly, monthly and quarterly basis
Prepare customized data reports, visualizations, and presentations for internal and external stakeholders
Ensure all reports, dashboards, and scorecards are accurate, timely and reflect program performance
Collaborate with the national operations team, the COO, and the Salesforce and Data Evaluation Director to ensure that ANY’s program reporting needs are met, and modifications are conducted in a timely manner
Conduct all program surveys and work with sites to understand and follow-up on results
Develop ongoing and as-needed internal and external presentations demonstrating program impact
Support ANY evaluation efforts to measure larger impact made for first-generation college students as well as volunteers
Partner with senior leadership and program staff to establish evaluation priorities for all program areas and the organization overall
Complete routine FirstGenU reports including a weekly gradebook and additional items as needed.
Manage all FirstGenU surveys for enrichment events, individual modules, program completion, program follow-up, and more as needed
Complete accurate evaluations for FirstGenU including evaluations for individual cohorts, for each fiscal year, and more as needed
Manage meetings, follow up, projects, and support the work of the ANY’s Data Committee
Attend Saturday workshops quarterly
Conduct professional development trainings for ANY staff as needed
Maintain regular interaction with our Fellows, Mentor Coaches and staff to evaluate how technology can help with service delivery
Other tasks as assigned

Skills and Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree with at least 2+ years of relevant data reporting experience
Data experience interacting with multiple systems in a related role highly preferred
Salesforce and/or other CRM experience highly preferred
Advanced Excel proficiency required
Strong task and project management skills, including the ability to integrate big picture goals with specific tasks needed to move complex projects forward effectively
Experience with utilizing common data programs for collecting inputs and reporting outputs
Ability to build relationships and create alignment with individuals from a wide range of perspectives and backgrounds
Ability to be creative and engage in proactive system-level problem solving
Microsoft Office proficiency and comfort learning new online systems

To Apply

Please submit a cover letter and resume to jobs@americaneedsyou.org (subject line: Program Data Associate – Last_Name, First_Name). Please note that your application will not be considered without a cover letter. No phone calls please.

Salary is in the low $50K range and commensurate with experience.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

401(k)
Dental insurance
Flexible schedule
Health insurance
Paid time off
Vision insurance

Schedule:

8 hour shift
Day shift
Weekends as needed

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Chicago, IL 60606

About Us

NOCD is the #1 telehealth provider for the treatment of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD). OCD is one of the most severe, prevalent, and misunderstood mental health conditions. NOCD creates access to online therapy for people with OCD through our telehealth platform. In the NOCD app, members can quickly access and schedule live, face-to-face video therapy sessions with our national network of licensed therapists that specialize in Exposure and Response Prevention Therapy (ERP) - considered the "gold standard" in OCD treatment.

At NOCD, we help people reclaim their lives with clinically proven OCD treatment, by removing barriers to OCD care, and reducing the stigma associated with OCD. We're changing the world and need other like-minded individuals to accelerate and expand our efforts.

About the Role:

We're looking for a highly analytical and mission-driven Sr. Lead Data Analyst to join the Analytics team at NOCD. Our team aids decision-making by providing the right data to stakeholders and using it to identify solutions. We are a highly collaborative team working with leaders across the company, so the Sr. Lead Data Analyst should expect to gain experience and exposure with all teams at NOCD. This includes providing advanced analytical support to Finance, Network Operations, Clinical, and Member Services. This role will take the lead in managing and enhancing the clinical measurement platform. The platform captures the clinical progress of all members, quantifying the reduction of symptoms, improvements in quality of life, and measuring the efficiency of our clinical protocol. This role will also support clinical research, clinical publication, and the development of predictive analytics that improve care delivery and member adherence to the clinical protocol.




Role Responsibilities Include:

Develop and maintain analytic models and reporting structures that are used to evaluate and improve clinical healthcare outcomes and operational efficiency
Serve as a data/analytics mentor to internal business departments to increase the analytics acumen of the organization
Meet with NOCD's health plan partners to share the clinical outcomes and utilization data
Work on big pillar strategy and planning projects, including goal setting and tracking, process optimization, and data analytics reporting
Uncover areas within the business to drive process improvements that enhance growth and provide clarity toward execution



Qualifications:

4 - 8 years of experience in consulting, business operations, or product operations in tech, healthcare, or high-growth startups
Strong data modeling skills with experience implementing enhancements in a data warehouse
3+ years experience in Healthcare (with providers, health plans, or as a vendor)
Bachelor's degree in mathematics, computer science, information management, public health, statistics, or equivalent work experience
Excellent data and analytical skills (fluent in SQL and Excel/Google Sheets)
Exceptional data presentation skills (ability to develop presentation and present)
Strong cross-functional project management skills (experience working with finance and software teams preferred)
Strong communication and organizational skills
Mission-driven and a passion for mental health and lowering the cost of healthcare

Job Title: Adobe Customer Journey Analytics Business Analyst
Job Description:
We Are:

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

You Are:

An analytics consultant at heart, with broad knowledge of the digital analytics space and a deep understanding Adobe’s offerings and solutions. Bringing your experience implementing Adobe Customer Journey Analytics (CJA) and/or Adobe Analytics end-to-end solutions for clients, you know what it takes to transform cross-channel datasets into meaningful metrics and visualizations. Working closely with business stakeholders, you’re the go-to person for crafting insightful reports and dashboards that address critical business questions. On top of your technical expertise, you excel at leading project teams in fast paced environments and collaborating effectively with clients and team members at all levels.

The Work:

Lead teams to design, build, and maintain large-scale analytics solutions.

Strategize and implement Adobe Analytics and Customer Journey Analytics solutions together with client Business and Marketing teams, Architects, and Developers.

Work with client stakeholders to determine reporting requirements and KPIs for cross-organizational use cases.

Design and build cross-channel reports in Customer Journey Analytics to derive meaningful and actionable insights from large datasets.

Ensure that Data Governance policies and best practices are implemented and enforced across all systems.

Build and maintain Data Views and Connections in CJA, work closely with AEP Data Engineers to ingest additional data sources.

Provide and evangelize best-in-class documentation and enablement.

Articulate complex ideas in a clear and concise manner, both verbally and in writing.

Exemplify excellent consulting skills, diplomacy, effective messaging, and team mentorship abilities.

Travel may be required for this role. The amount of travel will vary from 0 to 100% depending on business need and client requirements.




What you Need:

A minimum of 3 years of experience implementing an Adobe Experience Cloud analytics product (Adobe Analytics or Customer Journey Analytics) along with Adobe Tags

A minimum of 1 year of hands-on experience working with Adobe Customer Journey Analytics.

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent (12 years) work experience (If an, Associate’s Degree with 6 years of work experience).

Bonus Points If:

Certified in at least 1 Adobe Experience Could product (Customer Journey Analytics, Analytics, Real-Time CDP, Journey Optimizer).

You are proficient in SQL, Python, or an equivalent coding language for data processing and analysis.

You have experience implementing Adobe Real-Time CDP or Adobe Target.

Aon’s Capital Advisory group is seeking to hire a Senior Analyst – Aon Reinsurance Solutions.

We have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Analyst in our Ratings Advisory team. Primary office locations include Boston, Chicago, Minneapolis, New York, Northern New Jersey, and Philadelphia. Remote workstyle is an option but depends on candidate qualifications. About Aon Capital Advisory:
Aon’s Capital Advisory group is a firm-wide joint venture that combines expertise across various Aon disciplines, including Ratings Advisory, Corporate Finance, Analytics and Reinsurance Solutions. The goal of the Capital Advisory group is to provide objective and tailored holistic advice on the capital supporting clients’ business and how it can be optimized and be most efficiently utilized. The Ratings Advisory team provides customized support to clients for all their rating agency needs, including capital modeling, profitability analysis, peer benchmarking, and strategic positioning for the most optimal rating outcome. Job Description and Responsibilities:
The role is client facing and the colleague will interact with both internal Aon Reinsurance client teams as well as clients directly. The role will be focused on Rating Advisory support, where the colleague will be responsible for advising reinsurance clients through rating agency criteria and capital management strategies. Colleague will also be responsible for managing client relationships, providing expertise regarding rating agency criteria, and developing innovative tools and thought leadership research on behalf of clients. Colleague will be expected to work alongside other Capital Advisory functions, at times, such as Corporate Finance (M&A Advisory) and ReSolutions (Structured Reinsurance team), with the goal of growing client relationships.

The individual will work in a team environment on a variety of tasks, including:
Rating Agency Capital Modeling and Analysis – provide analytics and rating advisory support using rating agency capital models and company’s financial statements and forecasts Synthesize Information and Make Recommendations – research and analyze data and client financials through the lens of rating agency criteria; proactively identifying alternative ideas and solutions to meet client goals Support Rating Agency and Board-level objectives – assist senior management in creating presentations and recommendations by developing expertise in rating agency methodologies Establish and Maintain Client Relationships – build internal relationships within Aon and become a direct point of contact for Aon clients Industry Research – track (re)insurance industry trends and translate that information into insights that aid client recommendations Special Projects – participate in special projects and Thought Leadership content to further Aon’s market presence Qualifications: 2-5 years of insurance industry experience Ability to analyze insurance company financial statements Proficient user of Microsoft Excel and Power Point Experience with industry databases (S&P Global Market Intelligence/SNL and/or BestLink) are a plus Knowledge of insurance STAT and GAAP accounting concepts is a plus Bachelor’s Degree ideally in Finance, Economics, Accounting, Business or related major Strong analytical, problem-solving, and project management skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Skills and Experience: Prior experience with data analysis and research concepts Prior experience with rating agency and regulatory capital models is a plus Focused, with strong organizational abilities and attention to detail Good interpersonal skills, client management and communication capabilities Excellent presentation skills with ability to synthesize content from multiple sources Ability to perform under time pressures Self-directed with experience managing multiple, concurrent projects Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional environment How we support our colleagues
In addition to our comprehensive benefits package, we encourage a diverse workforce. Plus, our agile, inclusive environment allows you to manage your wellbeing and work/life balance, ensuring you can be your best self at Aon. Furthermore, all colleagues enjoy two “Global Wellbeing Days” each year, encouraging you to take time to focus on yourself. We offer a variety of working style solutions, but we also recognize that flexibility goes beyond just the place of work... and we are all for it. We call this Smart Working!

Our continuous learning culture inspires and equips you to learn, share and grow, helping you achieve your fullest potential. As a result, at Aon, you are more connected, more relevant, and more valued.

Aon values an innovative, diverse workplace where all colleagues feel empowered to be their authentic selves. Aon is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

Aon provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran, marital, domestic partner status, or other legally protected status.

We welcome applications from all and provide individuals with disabilities with reasonable adjustments to participate in the job application, interview process and to perform essential job functions once onboard. If you would like to learn more about the reasonable accommodations we provide, email ReasonableAccommodations@Aon.com
Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. Pay Transparency Laws:
The salary range for this position (intended for U.S. applicants) is $80,000 to $107,000 annually. The actual salary will vary based on applicant’s education, experience, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity and alignment with market data. The salary may also be adjusted based on applicant’s geographic location.

This position is eligible to participate in one of Aon’s annual incentive plans to receive an annual discretionary bonus in addition to base salary. The amount of any bonus varies and is subject to the terms and conditions of the applicable incentive plan.

Aon offers a comprehensive package of benefits for full-time and regular part-time colleagues, including, but not limited to: a 401(k) savings plan with employer contributions; an employee stock purchase plan; consideration for long-term incentive awards at Aon’s discretion; medical, dental and vision insurance, various types of leaves of absence, paid time off, including 12 paid holidays throughout the calendar year, 15 days of paid vacation per year, paid sick leave as provided under state and local paid sick leave laws, short-term disability and optional long-term disability, health savings account, health care and dependent care reimbursement accounts, employee and dependent life insurance and supplemental life and AD&D insurance; optional personal insurance policies, adoption assistance, tuition assistance, commuter benefits, and an employee assistance program that includes free counseling sessions. Eligibility for benefits is governed by the applicable plan documents and policies.
