AtriCure, Inc. provides innovative technologies for the treatment of Afib and related conditions. Afib affects more than 33 million people worldwide. Electrophysiologists and cardiothoracic surgeons around the globe use AtriCure technologies for the treatment of Afib and reduction of Afib related complications. AtriCure’s Isolator® Synergy™ Ablation System is the first medical device to receive FDA approval for the treatment of persistent Afib. AtriCure’s AtriClip® Left Atrial Appendage Exclusion System products are the most widely sold LAA management devices worldwide. AtriCure’s Hybrid AF™ Therapy is a minimally invasive procedure that provides a lasting solution for long-standing persistent Afib patients. AtriCure’s cryoICE cryoSPHERE® probe is cleared for temporary ablation of peripheral nerves to block pain, providing pain relief in cardiac and thoracic procedures. For more information, visit AtriCure.com or follow us on Twitter @AtriCure.

We foster a culture of inclusion by embracing diverse experiences and individuals where everyone’s authentic self is welcome. We offer supporting programs and resources that provide enriching and equitable opportunities for each person to contribute professionally and personally.

POSITION SUMMARY:
The Senior PLM Business Analyst (BA) will assist the PLM Business Solution Architect to consult and collaborate with business teams to capture and analyze current PLM business practices and systems, assist in architecting future state PLM solutions based on industry best practices enabled by computer-aided design (CAD), PLM and related technologies, and ensure technical alignment with AtriCure’s 3DExperience PLM platform. This role will partner with business stakeholders, Product Owners, SME’s, solution architects, data analysts, solution providers, and support personnel following the Agile framework and delivery. The PLM BA plays a critical role in capturing business, functional, system level requirements and serves as the liaison between the business and the IT development team to ensure the end solution adequately meets all requirements.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE POSITION:

Assist the team in the design of future state PLM solutions (process models enabled by CAD, PLM and related technologies) based on industry best practices and aligned with Dassault ENOVIA 3DExperience PLM platform for the following areas: document management, quality management, advanced product configuration management, change control, managed CAD in PLM, systems engineering and requirements management, risk management (FMEAs), materials management and compliance, and integrations with CRM, ERP, MES, Reporting & Analytics platforms
Collaborate with business’ legacy system owners and IT to define the scope and requirements for migrating legacy PLM and CAD data to the configured 3DExperience application
Assist the team in archiving and retiring legacy systems and associated data
Perform basic mockups, configurations on the Dassault ENOVIA 3DExperience PLM platform to facilitate future state solutioning workshops and align with out-of-the-box capabilities to minimize configuration and customization effort
Work closely with the business Product Owner and PLM Solution Architect to author and refine Agile features and associated user stories with clear and accurate acceptance criteria definition.
Quality Assurance and Incident Resolution: Assist the team through authoring and executing test scripts for verification, validation and capture results. Communicate and help rectify gaps, bugs, missed requirements for the developed solution that are exposed during testing to ensure delivered solution meets all requirements
Assist Project Lead / Scrum Master to keep projects on schedule and hold team accountable to the AtriCure delivery process
Assist with the development of training materials, socializing, and training business users on the future state PLM solution and mitigating solution gaps
Assist in the continuous improvement of AtriCure’s project delivery methodology including implementing improved revision and change control practices for living artifacts (e.g., requirements, source code, technical specifications, test plans & scripts, release packages, etc.)
ADDITIONAL ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE POSITION:

Experience with Continuous Delivery frameworks, Microsoft Azure and DevOps specifically
Familiarity with cloud-based Enterprise Application platforms used to support cross-functional business areas
Proven experience in conducting current state analysis and modeling future state solutions and related tools
Thorough understanding and proven experience with core, out-of-the-box 3DExperience functionality for change control, document management, product configuration management, and managed CAD.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s degree or higher in science, computing technology, or engineering discipline is required.
5+ years of experience working as a BA or comparable role with ENOVIA 3DExperience PLM platform (preferably 2021x or higher) with proven ability to demonstrate 3DExperience capabilities and facilitate requirements gathering workshops
8+ years of experience working with project teams to successfully implement ENOVIA 3DExperience solutions (preferrable) and/or other enterprise PLM package solutions for discrete manufacturers
Ability to interpret, understand and analyze complex legacy business processes, systems, and associated data, model and map to the future state solution
Proven experience in authoring requirements specifications for PLM solutions (features & user stories)
Working experience in an onsite-offshore model and collaborating with developers to meet the project schedule
Proven experience in providing input to quality assurance strategies, authoring, and executing test scripts and playing a significant role in the incident resolution process
Ability to partner across all levels in the organization to initiate, develop and maintain effective working relationships
Understanding of the various application development lifecycles (e.g., Agile, RUP, and Waterfall)
Exceptional communication skills (written and verbal)
Ability to travel 10%
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Excellent understanding of business complexity and project interdependencies
Minimum of two years experience working in the medical devices or health sciences industry supporting and/or providing business-process-enabling technologies
Two years experience using or supporting CAD data management systems – preferably Solidworks
3 years of combined experience working in Agile environment with multiple teams and dependencies in an enterprise organization
Trained or certified Agile Product Owner
Experience w/ using automated testing tools is desirable
OTHER REQUIREMENTS:

Ability to regularly walk, sit, or stand as required
Ability to occasionally bend and push/pull
Ability to occasionally lift up to 10 pounds
Ability to pass pre-employment drug screen and background check
Salary range of $105,500 to $136,500. The pay for the successful candidate will depend on various factors (e.g., qualifications, education, prior experience). You may also be entitled to receive bonus, benefits, and more.

Description:

Want to join a therapy clinic that is NOT managed by a faceless, distant, metrics-driven corporate employer? Want to join a therapy clinic that centers itself around its therapists? Want to work for a company that listens to its clinicians as it designs policies? Want to work for a therapy clinic that values work-life balance, physical and mental health of its employees? Do you want to work for a company where you can see the owners and managers on a daily basis? Do you want to work at a therapy clinic that values the collaboration of ABA with PT / OT / SLP therapists?

If you answered yes to the above, then keep reading about this opportunity at Treehouse Pediatric Therapy!

Treehouse Pediatric Therapy is hiring an enthusiastic, outgoing, and passionate Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) for our growing service of ABA! The candidate must have a positive attitude, be hard-working, and be willing to be the best therapist within themselves. At Treehouse we offer a supportive and collaborative environment. We are a multidisciplinary organization (PT, OT, Speech) that works collaboratively to help make a difference in children’s lives!

Primary Responsibilities

Provide ABA based programming, plans, and services in the clinic, in the home and in school settings

Train new behavior therapists to learn how to provide ABA services

Continue to provide supervision and feedback in a supportive manner to ensure therapist growth and retention

Conduct intake meeting, assessments, re-assessments and behavior plans in a timely manner

Work with the scheduling coordinator to get a team of therapists together for on-going services

Work with parents in a professional, supportive, and clinically impactful manner

Ability to program (and analyze data and make changes) in a way that promotes child growth in a timely manner

Collaborate with internal team, families, clients, and other professionals to provide the best support for clients

Ensure all proper documentation is in the child’s file

Work with the supervising clinician (BCBA) for on-going training and supervision

Provide BT supervision and parent training for ~25 hours per week

Employment Benefits

Supportive team of colleagues

Competitive pay

Opportunity to work in newly built clinic environment

Opportunities for professional development

Exposure to a holistic therapeutic approach in a multidisciplinary team

Requirements:

Board Certified Behavior Analyst

Master’s degree

Excellent oral, listening, communication and self-awareness skills

Self-motivated with the willingness and accountability to exceed client expectations

Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with changing circumstances while maintaining a positive attitude

Excellent organization, planning, prioritization, and time-management skills

Demonstrates positive collaboration with all disciplines

Passion and drive for working with children and their families

Timely response to email and telephone calls

Valid driver’s license, insurance and dependable transportation to travel to clinics, homes and schools as required

Duties:

- Conduct assessments and develop individualized treatment plans for clients with developmental disabilities, particularly children with special needs
- Provide behavioral therapy and interventions to clients, focusing on skill development and behavior management
- Implement behavior plans and strategies to address challenging behaviors and promote positive outcomes
- Collaborate with families, caregivers, and other professionals to ensure consistent implementation of treatment plans
- Collect and analyze data on client progress and adjust treatment strategies as needed
- Provide training and support to parents, teachers, and other individuals involved in the client's care

Requirements:

- Board Certification as a Behavior Analyst (BCBA)
- Experience working with children with special needs, particularly in the field of special education or behavioral therapy
- Strong knowledge of behavioral principles and techniques, including data collection and analysis
- Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, to effectively collaborate with clients, families, and other professionals
- Ability to develop and implement individualized treatment plans based on client needs and goals
- Understanding of autism spectrum disorders and evidence-based interventions for individuals with autism

Company Description

The Autism Center of Sauk Valley provides comprehensive Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy across Sterling, Rock Falls, Dixon, and surrounding areas including direct, one-to-one therapy services, in-depth caregiver training, and consultation services. ABA therapy is a data-driven, evidence-based treatment that is effective in improving social, communication, and adaptive skills while reducing problem behaviors. We are dedicated to providing support and empowering families in helping their children reach new heights.

Role Description

This is a full-time hybrid role for a Board Certified Behavior Analyst. The BCBA will be responsible for providing in-person and telehealth services to clients in addition to collaborating with the interdisciplinary team members, family members, and caregivers. The BCBA will also provide ongoing training for the Registered Behavior Technicians, and gather and analyze data to create and adjust the Individualized Treatment Plan. The BCBA will be based in Dixon, IL, but will also have some flexibility for remote work.

Board Certification in Behavior Analysis (BCBA)
Experience in developing and monitoring Behavioral Intervention Plans
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Collaborative approach and ability to work effectively in a team environment
Experience in ABA-based autism treatment preferred
Ability to supervise Registered Behavior Technicians

Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)

Hope is a clinical, educational, and therapeutic provider for individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities, including Autism Spectrum Disorder. At Hope Autism Clinics, Board Certified Behavior Analysts and other qualified service professionals provide medically necessary Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) services, Speech Language Therapy, autism screenings, and diagnostic evaluations to children with ASD and developmental disabilities from ages 0-18.


Job Summary:

The Board Certified Behavior Analyst develops programming for and supervises evidence-based Applied Behavior Analysis therapy services for individuals with Autism Spectrum Disorder in accordance with ethical guidelines of the Behavior Analysis Certification Board (BACB).


Essential Functions:

Develops treatment and/or behavior intervention plans for individuals with ASD as part of evidence based therapy service provision. Utilizes a variety of assessment tools such as the Verbal Behavior Milestones Assessment and Placement Program, Adaptive Behavior Assessment System to write operationally defined goals and objectives. Meets treatment plan requirements per insurance company and clinic checklist.
Treats problem behavior with a function-based approach. Utilizes teaching procedures based in Applied Behavior Analysis. Does not recommend complimentary or alternative therapies.
Consistently and frequently analyzes data on treatment goals and adjusts teaching procedures and intervention strategies according to data. Collects functional assessment data when appropriate.
Involves the entire family in treatment. Ensures treatment plans include parent goals. Meets with parents regarding progress or provides parent training a minimum of one time per month. Provides in-home consultations and/or parent training sessions when needed.
Supervises and collects treatment fidelity data for Registered Behavior Technicians for a minimum of 5% of the time spent in therapy. Ensures: reliable data collection (90% or above), and maintenance of 90% of above on treatment fidelity checklists, effective use of contingencies of reinforcement, appropriate prompting procedures are implemented and effective use of transfer of stimulus control procedures. Conducts preference and reinforcer assessments as needed.
Provides supervision and data analysis for a minimum of 20% of hours spent in treatment.
Provides supervised field work per BACB guidelines for clinical team members to obtain BCBA or BCaBA credentials.
Maintains BCBA credential by earning continuing education units per BACB guidelines.
Meets timelines for submission of treatment plans or assessments to the Clinic Billing Department. Submits session notes for billing at minimum weekly.
Accepts supervisory feedback and adjusts behavior or practices accordingly.


Marginal Functions:

Assumes responsibility as a mandated reporter concerning incidents of alleged abuse and neglect of individuals served by The Autism Clinic, as outlined in the agency’s policies and procedures.
Performs all other duties as required or assigned.


Working Conditions:

Work is performed in indoor and outdoor settings except in instances of inclement weather. Work may be performed in a clinic setting, client’s home or community setting.


Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Demonstrates a thorough understanding of the principles of ABA.
Strong clinical skill set.
Maintains professional boundaries with colleagues and families.
Sensitive to cultural differences.
Organized and punctual.
Communicates effectively with professionals of different fields of study.
Demonstrates problem solving and flexibility in difficult situations.


Minimum Qualifications:

Master’s Degree in Behavior Analysis and Therapy
Credentialed (and licensed if applicable) as a Board Certified Behavior Analyst
Credentialed or eligible to be credentialed with insurance companies
Has met Supervisor requirements per the BACB


Preferred Qualifications:

At least 2 years of prior experience working with individuals with ASD.


Available Benefits Include:

Paid holidays, sick days, vacation days, and personal days each year.
Health, dental, vision, and life insurance.
Short & long term disability.
Tuition reimbursement & 401(k).
On-site health clinic for covered employees.
